Reviews.Title: “Beyond Impressed !”
Reviews.Author: monique b
Reviews.Content: I have never thought about staying at a hotel in a airport but it was genius ! Having the ability to have a full service Hyatt inside of the airport , great meeting space , roof top pool and great room service made the stay all so perfect for three days . I never had to leave the airport and was right next to airport security when it came to the end of my stay ! I was very impressed with all the staff and they were more then willing to help with our 250 person Room Block without hesitation ! If you are wanting to have a corporate meeting in Orlando without having to leave , Hyatt at Orlando Airport is for you !!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the convenience”
Reviews.Author: dunnrej
Reviews.Content: Somewhat dated. The insitutional and rigid architecture was so extreme as to make it interesting. An overwhelming number of kiddies in the rooftop pool. No hottub or sauna a negative. Decent workout room. Very basic rooms. Dissappointed that there was no coffee available at 5:40 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you have an early flight”
Reviews.Author: PeterBNB
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight booked (6:00 am) and thought this would make life easier in the morning especially since we had to return the rental car. We ended up arriving at 3:00 in the afternoon (2 adults 2 kids) and checked in. We had an inside room. The advantage to an inside room is that you have access to the Airport Wifi which is free. The hotel charges for Internet. Come on Hyatt - nobody charges for wifi anymore!! The outside rooms would not have access to free wifi, but would have an outside balcony instead of a balcony overlooking the airport lobby. Kids spent some time at the pool which is on the 4th level and is outside on the roof. It is done up nicely with foilage and the pool itself is an infinity pool. There is also a seperate area with some tables where you can order food and watch the planes come and go. Our room was about an average size and everything was very well maintained. Beds were very comfortable. We ate at McCoys Bar and Grill at night, Food was good and not overly pricey for a nice hotel. $100 for 4 of us including a couple drinks. Access to the airport shopping and restaurant areas helped pass the time and gives more dining options. But the real value in this hotel is being able to be at the airport check-in in just a few minutes. It was worth the $280.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Located inside Airport Terminal”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone M
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here during November of 2009. Following arriving from the UK it was wonderful to have a hotel actualy located inside the terminal at Orlando Airport. The room was excellent and we were given the option of having a room that overlooked the interior of the terminal or one that looked out over the airport. We chose the later and was very satisfied with the entire hotel. We only stayed the one night before moving on to Clearwater the following day. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel as it is perfect it you don't wish to travel far following arriving at Orlando Airport. We did not eat in the restaurant within the hotel but chose to eat in one of the many restaurants located within the terminal. We will definatly stay here again the next time we fly into Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: usbrowns
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt the Orlando airport is a great place to stay or have business meetings. I highly reccomend this hotel for business or a stay before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “easy”
Reviews.Author: rodneyj1220
Reviews.Content: decided to stay here because of the park and stay deal. We had an early flight so we decided to stay the night. The room was comfortable and service helpful and friendly. Things I liked: Can't get closer, if we had a domestic flight I could have had boarding passes printed and just dropped luggage. The Bellhop will take you luggage to the ticket counter. Nice pool deck with heated pool. Great people watching. Dislikes: It was really loud. People were screaming in the airport and it woke us up. I ordered room service breakfast and never got it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless you are desperate and have to be close to your flight”
Reviews.Author: stephen c
Reviews.Content: I'm on my first night of a 3 night stay. Firstly, the hotel is old. e.g., the phones in the room have the numbers worn off, and the same for the TV remote. Rooms are average but definitely on the older side with things like a wide, comfort chair for the desk. Useless if you want to do any work but OK if you want to take a nap. On top of that, tonight TSA decided to do some drilling in the building housing the hotel and it's reverberating quite loudly in my room. Spoke to the front desk and they said they have no control over the TSA or the noise but that it should be finished by 11pm. Most other hotels seem to be sold out this week or I would move out. Bottom line - stay somewhere else unless you desperately need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Affordable, Convenient Luxury”
Reviews.Author: KarenBrown_CBD
Reviews.Content: We landed at MCO just before midnight and after finding our bags at the furthest carousel from the hotel, we called the Hyatt using the house phone in the luggage area to arrange for a shuttle. The hotel operator informed us that there was no such thing. The hotel was IN the airport, therefore no shuttle. Hauling our considerable amount of luggage the distance after midnight did not make us happy campers. Neither did the "please see the front desk" message we got from the kiosk when we attempted to retrieve our keys after checking in online. Fortunately, these were the only real disappointments with our stay here. The room we were assigned was over-sized and very nicely furnished. The balcony was huge and offered us a great deal of privacy. The bed was comfortable! The bath had a separate shower and tub, and one sink and vanity in the bathroom, another outside, in the foyer area that also housed the coffee maker. We were concerned when going to our rooms that there was a large youth group in house. Even after midnight they were seen in groups, giggling and talking loudly in the hallways. Our bellman assured us that the manager was on top of the situation and we did see security approaching as we were heading to our rooms, but once inside, with the door closed, we heard nothing. No planes, no teens. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: SisuGirl2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 7 year old and 20 month old travelled to Orlando from Edmonton, Alberta, for the purpose of boarding the Disney Magic Cruise Ship the following day at Port Canaveral. We were all beat after having to fly such a long distance with small kids and switch flights in Minneapolis. Never having been to Orlando, we didn't know what to expect. Other than seeing the cleanest airport ever (you cannot buy gum anywhere at the Orlando Int'l Airport because it is considered a cleaning hazard) we were pleasantly surprised and relieved to find the hotel in the airport or the airport in the hotel... No more traveling for the day! The hotel had signs up welcoming Disney cruise patrons and the front desk clerk was very pleasant and courteous. It was about 9:00 p.m. when we checked in but the hotel restaurant was still open and food arrived promptly for the kids. I had the lentil chili and it was fantastic. The room was clean and inviting and had a large balcony which my 7 year old liked watching the planes from (and the brightly painted Disney busses). The hotel is gorgeous and it is designed to give awesome wrap around views of the Orlando airport and the grounds which itself has these beautiful palm tree laden oases surrounding throughout. The hotel and airport gave new, literal meaning to the phrase "pretty as an airport". Highly recommend this hotel (and airport).

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: cjway
Reviews.Content: Very convenient stopover, rooms clean and beds comfortable. Passed some time with kids shopping in the airport stores. Will be taking advantage of this hotel again & again!

Reviews.Title: “Real Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalServicesGuy
Reviews.Content: Never stayed at a more integrated airport hotel. After 3 nights I thought I worked at the airport. Well organized and efficient service. Good bar area - sports bar feel. Multiple screens. Good room service and food. Small but well equipped fitness room. Very pleasant roof top pool area. Great that there is a Recycle bag available in the room. I used it once - it did not get replaced. Could do with a separate bin. Super initiative. If you are being picked or dropping someone off at the hotel by car follow signs for Hyatt Valet and you come in on a lower floor with easy access to the reception area and card access to the upper floors. Easy access to the airport concourse and shops, Starbucks, etc

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RootBeerFan
Reviews.Content: Got a day room here as we had an evening flight. It was perfect! We were able to use the rooftop pool, sit in the sun, have a rest on the huge beds afterwards, enjoy the in-room drinks, get showered and board our flight refreshed. Clean rooms, 2 big comfy beds, enough room for 2 adults and 2 teens. Bell hop was marvellous, we had 6 x 23kg cases and he took them all to the Virgin check in desk for us. I'd do it again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ1996
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay especially if you have a early morning flight out of the airport. Staff was very friendly, room was clean and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Surprising!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiCowgirl07
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Keep in mind its a hotel at an airport - its not a destination! But we loved being part of the airport - you actually take the elevator down to gates! The kids loved this part of it too! The room was very luxurious and looked newly remodeled. Lovely marble bathroom. Remarkably quiet - particularly given it is at an airport - I am a very light sleeper and had no problems. There is a small but very pleasant pool on the roof although we didnt use it because there was a lightning storm. It was so relaxing just to take the elevator to our gate for the morning flight! The food at McCoys was excellent. The room service was excellent. We had lunch there and all had a very enjoyable meal. We then ordered room service dinner as we were late back from our last day at Disney and the room service was also excellent. We would definitely stay here again if we were arriving late or leaving early morning from Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: GatorD39
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at this hotel to make travel easier. We were very comfortable in the room, very clean and quiet. Plenty of room for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel if you are flying into Orlando. It is right at the terminal. We stayed the night before our Disney Cruise vacation. As soon as we collected our bags we checked right into our room. The convenience of not having to take a shuttle or cab to the hotel was awesome. It also allowed us to rise at our leisure, grab breakfast, and catch the Disney Cruise transfer which picks you up in the lower level of the airport/hotel. I did experience 2 problems with this hotel. The first is that the junior suite was an inside corner suite with no natural light and only a small window overlooking the terminal. It made for a dreary room. I would check with the hotel to make sure you get a better location than this. Secondly, we (and other guests as well) found McCoy's restaurant to be so chilly that our food (which was good in taste and quality) turned cold before we could finish. I did ask the waiter to add a couple degrees to the thermostat when we sat down and he stated that he did as he was asked, but I found no difference in the room temperature throughout our dinner. Given this poor level of service and the price you pay for dinner at the hotel, you might just want to visit one of the restaurants in the airport's food court and save yourself from wasting money on a cold dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A+ and kicking myself for not staying upon arrival.”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie529
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms! Clean, comfortable, convenient and such a reasonable rate - I’m kicking myself for not staying upon arrival. Bottom-line, you cannot go wrong from this full service hotel. After vacationing, my husband and I stayed at the Hyatt the night prior to our early morning flight and couldn’t have made a better choice. The room at the HYATT Regency Orlando Int'l Airport was so nice. Wake up call is an actually person who when called to wake us asked if we would like a follow up in fifteen minutes (human snooze button). Breakfast was room service who knocked on the door exactly at the time requested. Steel cut oatmeal and yogurt with fresh black berries was the best eye opener we could have asked for. The room had a lovely ceiling fan which was spotless - no dust (though each room has central air conditioning and heating) I love a ceiling fan. A large glass door opens up to the balcony overlooking the airport terminal (what a view we had). No outside noise in our room -not even a plane taking off. The closet in the room was well, impressive to say the least. Fully stocked with whatever you could need and when opening the double doors, a closet light turns on automatically (nice touch). The bathroom - stocked with all the essentials including a fresh clean bath mat, lighted make up mirror. All fixtures are new and updated with something I would have in my home. Guest rooms are accessible by elevator that requires a room key for guest safety. Two restaurants, large bar with tables, chairs and sofas nicely spread out among the several TV’s to watch a game, shopping at your fingers, beautiful pool and staff to accommodate your needs with a smile. If we would have known the Hyatt was in the airport and as nice as it is, we would have stayed for first two days upon arrival while waiting for additional family to get into town. Pictures to follow soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: daisy20071960
Reviews.Content: Super nice staff, GREAT food, all located right outside the TSA. When taking an early flight, this is the ONLY way to go. Why take a shuttle from a nearby hotel to the airport, when you can stay right outside security! Nice rooms and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Cruising.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoFamilyDenver
Reviews.Content: My family recently took a Disney Cruise. We used airline miles for our flights. I was really pleased at the way this hotel catered to people taking a cruise. I let them know we were taking a cruise the next day and the bell desk took care of our luggage right from our room. We just added the cruise provided ID tags to our luggage and the bell desk took care of the rest. The next time we saw our bags they were just outside our cabin on the Disney Magic. The airport has plenty of places to eat and when we called the front desk they were able to give us a phone number of a pizza place that delivered to the hotel also. Access to the hotel is difficult for the Pizza Delivery company so you have to meet them at the ground level car port. Our kids really enjoyed the pool area. We were not bothered by airport noise. We stayed a night after the cruise also and the concierge was very helpful. We wanted to do something the day we got off of the ship and she gave us several options and even checked us into our Soutwest Airlines flight and got us our A line number. Once we deiced what we wanted to do she set up transportation for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & very convenient”
Reviews.Author: sweetonme
Reviews.Content: Booked here after cancelling at a different hotel with several issues. WOW what a great find. We were traveling with a 15 month old and this was a life saver in the morning to make our flight. Clean, spacious rooms and lovely bathrooms with a huge tub. Sturdy cribs for the baby with clean sheets and a blanket. In room fridge for milk storage and snacks. Wonderful front desk clerk, super friendly, happy and genuinely concerned for our needs. Take the elevator downstairs into the airport for a full food court (open at 0430), a 24 hour Starbucks and lots of shops to browse through. We will be staying here with every trip in and out of Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: Ania K
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, conveniently located at the airport terminal. Rooms are quite standard in size, nicelly decorated but no luxury. Quiet despite close location to a busy terminal. Bathroom was nice, quite modern not too big but just enough in size. Some of the rooms have shower/bath and some are only fitted with a shower. Service is really nice and they definitely understand tired travellers. We arrived there at midnight on a delayed flight with no reservation and they made the check in process really fast and smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Overnite stay”
Reviews.Author: fox4ster25
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite prior to traval the next day. Told the clerk at check in this was the first time at a Hyatt hotel. Normally stay at the JW Marriott. Was given a room far from the elevator overlooking a parking lot. Room was clean with the exception of the bed skirt on the window side of the bed. Appeared to be a stain of some sort. The room was large with a large bathroom, however the room and bathroom could have cleaner. There were water stains on the counter in the bathroom and bits of lint on the carpet. With the price of the room (159.00 plus tax) I would have expected more. It was quiet but no wireless Internet available. We dined in the hemisphere restaurant that evening with the food being top notch. The server Sherry was also on top of her game. The meal with wine for myself and my wife well exceeded the hotel room bill, but was worth it. We traval extensively and stay at a variety of hotels. The Hyatt was a disappointment, but the restaurant would have been with the trip itself. Good food, good service. I don't know if I would stay here agin with so many other hotels with shuttles to the airport nearby, but would certainly go back to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: Annbam
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed at this hotel 3 times, each time being the night before an early flight. Despite the hotel being located within the airport, the rooms are quiet (even those with a runway view) and comfortable so ideal when you know you need to get a good night's sleep. This time, the only negative things I would mention is that the housekeeping seemed to have slipped a little - the room was quite dusty, particularly around the TV and bedside units also the glass panel in the bathroom door was covered in child size handprints of what looked like shower gel/suncream - really obvious so not just an easy oversight. Also no matter when you turn up there always seems to be a wait at the receiption desk. The pool is also very cold!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: labs33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had an early morning flight. The hotel was a little on the expensive side but well worth it. We were able to return our rental car the night before and didn't have to get up until 2 1/2 hours before our flight. We even checked in for our flight and got rid of our big luggage then went back up to our room to relax before we went to the gate. Very nice room with a balcony and very quiet. Bathroom was really nice with plenty of space.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick06032011
Reviews.Content: Hyatt at Orlando airport is convenient hotel with easy access to airport, all variety of food(including hotel restaurants), and easy to taxi or limo to Disney & other area attractions. Large nice balconies overlooking airport. Pool & fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Best Convenience for a Morning Flight”
Reviews.Author: CSB_Edina
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here on the Friday before Easter to have a relaxing night before a morning flight to return home, and I have concluded that staying at an airport hotel should be considered a best practice for families. Our stay at the Orlando Airport Hyatt was very relaxing and convenient. The property was clean, comfortable, updated and staffed with top-notch guest centric staff. I have stayed at a lot of Hyatts over time and have found their system to be very inconsistent in quality-service-cleanliness from hotel to hotel, but this one is a good one (other great picks are Gainey Ranch in AZ and the one on Poipu Beach Kauai - the best in my opinion). When I arrived in the Orlando airport I stopped at the Hyatt front desk and made my reservation for the following week's night before my departure. The front desk staff member was very nice, but lacking in some training on making reservations (she probably does mainly check-ins). Her colleague helped her and I was assured that a room with two double beds was being reserved. Upon check-in, I was told that my reservation was for a king bed room and that there were no doubles available in the hotel. I explained to the front desk person that with four people it was unacceptable, that I was told that a double had been reserved and I could not understand why/how this happened. She was pleasant and offered a larger room with a sofa bed and the option to bring a rollaway into the room ... all at a 70% room rate premium to what I had reserved. I told her that I would take the room, but it would need to be at the original rate that was listed in my reservation. To my delight, she was empowered to say "yes" and she made the change. The rest of the check-in process was very expedient and were quickly in our room. The room was very spacious and well-appointed. Within minutes, a knock at the door and the rollaway appeared. I called down to room service to order a bottle of wine (by the way, their wine selection could use a make-over) and was told it could take up to 40 minutes to receive. Once again, they over-delivered and the wine showed-up in less than ten minutes. Each time we interacted with a Hyatt employee we were treated with respect and the service was prompt and friendly -- I cannot ask for more. The bed was comfortable and the room was exceptionally sound-proof from the airport ... we did not hear one jet all night. We went to the pool on the sixth floor and it was fine, but there was no hot tub and I think all hotels should have one. The next morning, we had a Starbucks close by in the food and shopping area just outside the hotel entrance and all was good with the world. Seriously, this was probably the easiest and least stressful travel morning I have ever had and it causes me to wish that every airport had a hotel in their terminals.

Reviews.Title: “1night stopover”
Reviews.Author: Jakeylad
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from las Vegas so we decided to stay at the Hyatt in the airport, we had seen the hotel many times while flying through Orlando. The room was very comfortable with an inside balcony and a nice bathroom, we had a couple of drinks at the bar which was not really designed for anything other than diners but in saying that, the staff were very welcoming for what I'm sure is just a transit hotel. We had a nice breakfast when it eventually arrived, even though it wasn't very busy we had a very long wait, I think American hotels like to bring you everything you've ordered all at once instead of the cereal first then the rest later which lets your cooked food go even cooler than it already is, so it was just OK!

Reviews.Title: “looks nice and staff are great but...”
Reviews.Author: Mike60817
Reviews.Content: I staid at this hotel while waiting for my wife to fly in to join me after a business trip. The place looks high end and certainly charges mid to high end; but things aren't maintained like a mid to high end place. I noticed cracking plaster and tiles in the bathroom; the sink leaked all over the counter and there was water damage around the shower. I will say the staff was very friendly and responsive and they really did try to be helpful. Overall though the only reason I give them 3 out of 5 was location at the airport and staff; otherwise I would have given them a 2.

Reviews.Title: “This is all about the location......”
Reviews.Author: waltonwanderer
Reviews.Content: We arrived off a delayed Atlantic flight and were delighted to see the hotel just as you get into the terminal building. Check in was pretty smooth and we were told we had been upgraded to two interconnecting rooms from a room with two doubles. However, when we got to the room, one of them was a conference room with a meeting table in it and no bed and it took a bit of time and some help from housekeeping to get the bed revealed (it flipped down from a wooden panel in the wall.) Ok we were tired But for the dollars, for a room booked months in advance the hotel could just have had the bed ready. It had our travellers details for months so I would have hoped for a bit of common sense and service with a 5 year old guest if they wanted to upsell us their onference room.The rooms were standard business fare. A bit tired and grubby. We didn't try any food given th e lobby was just outside and we hit the food court for breakfast. It was my daughter's first ever McDonald's (pancakes) and fruit salad and the grown ups had cereal and coffee but hey ....from the other comments we saved a lot compared with the hotel and we had a walk around. We picked up our hire car earlier than expected and hit the road. This hotel only scores a 4 star because of its unbeatable location. The service was slightly disappointing but you can't beat getting off a plane and being able to walk right to the hotel. The hope was to get our small child to sleep within minutes of landing which is why it was a disappointment not to have a visible bed (who knew we had to feel round the wood panelling?) But it was quiet....

Reviews.Title: “The best airport hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia10
Reviews.Content: My business frequently takes me to the Orlando airport area and I have stayed at many airport inns and hotels. This one is actually right in the airport terminal. It is a little pricey, but WOW, it is so lovely and convenient. And the restaurant, Hemisphere, was wonderful. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Cruisers Dream Stay”
Reviews.Author: kj26mom
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great place to stay the night before we went on our Disney Cruise and WDW vacation. We hadn't been in the area before and received a few recommendations with this being one of them. I give myself 2 thumbs up and an extra pat on the back for picking this place. The recommendations we received were for this Hyatt and a few at Port Canaveral. The first impression was great. We had a slight, ok, more than slight delay with flights. About 3 hours and didn't even land into Orlando until about 1:30 in the morning. Traveling alone with my 2 young kids, I can't tell you how convenient this place is. Never did I imagine I'd have the layover but to haul luggage and 2 kids through the airport was exhausting. Luckily I didn't have far to go. We got to the check in desk and that went very smooth. No hassles. The check in guy explains how the Disney Cruise luggage stuff works and we went to our room. I must say I was a little hesitant with the price but after seeing the room, it was spectacular. No noise, nothing but peace to sleep. After settling in, we only got about 4 hours sleep. Once we got up and moving about, we headed down for breakfast, again the convenience is awesome. I had to check out and I redeemed a gift voucher? and am pleased to report there were no issues with that either. The whole luggage transition and check-in was beyond easy. In fact, I had expected it to all take a little longer. So Kudos to the Hyatt. You get a lot of referrals from our cruise board and I am planning on returning again. It was a great start to a fabulous vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more convenient”
Reviews.Author: BXC53
Reviews.Content: My stay at the MCO Hyatt was the end of a 10 day business trip. Being able to relax without concern for making the morning flight was great. The room was comfortable and quiet,despite the airport noise. Lots of dining and beverage options both in the hotel and out in the terminal. The pool area was surprisingly nice given the location restrictions. Understandably, it was busy with families well into the evening hours, but this tired business type was eventually able to get a quiet soak. One minor suggestion for the management is to provide more accessible power sockets in the room. In this day of traveling with multiple electronics, having to crawl behind the desk to plug in the laptop was a bit out of date. Al in all a good stay and I'll likely stay again next time I'm in a similar situation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: belleandthebeast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we cruised on the Disney Fantasy. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The staff were friendly, helpful, and just fantastic. The restuarant (McCoy's) was great! Room service for breakfast was a little on the expensive side but other than that, we had a great stay. Your staff should be commended on being the best!

Reviews.Title: “extreme convenience, but good too”
Reviews.Author: teepees
Reviews.Content: To be able to stagger into this oasis of calm right inside the terminal after 8 hours in the air and 2 hours queueing for US immigration is heaven and genius. Why dont other airports have a big hotel stuck in the middle? Check in was efficient and we were soon installed in our spacious ,comfortable and very quiet room. Mc Coys grill did tasty comfort food and good wine at reasonable prices served by very pleasant staff. Sated by all this and thoroughly tired we had a very comfortable night and woke well rested for the drive to the gulf. The convenience alone would make you consider it but they don't rest on their laurels - within the thousands of huge corporate hotels in the world this one is pretty good. No hesitation in recommending before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt after a cruise - well worth the price. Great hotel with great rooms. Got up in the moring went downstairs and directly onto our flight home. Would definetly stay there again. Had a room overlooking the airport with a large balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for a business conference”
Reviews.Author: HiddenHelper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for a business conference from 3-28 to 4-1. I arrived at around 2 PM and was able to check in and get in my room right away, which was nice. Beds and pillows were comfy and the size of the room was adequate. We also had a nice outdoor balcony where we could sit and enjoy the sun. My only complaint was the shower made a weird squealing noise that was quite annoying. Also, on 2 nights when my roommate and I went to get a soda out of the 9th floor vending machine, the machine was completely sold out. Since I was not in Orlando to sightsee and you rarely leave your hotel anyway during a business conference, the location was convenient. We ate at McCoy’s two nights (food was very good and reasonably priced), the Lobby Bar made some nice strong drinks, and you could order off a limited menu (apps were tasty). Another benefit of having a conference here was that we could venture into the airport to get a bite to eat at the food court or sit-down restaurants so there was a wide selection of food and price ranges. I went to the pool area to see it and it looked nice. I saw a bunch of sunbathers but no one in the pool. Overall a good hotel. I can’t imagine you’d want to stay there for a vacation, but for an overnight before or after a flight or for a conference, it is a good choice. Friendly and helpful staff too!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome stay after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: MJH1948
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at the Hyatt, Orlando Hotel. After a long 9 hour flight and luckily a quick sprint through Immigration, we were soon welcomed by a friendly reception agent, given our room keys then off to the pool area where we flopped into a comfortable sunlounger until the sun went down. Absolutely wonderful. We've stayed at this luxury hotel several times over the years and it is still a great place. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. We had a little balcony to get a glimpse of the Floridian landscape. I love to watch the airport comings and goings from that balcony. There is an abundance of comfortable seats in their huge lobby/lounge area. We had a small bit to eat in their McCoys restaurant and then early to bed. Next morning we was up very early, so after a quick coffee in our room we went over to the car rental office to pick up our hire car. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling long haul as it gives you a nice relaxing place to chill out before you start your trip. So much better than picking up a car and heading off when you are tired and jet-lagged.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel inside the airport”
Reviews.Author: braynpayn
Reviews.Content: Our southwest flight arrive around 11 pm at night. We literally rolled our family of seven into the lobby from the gate. It was so convenient. We were able to get room service and get our youngest to sleep minutes from arriving at the gate. The next day we arranged transportation to the Disney cruise. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the convenience of being on the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitravels01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for convinience as the hotel is perfectly situated to drop the rental car off then walk a short distance to the hotel, then another short walk to get ticketed to fly out. The hotel is nicely appointed and the staff we dealt with were all very helpful. Cleanliness was spot on, rooms were well appointed and beds were comfortable. While there is security card access to the lifts, was surprised that there was no room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: CleveRocks
Reviews.Content: We had no choice but to stay here one night due to a flight cancellation. This hotel property made the best of a bad situation. The convenience of its location is obvious, we didn't need to leave the airport. We collected our checked bags and lugged them to the hotel elevator, took it one floor up (to the 4th floor) and checked-in at the front desk. We had a voucher from our airline, and the front desk clerk made it all as easy and quick as I'd ever seen. I didn't need to produce ID or a credit card, we just got our keys lickety-split. The room was clean and comfortable, had a balocny overlooking the bustling airport, and the balcony doors were surprisingly soundproof. We took advantage of the surprisingly good outdoor pool, and the gym (which is important to us) was of the same high quality that we'd come to expect from a Hyatt property, from the new and varied equipment to the mini-fridge with cool towels in it. I hope I never need to stay here again under the same circumstances (a cancelled flight rescheduled for 24 hours later), but if we had to be stuck somewhere, this was a fine place for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and So Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tjg986
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night after getting in late from West Coast. We were going on cruise the next day and wanted to get a good nights rest. The location can't be beat if flying in late as we did. You literally pick up your luggage and walk a few yards to the hotel and up the elevator to your room. The rooms were so quite! You could here nothing. No noise at all. That was amazing. That is our pet peeve, loud people slamming doors coming in at all hours etc. This hotel was right on the runway and you couldn't here a thing. Front desk was pleasant and helpful. We did have the breakfast buffet up on level 9 and as expected it was over priced. We may have just gotten there when a lot of food was picked thru because it wasn't hot. Service wasn't that great but we were getting ready to start our vacation and it didn't bother us too much. We know if we went down into terminal we could have found more selection and cheaper pricing but the convenience of using the same elevator from the night before was perfect for us. The room was spotless and looked freshly remodeled. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at its best and a haven at the airport”
Reviews.Author: pair211
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here many years ago and it was as nice as I remembered it. The carpets are so thick that there is no noise from rolly bags at night!!! This time I had gold passport points so only had to pay taxes etc, so really good value, but not normally cheap! Last time I had an internal room over looking the airport terminal but this time had an external room with balcony so a bit more engine noise but not too bad. I arrived around 18.00 local time but body clock was after midnight and did not want to drive a long way before I "hit the sack". Had a shower and then dinner in the restaurant, wide choice of options from Sushi to the usual American fare, but as you might expect not cheap. After this put my head on the pillow and knew nothing till around 4.00 am, lovely comfortable bed and quilt. Dozzed until breakfast time which was on the 9th Floor with a lovely view of the runway etc. This was free as I opted for an executive room upgarde for $19, well worth it as it paid for breakfast, if there were two of you that would be great value. Lovely soft towels and eveything spotlessly clean as you expect from the Hyatt brand. You can't get much better than this for an airport hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: engteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the night before leaving on our cruise. The fact that the hotel is right in the airport terminal was more than convenient as we landed late at night with a cranky child. The room was very nice and clean and the staff helpful. They even took care of our luggage for us the following morning. We left them in the room and say them again in our cabin on the ship. We would definitely stay there again if leaving on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location OK Overall”
Reviews.Author: ifly737
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for the month of February for work. The hotel is in a good location for travelers and even to theme parks. The rooms are fine. The inside rooms facing the airport lobby are novel for about two nights and are then just noisy. The hotel easily filled my request for an outside room. The room smelled and after three nights I was switched to another room down the hall, which also smelled of some sort of sewer gas. Every morning my room was coated in some sort of white dust. I live in AZ I'm used to dust, this was heavy, the TV remote was covered to the point the numbers were hardly visible. Not impressed with the cleanliness overall.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Cruise”
Reviews.Author: AngiieNewYork
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel very much. Arrived at orlando international the day before our cruise. We arrived at the airport at 9:30am on Thursday morning, our flight was bumped up earlier. Guest Agent Angie was great she searched for an available room for us. Lucky for us she found one and we were able to check in at that time. Which was awsome since the kids had been up since 3am that morning. Getting to the airport that early we were afraid that we were not going to be able to check in. The hotel was great everyone was curtious and helpful. We checked in as Disney cruisers and were given a form to fill out for the next morning so that our luggage can be picked up and taken to the ship. Great don't have to get on the ship with luggage. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel to all cruisers who fly in the day before.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is, a hotel in an airport, with small quiet rooms & not the normal amenities Hyatt usually offets.”
Reviews.Author: Raymond Q
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient for late or early flights out of MCO. The pool was way to cold to get into...but as nice as it can be in an airport! Definetly not a place for long stays!

Reviews.Title: “close,convenient,cost effective”
Reviews.Author: forkcreek
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you need a flight out of Orlando airport. It is right in the terminal, so you check out, go down an escalator (or elevator) and you are in the airport terminal. A hotel employee will carry your luggage directly to the appropriate ticket counter. The hotel itself is functionaly pretty, rooms are very clean and well appointed, bedding is excellent and bath facilities top notch. For something to eat, there is either the hotel restaurants ( which we did not try) and the airport food court. By the way, the rental vcar return/pick up is part of the same complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in main MCO terminal”
Reviews.Author: Lorax001
Reviews.Content: We had a late arrival and booked the rental car for the next day. Staying at the Hyatt was a perfect solution for us, as we had two young children tired from a long day of travel. My wife checked in while I collected the luggage from the nearby baggage claim. This is a first class hotel with first class service and amenities. The room was spotless though it was a bit of a walk to get to our room, we needed to stretch our legs and was good for the kids to move after a couple long flights. Our room had a balcony looking into the main terminal, though little natural light there was definately a cool factor - especially with the kids. Had a great rest before starting our Disney famiy facation.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant walk-in for the weary traveller”
Reviews.Author: taarhaug
Reviews.Content: After being in Transit for nearly 18 hours, walking straight into the Hyatt front desk from the terminal was really convenient. Very fast check-in was appreciable although probably to be expected at 00:30. The room was large, and the bed very comfortable. My business package had breakfast (excellent food quality) and a bottle of water included. The water pressure in the shower could have been better, but overall excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “In airport hotel Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SANDRA E
Reviews.Content: As our flight was arriving late on we did not want to pick up the hire car and drive to our destination so decided to stay at this hotel. It was a wise move, after a 9 hour flight we didn't realise how tired we were! Check-in was smooth and trouble free, the Receptionist was very helpful, even taking us to the lifts with our bags. This is a vast hotel and finding your room does take a little doing, but when there you will be pleased as it is beautifully clean, lots of space, a great comfortable beds and pillows with a very nice bathroom. The veranda overlooked the airport lobby with a fantastic view. We showered, had a rest and went to eat out, later we then visited McCoys Bar for a couple of cold beers which were served with some nuts. Barman told us to sit and the waitress came over straight away, very nice lady, lots of smiles. We didn't visit the pool, however it looked excellent. My only small complaint was 4 dollars for a tiny bottle of water in the bedroom, although the price we paid for the room was excellent! All in all a very good stay, very convenient and we would stay here again and recomend it to friends no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Still my top choice when flying out of MCO”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraBunny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times over the years when I have an early flight out of MCO since it's literally IN the airport. The quality and consistency are still there, and the web check-in and kiosk for keys make it quick and easy to check in and get into a room. The TSA security lines here in Orlando are among the worst in the country for waiting time (20-30 minutes early AM), so for an early flight a stay here means a bit more sleep before having to queue up for screening. I had dinner at McCoy's this time, and although a bit pricey, the service and food quality was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessLCH
Reviews.Content: This could not be any more convenient for an airport hotel...right IN the terminal! We were upgraded from a Junior Suite to a huge 2 bedroom suite. We stayed here for one night before a Disney Cruise. The hotel offers complimentary baggage transportation to the Disney bus, so you can leave your bags in your room at the Hyatt and they will be picked up and magically appear in your cruise stateroom if you use the Disney bus transportation. Nice perk! For hotel restaurants, we were pleasantly surprised with both dinner and breakfast and the prices. It was fun for the kids to watch planes taking off and landing during meals. Also, MCO is such a nice airport with good shops that we walked around browsing the shops after dinner. Would definitely stay here again if I needed an overnight at MCO.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0317
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before an early morning flight. I wish we'd been able to stay longer! The bathroom was luxurious, the bed was very comfortable, and the room was spacious. We had an atrium view, so we were able to see the concourse from our balcony. The location could not be more convenient- it is located right between Terminals A and B, so we were able to sleep in a little and still make our flight. The only thing that bothered me is that the window was to the concourse- not the outside- so I think that may have gotten to me if I stayed there too long. But all in all, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay prior to flight”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: I was tired, sweating profusely and the gal behind the desk quickly checked me in and then helped me over to the elevator, gave me precise directions to my hotel room. Great service! The room was well laid out and the bathroom was clean; damn near "swanky." About the only thing that cheapened my experience was the $9.99 charge for internet. I would definitely stay there again. Get up early in the morning, and a short 5 minute walk to the gate. PRICELESS!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent facility, great food”
Reviews.Author: Celebconsult
Reviews.Content: If you live an hour or more away from the Orlando International Airport (MCO) and have to catch an early flight, the most convenient -- and relaxed -- way is to stay IN the airport at the Hyatt. Restaurants and room service food is great. If you need help with luggage, the bellman will take it to the airline ticketing/check-in desk with you. Check with front desk for special parking fee if your trip is less than 7 days; one night's room fee covers several days of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: Our flight was scheduled to arrive very late at MCO,so we decided to spend the night at Hyatt REgency at the Airport.I checked in midnight and I was assisted by Ken at the front desk.I was told that the hotel was sold out and the only rooms available without connecting doors(my request ) have sofa beds,no beds!!!I complaint because I have booked and paid for a room and was expecting to sleep in a bed.Ken checked in his computer and found a room for us.This room was adjacent to the elevators and it was for handcapped.I refused myself to stay there,after more 15 minutes I finally got a decent room!!!I was tired(coming from Sao Paulo,Brazil where I live) and I was not treated like a real guest.I noticed several people checking in iand all of them had their keys asap.I felt really bad that night!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in-airport hotels”
Reviews.Author: MaPeacetravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated inside the main terminal, with the reception on a level above. The rooms are clean, well appointed with extremely comfortable beds. The rooms have been soundproofed so that sound form the outside is greatly reduced and sound from adjoining rooms is almost imperceptible. Relaxing atmosphere despite the bustle below. They offer the use of day-rooms also, should be stranded for several hours. There is a gym and a nice outside pool area, from which you can see the runways, if you like that sort of thing. Although the hotel system had misplaced our reservation, the reception staff made sure we had a comfortable room to our liking. The concierges were generous with advice and very practical pre-written directions. We indeed visited a part of town we didn't know anything about until suggested by Peter. The Hemispheres restaurant offers a fantastic breakfast buffet. I am not usually a big fan of buffets, but this one offers a vast selection of fresh fruits, compotes, cheeses, egg dishes, meats, cereals, breads and pastries and they are all delicious. McCoys is the relaxed restaurant that offers a wide variety of casual dining foods and also serves sushi after 4pm. Having recently required the need for a special diet, I was extremely pleased by the care and attention by both waitstaff and chef to provide me with a delicious meal despite my restrictions. Overall the staff is extremely courteous and eager to please. We spent three days on our way back home.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key!”
Reviews.Author: dr_reagan
Reviews.Content: My kids and I had just completed a cruise that ported at Port Canaveral so we flew in and out of Orlando. Our ship came in on a Saturday morning but our flight was not till Sunday, so we spent the day at Epcot and the night at the Hyatt. The room was a typical upscale hotel room, clean, comfortable bed, marble counter tops, but nothing special. The $212 per night price is half for the room and half for the location. It was so nice and relaxing Sunday morning to wake up, shower, and take an elavator down to the security check-in at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: Had to change my return flight to the next day. Needed a place to stay. Walked up to the front desk and was able to get a room. My room was on the 9th floor. Very quiet and extremely comfortable. Even with the balcony overlooking a parking garage and the A side terminal, it was still very quiet. Service was great. I went to dinner in the bar and grill and sat at the bar. Had a great experience. Seemed to be many families staying the night before their cruise. But still no complaints. I did not use the pool or any of the amenities. Checking out was a breeze and printing out my boarding pass was a nice perk. Although it would be nice if they had more than one computer and printer. It was a little too pricey for what they offer. But convenience has its price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Disney Cruise.”
Reviews.Author: toddkharding
Reviews.Content: The hotel is highly convenient. Located between Terminals A and B and it is close to restaurants (surprisingly good for an airport). Fast food and sit down. The rooms are very comfortable, spacious and nicely decorated. The rooftop pool is fantastic and room service will deliver. Every room has either an interior or exterior balcony. If you are on a Disney cruise this hotel is perfect if you want to arrive a day before or leave a day after. Disney has staff in the lobby the morning of the cruise to answer questions. Hyatt takes care of your luggage. You just tag them and leave them. Next time you see them is in your stateroom. We stayed both before and after the cruise. Perfect for kids with the pool and the lobby to run around in. Will definitely stay here again the next time we take a Disney cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: captainTexas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times prior to Disney Cruises or visiting Walt Disney World. Of course, its a great location in the middle of Orlando International Airport. The staff is very courteous and helpful especially in terms of transfer of luggage for Disney Cruises. The rooms are clean, very comfortable ( nice linens/comforters like all of Hyatt properties ). We have found the rooms to be fairly quiet for an airport hotel and have had no problems with sleep interuptions due to planes landing/taking off like in other airport hotels. We have eaten at the restaurant mulitple times and is surprisingly quite good for a hotel restaurant (sushi and burgers quite good). All in all, this is a clean comfortable convenient hotel that is perfect if you find yourself needing to stay in or near the airport for business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Captain_0veur
Reviews.Content: Overall a good airport Hotel with very good location, it is right in the terminal, close to a food court and security checks. Basically almost everything was as expected. Check in very quick and friendly, a clean spacious room with comfortable bed. My room was facing outside (some are facing inside the terminal) and had good soundproofing. I am a light sleeper but did not notice noise from planes. The only downside is that some rooms might be noisy due to a restaurant / bar / staff only rooms. I recall that there was a review here complaining about that. While I was on the way to my room (which was very quiet) I passed by some rooms close to a bar / restaurant and the area seemed a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Live Your Terminal Fantasies”
Reviews.Author: poleinahole1
Reviews.Content: If you ever wanted to make like Tom Hanks in Terminal, this is the place to do it--in luxury. Check in is super quick and friendly. You can even check in scanning a bar code print out of your reservation. Rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated and WIFI (with cable) fast. You can access the Internet to print out your boarding pass for free in the lobby. There's a very good selection of recent movies for rent although they are very expensive. Toileteries are of good quality with even toothpaste provided. I had a room facing onto the interior of the airport terminal and there was some noise from there during the night if you are a light sleeper. The gym is well equipped if a bit cramped. You can go running on the helipad with a view of the airport. The pool is small but also overlooks the airport tarmac. Food is very good, with lots of fresh, healthy choices. Even during my three day meeting, the snacks served were healthy. The one negative is that while room service is very quick, if very pricey, it takes them ages to collect the trays and trolleys (all night) even after you call to remind them that your trolley is standing outside your door. That's a small niggle though. This is a very convenient and comfortable place to stay for meetings and I would stay heere again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant way to kill time before your flight”
Reviews.Author: GinaSamarotto
Reviews.Content: For $89 at the time of this review, you can book your family for a "Day Room" at the Hyatt at MCO. A place to shower, a bed to stretch out on and all access to the pools and amenities this upscale airport hotel has to offer is a bargain for the price. If you're flying Delta, the hotel is literally 20 feet from the terminal located within the airport itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and so convenient for flying in late or out early”
Reviews.Author: Like2cruz
Reviews.Content: i live in the Orlando area, but use this hotel occasionally if I have early or late arriving flight. For early flights especially, it's super convenient and you don't have to worry about over-sleeping as the hotel provides personalized (not recorded) wake-up calls, and even provides a follow-up call 15 minutes later to make sure you're up. That coupled with the fancy alarm clock and 2 alarm settings, and you can rest assured you won't over-sleep. The hotel itself is outstanding and room furnishings and decor are first class. I've had both an inside-facing terminal room and runway-facing room, and they are both extremely comfortable (bed has loads of pillows!) and soundproof. The inside facing terminal rooms have a balcony overlooking the terminal (great for people watching and seeing how long the security line is), while the runway view rooms have a balcony where you can watch planes soaring off. The bed is SO comfortable and there are actually too many pillows to realistically use! The staff is excellent and very professional. The bathroom has a combined tub and shower, and the shower head is very nice, offering a nice pressure stream of water. The bath amenities are very good, as well as the over-size towels. There is a coffee maker in the room with Starbucks coffee. The flat panel TV has a couple channels showing arrivals and departures (as well as the regular channels) for checking flights, or just dreaming about the next place you want to go. The airport location can't be beat if you're flying out early or arriving late. For late arriving passengers (or even those folks waiting on other's flights to arrive), there is a restaurant and bar on the lobby level, which is open until at least midnight. This was really a much appreciated feature after I arrived back at 10pm one time and could still get a meal and a drink. There is another hotel restaurant located on another level, however I have not used that one so can't comment. There is a fancy outdoor pool with waterfall, and there is plenty of lounge seating as well. This area offers great views of the runway and terminal trains (some people call them monorails, but these are not) which transport passengers to their gates. Surprisingly there is not a pool bar here for this nice area, although there is a house phone with a number to call for room service delivery to the pool. If you have a car, the charge for self parking is $12 (valet available), and the parking garage is conveniently connected to the hotel entrance and lobby. (The regular garage rate is $17 a day for non-guests). After check-in, keep your room key out, as you will need it to take the glass-enclosed elevators (overlooking the terminal) up to your room. The room key is required for guests (for all room types) to use the elevators (at least going up), and adds a nice feeling of security. Overall, this is a wonderful hotel to stay, if only for a night coming or going from MCO airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're flying out early”
Reviews.Author: sneaky291
Reviews.Content: My family had an early flight out of Orlando International and this hotel was an ideal choice. I was given the opportunity to check-in online, which was terrific because I was informed by email as soon as my room was ready, which was at 9am. This allowed me to reschedule my day which saved me fantastic amounts of time. Check in was done at a kiosk, and was quick and easy. The rooms were comfortable and stylish. We were given two double beds and the usual hotel amenities (fridge, tv, desk etc...) A nice advantage of staying here was that we were able to visit the terminal, which has a fair amount of shopping and restaurants before security, the night before. This also allowed us to kind of map out where we would be heading bright and early the next day. Luggage assistance was available and responded quickly to our request. They took us straight to our airline counter which was tremendously helpful for a family with two small children and all the bags which accompany. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Valleyresident
Reviews.Content: This was a great way to end our long Florida vacation. Rather than rise extremely early for the flight home, as we usually do, we checked the car rental back and stayed over at the airport hotel. Room was on top floor with atrium view. Very comfortable, good quality bed, with fairly upmarket furnishings and bathroom fittings, and best of all, the room was very quiet. The restaurant on 4th floor was pretty good, with nice food and very friendly service. The choices for breakfast were good and very enjoyable with a great view over the runway. I'm sure we'll choose this option for future vacations in Orlando, it was far less rushed and a much more pleasant conclusion to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good quality”
Reviews.Author: onionryder
Reviews.Content: I spent an overnight at this hotel during a business trip and for frequent travelers there is nothing better than to just get off the plane and roll right up to your room. The Hyatt Regency provides such an experience. The rooms are slightly worn but nice and comfortable and room service is extremely friendly and the food is really quite good. I had a king room that faced into the interior of the terminal but was surprisingly quite. I also loved that there was a Wall Street Journal at my door in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel for overnights at the Orlando airport and plan to use it again this week before my return flight.

Reviews.Title: “Love this airport”
Reviews.Author: FatherDaughterTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a great airport. We stayed in the hotel for a night, and we had a great view of the airport main. And the elevators were cool. We also liked the Disney Store and The Seaworld Store in the aiport. :):):)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before Disney Cruise”
Reviews.Author: turistaamericana
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel before a Disney Cruise. We stayed here two weeks ago after flying in to the airport. It was quiet, clean and made traveling with a 2 and 4 year old to Port Canaveral effortless. We awoke the morning of the cruise, grabbed breakfast in the airport and checked in for the cruise. Baggage was picked up in our hotel room and delivered to our state room on the ship! No lines to check in for the cruise! Bypassed the lines at the port! My only disappointment was with the restaurant. I didn't realize how accessible the airport food court and restaurants would be from the hotel. I made a needless reservation at what I thought was a sushi restaurant located within the hotel. It was a general restaurant that served a few very expensive and average sushi rolls. If we return to Orlando, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. It could not have been more convenient for our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in the middle of the airport”
Reviews.Author: bbanks945
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after late arrival while waiting for our vacation rental to be available. The hotel is located right in the center of the airport. It is very quiet, and the rooms are typical Hyatt Regency superbly fitted out. We were on the top floor and the balcony had a great view of the jets landing. The breakfast service was fair - the buffet was standard and the service was indifferent. The view from the breakfast restaurant was disappointing considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrthster
Reviews.Content: I got this through priceline name your own price at a great rate. Very nice hotel if you do not mind staying in the airport terminal. My room had a balcony and was really nice. The balcony overlooked the airport terminal. Everything about this hotel was really nice, except for the parking. You must valet or park in short term parking, both of which are very expensive. I think the hotel should comp on the valet. That is my only criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property!”
Reviews.Author: pverda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one-night waiting for an early-morning flight and couldn't have been happier. It's a typical Hyatt but at a great location for business travelers, meetings, and even families. Great restaurants. Fitness center is a bit small, though. Try jogging on the roof of the parking garage with the heliport -- that's a first for me! I'll definitely return! Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “Great location. OK to good overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: ccm17
Reviews.Content: I would like to be able to give this place 3 and 1/2 stars. It was better than average but not especially great. The service was good (typical for Hyatt) and generally short lines at the front desk. People were well trained, helpful, and friendly. The hotel is over the main terminal of the Orlando airport, so just a short walk from the food court and a couple floors above the baggage claim. The room I had was on the west side of the building with a patio/windows looking out into the public atrium and the entrance to the TSA security lines. In other words, on the opposite side of the building as the elevators so there was little hallway traffic but it was a long walk to get there (especially with luggage after a flight). It seems the rooms closer to the elevator are priced slightly higher on a per night basis. The "runway view rooms" are some of the ones closest to the elevators. The rooms themselves were as advertised, not overly large, but not tiny either. I don't think anything was outright broken, but lots of things seemed heavily worn and ready for a refinish, reupholstering, or replacement. Unfortunately, this also seems somewhat typical for a Hyatt. The bathroom was upscale but reeked of the overly perfumed toiletries that Hyatt uses. I am not sure why they thing their soaps and shampoos should smell like the inside of an Asian spice market, but they do. Yes, this sets them apart from their competition, but in a bad way. Some noise did leak into the room. It was noticeable, but not bad. There is a full service restaurant, named McCoy's, near the lobby. The food is pretty good, but overpriced. The service was good, and better than in most tourist areas. There was a significant variety on the menu and the hours of service were long to accommodate travelers including those from different time zones and getting off (or on) to long flights. I would go back, but I wouldn't automatically go back (i.e. I will certainly look for other options in the area as well).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: KansasHummingbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our trip to Walt Disney World. Since our plane arrived at the Orlando airport at 10:00 p.m., our travel agent suggested we stay the night at this hotel for the convenience. What a great plan!! We got off the plane, retrieved our luggage, and walked right to the hotel glass-enclosed elevator to the beautiful second-floor lobby. Check-in was a breeze. I wish I could remember the clerk’s name. We had reserved three rooms and they were all on the same floor. The rooms were spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. We also had a balcony area that overlooked the beautiful fountain and terminal. The beds were extremely comfortable and the marble bathroom was very nice. As I am a light sleeper, the only problem was the loud clicking noise when the a/c came on, but I always travel with earplugs, so that really was not an issue. We had the breakfast buffet in the Hemisphere Steak and Seafood Restaurant on the 9th floor, which was excellent. We could not ask for better service, food, and ambience. We can highly recommend the Hyatt Regency as well as the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop in airport”
Reviews.Author: getoutofNJ
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay right in Orlando airport. My family took a Disney cruise and this was a great stop pre and post cruise. We stayed the night before our cruise and got up in the morning and went right to the Disney bus. We did not need to worry about our luggage, as the hotel staff took care of gettting it to Disney. We also used the hotel as a day room for a great price ($89) after our cruise. Our flight did not leave until 9PM, so it was a great way to wait for our flight. My kids used the pool most of the day, then I showered them before dinner and boarding. The staff at the hotel was very helpful! Great way to end a perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “It's an Airport Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DonaldE
Reviews.Content: As the only hotel attached to the Orlando Airport (MCO), there is little reason to provide an outstanding product. First of all, this hotel is very convenient for a late arrival or early departure into/out of Orlando. It is very easy to find, and check in check out couldn’t be easier. Now, onto the rooms – we had a king bed room, which included their breakfast buffet. The hotel is clearly an older property, and they’ve put a little “lipstick” on it. The rooms have flat-screen tvs, marble bathroom countertops, very comfortable beds & chairs. However, the rooms have no electrical outlets on or near the nightstands, and none on the desk. They do have an outlet below the desk (used by a lamp & phone), and a power strip mounted underneath the desk (get on your hands & knees)! Also, they have an outlet in the restroom. In summary, today’s consumer expects some accessible outlets, and this upgrade was spared. Bathroom – not bad, not good. Just okay. Tub/shower combo with shower curtain is a bit outdated, and the shower head is mounted at about 5’ 8”. Water spots prevalent at bathroom faucet, peeling wallpaper, and exhaust doesn’t remove shower steam. Shower itself worked great, lighting was fine, and tile floor was nice. Restaurant – has a respectable breakfast buffet, with a solid set of choices. You won’t find an omelette station, or much for fruit choices, but was acceptable. Okay, none of us are probably staying at an airport hotel and expecting resort-level amenities/facilities. However, Hyatt isn’t doing their brand any favors with this property. Would I stay their again? Yes. More than one night? No. This is strictly a place to stay before an early-morning flight, not a great place to set up camp for the typical Orlando activities. Tips: you have direct access to an airport food court (Chik-Fil-A, Krispy Kreme, Panda Express, Starbucks,…) and some last minute theme park shopping. Also, easy access to/from car rental services if needed.

Reviews.Title: “As convenient as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: luthgicap
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in early December due to catching a very early flight next day to NYC. Our room was spotlessly clean but not huge with a nice view over the runways. Check in was fast although it was a fair walk to our room! There were no noise issues during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: Lovetocruise277
Reviews.Content: Flew into Orlando day before our cruise, stayed at the Hyatt Regency there at the airport. I highly recommend this hotel if your doing like what we did. You never have to go outside to get to the hotel, very convenient. Room was very spacious and had a large walk out patio with table and chairs. We ate at the restaurant on the 9th floor, great good, good service and a great view. The check in staff were very good and helpfull. In fact when we returned from our cruise we stayed there again, since our flight wasn't until the next morning. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ,the staff makes this Hyatt really shine!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa K
Reviews.Content: Myself , husband , and 10 year old daughter had a one night stay at this hotel while waiting for the rest of our family to arrive for our vacation the next morning. Upon arrival we were greeted with the warmest smile by Michelle at the front desk, who went above and beyond answering all of our questions and showing and explaining to us all of the hotel facilities and services. She even gave us the best tip , EVER! The lobby bar and Mc Coy Grill restaurant. Away from the hustle and bustle of the airport and very honestly priced, both are excellent! The staff at this hotel is really a plus. Everyone we came across had a friendly smile. The room we stayed at, a deluxe king , had all the amenities we needed, big flat screen tv, a huge bathroom, and a lovely sitting area with a sofa bed. Our room faced the airport runway, and I confess that at first I did not feel comfortable, as I am a very light sleeper, trust me on this. But I must confess that I slept like a baby, never heard anything!!!! Their rooms are really soundproof, believe me! We wanted fresh towels in the morning and heard a a housekeeper next door, so I went there and asked her for some extra towels. She gladly provided us with even more than we needed. She was very sweet. In overall I'd say this hotel is a hidden gem within the Orlando Airport , and I would recommend it to anyone! Congratulations, Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport Team members, you are out of this world! We were very satisfied and will surely return!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: HenryGreenHills
Reviews.Content: This hotel pretty much nails it. Only complaint is that the full service restaurant for dinner is overpriced. Quality of food was very good though. Several high points: very quick and efficient check in, along with printing our boarding passes for our a.m. flight. Our bellman took care of everything: wake up call in the morning, a.m. porter service from our room to the airline counter (VERY much appreciated as we had 5 large suitcases). Wake up call was right on time as was our room service breakfast. Actually breakfast was delivered on the early side.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: vwporsche1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long day and a very turbulent flight. The location couldn't have been better, we literally stepped right off the plane to the hotel! The hotel was BEAUTIFUL, with awesome greenery and glass elevators. The staff could not have been nicer. We also ate at a couple of the restaurants inside the hotel, which were great! We also had a view of inside the terminal, which was awesome. My favorite part though of the stay here was the pool. It was very refreshing, and you got mind-blowing views of the runways! This hotel is on my MUST stay at list!

Reviews.Title: “great for overnight stop over”
Reviews.Author: kevin041
Reviews.Content: stayed one night due to flight booking, hotel very accomodating on arrival, got a fab suite room for price of basic, bar good, stroll around terminal was relaxing ! prices dear, as had to catch early am flight location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Roll out of bed and keep rolling to your gate”
Reviews.Author: Kairho1
Reviews.Content: In airport convenience is the hallmark of this upscale Hyatt. Located right in the main terminal (the terminal itself serving as the atrium) literally on top of the east side TSA checkpoint I use this Hyatt for overnights before and after trips when the air schedule forces a misconnect with the limo from and back home. Used to stay at a hotel outside the airport but it is worth the few extra dollars for the convenience of not having to wait for shuttle vans. Plus the conveniences of the airport are there including a choice of three restaurants -- in addition to the two in the hotel -- plus the food court. So no dinner or breakfast planning is necessary; just decide what you feel like when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgoff5455
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight waiting to meet family. Much to our surprise the hotel was conveniently centered around the stores, and our room faced the tarmac yet wass very quiet. We were fairly close to the elevator, but some rooms are quite a hike away. The room was spotless and with a standard-sized tub. No wi-fi unless we went out into the airport area. Very good restaurants are available within the hotel if you want more than airport fast food. Hotel staff were eager to assure that our brief visit was pleasant. Highly recommend for quick stays getting into and out of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: dazed912
Reviews.Content: Convenient for pre-cruise stays. Clean and comfortable rooms. Only downfall is if u arrive late you are stuck with room service menu or mcdonald's. No places deliver food there late night. Would recommend for pre-cruise stays but not for anyone who enjoys a stroll outside. Overall nice design and kids liked the huge christmas trees decorated in blue lights.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1313
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. Average size. Used for convenience before a Disney cruise. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: We stay at this Hyatt in the Orlando Airport every year. It is so nice to walk out of your htel and into the airport when you have an early flight. Lots of stores to see, restaurants and an arcade in the airport. Rooms are clean and stylish. Staff is friendly. McCoys is a good place to eat or have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rimi S
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay..great rooms, great views..you can see people check- in and out in the Airport lobby from your Room...Loved It!

Reviews.Title: “If you're willing to spend, then you can't beat the convenience”
Reviews.Author: slakhany1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the orlando intl airport. Rooms are great and service is excellent. Just be prepared to spend around $200/room.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for those of a nervous disposition”
Reviews.Author: Mitch1946
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, conveniently located and we were "upgraded" but OMG, the noise, we must have had every single sewage pipe in the building routed behind a plasterboard panel in our room. The sound of flushing and running water was continuous and LOUD, so loud we could not sleep. Like Chinese Water torture but worse as we could imagine what was passing us. We complained and the desk said they would look into it but never got back to us so we made the best of it but got little or no sleep that night. May go back but on the condition that our room is nowhere near the "cascades".

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Overnight for Cruise or Intl. Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before our Disney Cruise. It was pretty good, but not "fabulous. It's an older hotel, unique in many ways, and located right between terminals at the airport. We ate at the Hotel Pub on the fourth floor, and the food was rather good and not overly expensive. There is absolutely no "airport noise" in the hotel, which we found surprising (but appreciated.) I'd venture to say that this is a great place to stay when waiting for an overseas flight or cruise. The hotel seems to be geared for convention and group travel service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bertha55
Reviews.Content: After four beautiful days in Orlando at another hotel, Due to an early flight out of Orlando on Christmas morning we chose to stay at the Hyatt at the MCO airport on Christmas eve. Great choice! Even though it was Christmas eve, there were still several options for dinner. The room was very nice with updated bathroom and lovely decor. Very clean. We even had a balcony where we could sit outside and enjoy our last day of warm Florida weather before traveling back up north.
