The convenience of being connected to the airport alone makes this hotel worthwhile. I travel a lot and this is one of the best airport hotels I have stayed in. It is a great hotel period.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent is the best thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LBeavers
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Orlando to make flight connections and decided to stay at the airport Hyatt. It is very convienent both for airport check in and baggage claim. Hotel check in was also a breeze. After that the service and attention declined. As we opened the door to our non smoking room the strong odor of cigarette smoke assaulted us. I called the front desk and received an apology and nothing else. Since the hotel is in the airport the whole facility isnonsmoking! I did manage to get them to send someone up with room freshener. How housekeeping could have missed the smell is beyond me. They also missed the half dozen butts and a cigar on the roof just outside our room window. Service at the lobby bar was slow... they didn't want to seat the six of us in the restaurant if we only wanted appetizers, but the food was very good and drink excellent, but pricey. When we got ready for bed we had to remake the sheets as the bed had been so poorly made. At least the sheets were clean! The final missed detail came early the next morning when I realized that there was no shampoo! Since I wake early I did not want to disturb my wife by calling housekeeping. I made do with the one bar of hand soap we were provided. If I stay here again and we might, I will certainly be more demanding as it seems that the management here is not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: DeeThom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here - service was excellent, breakfast included was adequate. Room was in awesome condition, and it was super easy to catch the shuttle the next day for our Carnival Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Perfect Convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Nati_Traveler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week in an effort to break up a long day of travel. Just thought I would write a quick note for anyone considering the same. This hotel is clean, perfectly located and actually has a really solid restaurant called McCoy's Bar and Grille. It served its purpose well and the staff was very attentive if you needed them to be. Great choice if you need to stay at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good Convenient Hotel For Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: cloudsurfer2
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport for a pre-Disney cruise and let me tell you, we have no regrets. Our plane landed at approximately 8:15pm so we were exhausted. We were so glad that the hotel was right inside the terminal. All we had to do was collect our luggage, wheel it to the 3rd floor, go up the elevator and then walk right into the hotel lobby. We were cordially greeted by both the bellboy and the front desk and immediately shown to our room that was located on the 8th floor overlooking the inside of the terminal. The room contained 2 medium firm double beds and a small balcony (sits 2 very comfortably) and was of modern decor with a flat screen 32" TV (no hdmi to plug in a laptop to watch your own movies - it had the red/white inputs). More importantly, everything was very clean...from the crisp sheets on the bed to the towels hanging in the bathroom. No mold in the bathtub, no dampness in sheets or in the air. The walls and ceiling were flat clean drywall. Not the awful popcorn type ceilings and walls you find in a lot of accommodations in Florida and in the Bahamas. We had no problems with noise where we were located...no noise from planes landing or taking off...no noise from within the terminal. In fact even the air conditioning was quiet. You will get a good night sleep here. You can choose to eat at the hotel restaurant (nice but pricey) or go for a short walk downstairs in the terminal food court where you will find a McDonalds, Quiznos, Starbucks, etc. The following morning we went for a tour of the outdoor pool located on the 6th floor (I will request to stay in a room located on this floor next time) overlooking the runway. Don’t expect a large pool but its nice just the same. You can choose to sit under the good size wood gazebo or take a dip in the heated pool. I wish we had stayed an extra night to enjoy this floor that also included a fitness room. Since we already paid for Disney transportation, the Hyatt assisted in the luggage delivery to the Disney ship. All we had to do was place the hotel-supplied tags on our luggage, leave them inside our room by the door and check out of the hotel (check in time is 4:00PM and Check out is 12:00PM). It was very simple and the luggage showed up outside our ship cabin door. We waited until 11:30PM to check out since boarding was at 1:00PM. The distance from the hotel to the port is approximately 50 minutes. We figured it would probably take another 30 minutes to process papers at the dock. We were told that there was nothing to do at the dock so we tried to maximize our stay. You will really like the accommodations, friendliness, and convenience of this hotel if you need to stay somewhere prior to a cruise. I would have rated it excellent if the beds were queen size and if they were a little more firm.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...... The best location before or after a flight.”
Reviews.Author: PerfectBreezeTravel
Reviews.Content: Wow is all I can say..... This would definitely be my first choice before or after a cruise. It is absolutely breathtaking and of course the place to be for a early morning flight. You just wake up, check out and go down on the elevator and you are in your terminal (JetBlue for me). It was so convenient. The rooms were absolutely nice and spacious. I HIGHLY recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Convenient and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: optiontrader
Reviews.Content: We stayed coming and going on a cruise vacation with daughter, son-in-law and granddaughter and were impressed with the courtesy and helpfulness of the staff, particularly the front desk and restaurant. The room was clean, fairly large, and provided an interesting view of the airport lobby and shops. The top floor restaurant had excellent food and service and the lobby level restaurant though less formal provided good food and prompt service as well. The hotel provided a great stopping off both before and after the cruise. It is about an hour or so to the port from the hotel and travel can easily be arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Exrugbyplayer1
Reviews.Content: I can appreciate the convenience of the Hyatt located within the airport, and will certainly not disagree. It may be unfathomable to believe that an issue could result in a score of 1 out of 5, but when there is no hot water to take a shower on not only 1 but 4 seperate occasions on 3 consecutive days (after reporting to management the first day). Maybe not a problem if you are staying for personal, but when on a business trip, having shampoo in your hair and nothing but cold water is a dealbreaker (further confirmed by coworkers also staying in the hotel). Certainly, mistakes happen - it's what happens after the mistake that is telling. Had we been offered a discount rate, a free night, or simply remediation of the problem, we would have had empathy for the situation. But when no action is taken? I have included a photo taken with the shower on full hot (there is no water coming out of the shower), would love to include the video I took showing the water going from a trickle to stopping entirely from both the faucet, as well as the showerhead. After this negative experience, I will admit to a more critical eye of my stay - but neither would I recommend this hotel or stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Relocation”
Reviews.Author: Halesky
Reviews.Content: We were arriving around 9 P.M. Friday night for a criuse on Saturday. Being as we were arriving a little later than usual and with extra luggage, we thought it would be much more convenient to stay here as it is right in the airport lobby. We did not have to call a shuttle and repeat the same thing the next morning, the perfect LOCATION. But the LOCATION of our room was near a party room, across from a "staff only" room and the ice machine. After the party was over the staff began to scoot furniture across the floor from one area to the other, go in and out the staff only room and slam doors and talk loudly. Impossible to sleep, I called the front desk to find out what was going on and he sent security to check it out. Obviously, not a problem because the noise continued. I got dressed and went into the hall to check out the situation and called the desk again to let them know what was going on. At 2 A.M. the manager came to help US MOVE from the noise, so we could get 4 hours sleep. RELOCATION. This room should be blocked during events that require such movement and cleaning unless there are no other rooms available, which was not the case. Sad to say all of this could have been prevented had someone put a little more thought into room assignments and party times. I hope this will prevent others from the same experience. You are definetly paying for the location, as we have stayed at nicer places for much better prices. Breakfast was included in our AAA rate. It was in a beautiful dining room overlooking one of the runways and the food and service was very good. A very nice way to begin the day after a short night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely do it again”
Reviews.Author: sonya
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel pre-cruise and also unexpectedly post-cruise. We checked in late Friday night after our flight. We were promptly assisted and checked in to a executive suite that we paid an extra $10 for an upgrade online. The room was huge and definitely kicked our vacation off with a great start. We ate in the bar that night. This dish I had was great but I can't remember the name of it. It was steak cut up on flatbread and my fiance had a hamburger. We did not need any assistance that night. The room was quiet and we didn't hear anything at all. The next morning we checked out with no problems and were promptly on our way to the port. The second stay came about unexpectantly as when we got off the ship, we were told that our home airport was closed due to Hurricane Irene. We were lucky enough to be able to grab a room at the Hyatt again. This time we had a regular king bed room. The walk was very long from the elevator but that would be my only complaint and its not a big deal. The view of the airport from the balcony was also nice because I like to people watch. Overall, its a great convenience to have this hotel in the airport. We were able to eat in the food court and quickly catch our flights or our transfer to the port. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for being INSIDE the airport!”
Reviews.Author: geekacky
Reviews.Content: If you find yourself stuck at Orlando airport for the night, the Hyatt is located right INSIDE the main terminal and is very very nice. The rooms were spacious, the price was good and the airport has a food court with many restaurants located in it. No need to rent-a-car or taxi. Literally you are 1 minute from security and 5 minutes from the gates. MCO offers free WiFi also. A GREAT find!

Reviews.Title: “Fab strategic location and high service levels”
Reviews.Author: bwlchtocynman
Reviews.Content: We stay here as our springboard to Manchester If you have not experienced the ease from getting of the plane to check in and then to one of the quiet and comfy bedrooms then more fool you The McCoyes restuarant has some inovative dishes and great cocktails Helpful staff and a easy way to reduce travel stress We are back in January Give it a try Chris

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in a unique location.”
Reviews.Author: sgtpet
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Hyatt in early November. We had a late flight into Orlando and the next day we were going on a Disney Cruise. The convenience of exiting the plane and checking in to the hotel was awesome. I got the family in the hotel room and walked over to baggage to get the suitcases. We had a wonderful breakfast the next morning and we were able to leave our luggage in the room and next time we saw the luggage was in our stateroom on the ship.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: P2Pro
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute change of plans, and needed to stay close to the airport in Orlando for one night. You really can't make it any easier to catch a flight from this hotel, as the hotel is actually in the airport. You can walk from the lobby to the security check in about 30 seconds. I was a little considered about the noise from the airport drifting into the rooms, but I was impressed at the sound proofing they did on this hotel. Very quiet. The room I booked was a king, non smoking. The room was large, and very clean. The bathroom was spotless. The bed was very comfortable, with numerous pillows, including 2 very nice body length ones. The air conditioning was excellent. Very quiet, with a digital thermometer. I really hate the loud units. The room service I ordered was delivered in less than 30 minutes, and the food was hot and well prepared. I would not go as far as saying it was a good value, but at least it was good. The staff was attentive and prompt when requested. I had a few disappointments in the hotel. One, my room was quite a walk from the elevators. This hotel, like any with any open atrium, makes getting to the rooms on the opposite side a walk. Also, at $200 a night, it would be nice to see free internet access in the rooms. Overall, I would stay again when I need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “wow a hotel attached to the airport”
Reviews.Author: joyce t
Reviews.Content: i got off the plane and wandered down the halls because the information person said its in the airport. i didnt know what they were talking about. anyway,i walked into a huge atrium with a water fountain ,huge lobby like, and i looked up and realized i was inside the airport and hotel, at the hotel at the same time. i got a terrific room overlooking this huge atrium and loved it. strangely, i could see the airport travelers going through security right from my room. you would have to be there to know what im talking about. clean quiet, fantastic. i cant wait to go back again. many places to eat inside and outside without every leaving the airport. they let me check in at 0830 which was great since i flew all night. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “IN TRANSIT”
Reviews.Author: peter_glazier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in transit to Dallas for Thanksgiving and then, in transit again, to Sao Paulo on our way back. The hotel was excellent and the staff very helpful. We were able to check in our flights on line right next to the front desk. The first morning my wife ordered a very early breakfast in the room which was delivered on time and very nicely presented. I would like to mention that Orlando is not a traveler friendly airport. In fact, it is a very confusing airport and my wife and I are avid travelers. One arrives, gets a shuttle walks a considerable distance, goes down a floor to the baggage claim, comes up again to walk another considerable distance to check in or goes up another floor to the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aluor
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we needed to stay one night in Orlando before going on a Disney cruise the next day. Location is perfect, right at the airport. Check-in was seamless and front desk people were very polite and helpful. The porters take your luggage the next day to the disney counter at the airport. The rooms were decent; comfortable and clean. Basic amenities (soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion). No shower caps or other toiletries. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem.”
Reviews.Author: dubsman
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5pm from 9 hours in the sky,Checked in straight away and went back down to the carousel to collect cases,Rooms were very nice with balconies looking over runways,Also very quite night and day,Beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in. To be able to get out of bed, check in and come back up to Hemispheres restaurant for a wonderful breakfast then shower and jump on an 8 am flight with no rushing around was worth the extra few quid we paid,It was actually a fantastic way to start our holiday. Cannot wait to pass through orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “LifeSaver”
Reviews.Author: she_marina
Reviews.Content: We were so gratiful we booked this before an early morning flight. We didnt get in til late after a very busy night out in orlando. Made things so easy to just drop the rental car the night before for a stressfree morning, and just walk on upstairs to get as much sleep as we could, we couldnt have been happier in the moment that we chose to stay here! Worth it when your tired, to avoid any stress, just that simple elevator to the gates in the morning eases the travel hassles. Really worth it to pay the cost for the best way to start or end your trip off right, great for the tired body and mind to rest and be ready for the fun vacation or the long trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestravelanddogs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice when traveling to/from the Orlando area. It is super convenient and up to Hyatt's high standards. When we stayed here the night before our disney cruise they even arranged to get our bags to the ship so we didn't have to lug them along. The beds here were fabulous and so was the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popovova
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It makes early flights very bearable, as time from room to gate can be 10 minutes, if security is light. The rooms are very nice, with firm beds and comfortable pillows. Importantly, the hotel is very quiet and peaceful, despite the airport noise and activity. I really appreciate the ceiling fans, as well. Breakfast is excellent, though a bit pricey. The two areas where improvement is welcome: actual HD channels on the flat screen tv and significant improvement in towel quality.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepperwhite
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here twice when traveling and it is extremely convenient...The first time was at the end of a trip with an early morning flight home and the 2nd time was at the beginning of a trip when we took a late night trip into Orlando. The staff at the hotel are amazing and very helpful. The rooms are clean and comfy. We ate at the restaurant and I had an amazing blue crab mac n cheese. Super convenient, great staff, clean and comfy - how much better does it get?

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Quality, But Don't Face the Wrong Side”
Reviews.Author: Sammyfloyd
Reviews.Content: Overall: Good Hyatt Regency type hotel with a few minor issues. Reasonably priced especially on a weekend. No Regency Club offered. Location: Connected to the terminal. In fact, the courtyard facing rooms can see some of the terminal. Plenty of airport restaurants and shops directly under the hotel. Sand Lake Road is about 15 minutes away so you can visit Florida Mall and other restaurants. Disney World, etc are about 30 minutes max. Reception: Quite large with a huge sitting area. There are four elevators taking you to the rooms. Access to rooms are by your hotel card key only. Rooms: Well appointed Hyatt Regency rooms and overall, quite nice with comfortable beds. Bathroom is fairly well sized with a good shower. My room originally faced the runway. It wasn't the runway noise that was bothersome. Rather, there was a monorail service operating underneath so I could constantly hear the automated announcement. Once I switched my room to the other side of the complex, not much noise could be heard and it was much more comfortable. Service: Good service overall as my room switch was handled without a hitch. The bellman brought the key up to my room within 5 minutes of my request. Free internet if you are a Hyatt elite member but otherwise charges are applicable. Parking: You park your car at one of the airport's short term parking garage which is no more than 3 minutes on foot to the hotel. The cost was $12 per day with unlimited in/out. Gym: Lots of equipment but they were clustered quite tightly together. The TV on the treadmill was unwatchable due to the vibration once I started running. The A/C is too stuffy in the gym. There is also a pool which I did not use. Value: Stayed there on a Sunday night so it was just $90. For a weekday, it probably would be worth $150 to $180. Anything more and you might consider staying elsewhere beyond the airport. I was disappointed that the hotel did not have a Regency Club though as I would have been able to get a free upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “The Night Before Hurricane IRENE!”
Reviews.Author: IrvineBeary
Reviews.Content: After our stay at the SWAN hotel, we had a very earlymorning fight up to Philly and decided to stay at the Airport Hyatt for the night before the trip. We had booked our stay a month ahead of time on the Hyatt website and had read the previous reviews of this facility. We were not disappointed with the rooms and enjoyed walking around the airport mall which is one of the best in the U.S. for an airport stay. We had supper at the McCoy's Grill and had a great server- Eileen who told us about the Airport's hurricane preparations and safety measures. Later on, We had to change our room because of a noisy next door family and the Front desk staff were very quick moving us to another guest room. The airport mall was fantastic for last second gift items or travel supplies with many vendors for all of your varies needs. Security was quick in the early morning and despite the impeding hurricane, we were on time and off to Philly for our next trip. For an over night stay & a good rest before your early morning flight this property is the best airport hotel to use in the Orlando Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “If your flying out of Orlando...”
Reviews.Author: Girl90028
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you have a early flight. On a spring vacation, I had to fly west to Los Angeles, and my Mom had to fly North on a later flight. The Hyatt staff was amazing. They couldn't have been more helpful metting my Mom at her room and taking her to the gate insuring she was ontime. THANK YOU Hyatt staff.... I will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: destinycm
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times before cruising with Carnival Cruise Lines out of Port Canaveral. Big rooms, very comfortable and clean... Very easy to get to since it is inside the airport. Free airport wifi is accessible from the rooms facing the internal of the airport. The staff every time I have been to this airport have been top notch - friendly, helpful, professional. There are many shops for food and shopping inside the Orlando airport and therefore easily accessible from the hotel. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to recover after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: RSHUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: We flew from the UK to Orlando but were travelling on to Georgia. Having already decided to stay overnight we were so pleased we'd done this as we incurred a 6 hour delay before our 8 hour flight. The Hotel is easy to find, friendly staff, lovely rooms (pay a little extra for the quiet 9th Floor) a small roof top pool to swim in after a long flight and you can watch the aircraft landing & taking off, good gym. Hotel restaurants a little pricey but a short walk takes you to 3 or 4 restaurants or an inexpensive Food Court. We liked it so much we stayed 2 nights on our return journey.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stopover”
Reviews.Author: SueD193
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt in the Airport is a great place to stop over after a long International flight. From collecting your bags to getting to the hotel takes around 10 minutes. When you get off the shuttle train in the terminal you just walk round the corner, up the escalator and you are at the reception area. We have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions when flying from the UK into Orlando. We usually book a Deluxe King room which has a fantastic King Grand Bed and a separate Sofa Bed which is ideal for our teenager. The room is very generous in size and the bathroom is very well equipped and clean and there are plenty of towels for all of us. The hotel has an outdoor pool with great views from the elevated position over the runway. After a long flight it is very refreshing to take a dip and start to adjust to the time difference. Plenty of towels and loungers and a nice place to relax. On this occasion we ate at McCoys in the evening which had a great atmosphere and a good selection of food. From a sushi menu to pizza and burgers, plenty of choice to suit all tastes and good quick service. We had breakfast in the Hemisphere restaurant. There is a good buffet breakfast as well as other choices from the menu. The buffet breakfast was good value, considering your surroundings, and had a wide selection of food to choose from. Overall the hotel is a great place to stay, more expensive than some, but the convenient location is a plus. On all the occasions we have stayed at the hotel the staff have always been very helpful and courteous and we would always choose this hotel as our stop over option when flying into Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Post-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: cjdixon4
Reviews.Content: Our cruise ship disembarked early in the morning in Port Canaveral, and our flight back to Chicago on Southwest Air was not until 8:15 p.m. What a brilliant idea for the Hyatt Orlando Airport to offer a "day rate room" for 89.00. We had a beautiful room to relax in from 10 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. We dropped our bags in the room, went down to the airport food court to eat, checked out the airport mall-shops, then returned to the room for a few hours of napping and tv. The hotel room was quite spacious, and the bathroom was typical Hyatt elegant (with all the amenities, i.e., shower cap, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc.). Our room overlooked the busy terminal, and the balcony was large enough to sit on and watch the travelers come and go. When it got too noisy, we closed the doors for some peace and quiet. The rooms across the hall from us had a view of the actuall airport and runways. One drawback: Who designed this hotel to have elevators only situated on one side of the hotel building? If you aren't smart enough to know in advance to ask for a room near the elevator, you've got one heck of a walk ahead of you. It's especially hard if you're physically challenged, or you've got a bunch of cumbersome luggage to drag along, or maybe just plain tired, However, it wasn't enough of a problem to not want to stay there again. It's a great concept to have a beautiful, reasonably priced hotel built right into the airiport terminal facilities. I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One night because of overbooked flight”
Reviews.Author: justtravel
Reviews.Content: My United Airlines flight was overbooked on Sunday October 30, 2011 so they put me at the Hyatt for one night. Muhammad was the one that checked me in and gave me room 6070. The room was a king and it had all the amenities you could want. The view from the room balcony was incredible, as I saw the fountain and the airport terminal. I did not have any luggage with me so I needed a toothbrush, so Robert at the front desk searched for one but they were out. He promised to send one to the room and sure enough 2 minutes later, Joel brought me one. I was also able to check in and print my boarding pass on their computer in the lobby which saved me time in the morning. Next time I am in Orlando I will look to this Hyatt as it is very convenient for late arrivals and early departures.

Reviews.Title: “Got a day rate and plan to return in February”
Reviews.Author: ckrobynToronto
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt in the Orlando International Airport offers a day rate for travellers who have long layovers or late flights and we took advantage of this. We had a room with a king bed and a balcony that overlooked the terminal. The room was impeccably clean and the bed very comfortable. The only negative is the proximity of the rooms to the elevators - it is a long and winding walk! We are planning to return in a few months on our way to a cruise in Port Canaveral.

Reviews.Title: “Really unique property, everyone should stay here once! Very convenient for Port Canaveral.”
Reviews.Author: lougordon1306
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hyatt the night before we boarded our cruise ship. There is nothing negative that I would say about our experience. First of all, the hotel is conveniently located if you are planning to get to Port Canaveral to board a cruise ship. The drive from the hotel to the port is about 35 minutes and its a simple easy drive, we would stay here every time we were headed for the port. Second, the hotel is literally INSIDE the Orlando airport and this offers an experience that is very unique. You can only access the elevators with your room key so the hotel does offer some seperation from the airport traffic. You can go into the airport terminal though, via the elevator or escalators. This means that you have access to all of the great airport features (shops, arcade, food court) without having the headache of actually traveling through the airport. The rooms in the hotel are very modern, very clean and equipped with some great features such as makeup mirrors, full size hair dryers, a great flat screen TV, alarm clock that has an iPhone/iPod dock, coffee pot and travel coffee cups. Plus, most rooms have a really great balcony that allows you to step out and see into the airport terminal. There is a great rooftop pool and sitting area that allows you to watch the planes take off and land. There are severl great restaurants on site as well as a bar and there are drink specials/room service offered in the pool area. The only tip I can offer is around parking. We really didnt know what we were getting into with the parking. You access the hotel via the airport so the parking garage also houses airport traffic. Follow the signs for the Hyatt and youll find the specific garage area for them. You will take a parking ticket like anyone else, but when you speak to the front desk, they will offer your details on how to reduce that parking fee. Instead of $17, we paid $12 for the days parking. This hotel is worth your stay!

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best airport hotels.”
Reviews.Author: sportsbabe59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so convenient that it would be a decent bet even if the rooms were awful. The lobby actually overlooks the security area, and anyone who checks in for their flight online can be in a security line within a few minutes of leaving their room. And the rooms themselves are up to Hyatt's usually standards - nice, comfortable and quiet. In addition, there is easy access to all the Orlando Airport pre-security stores and restaurants -including both Disney and Universal stores for last minute souvenirs, and a branch of LUSH. (Women will appreciate this more than men.) The staff was universally friendly too. Only small caveats, Hyatt still charges $9.95 a day for internet. (The airport has free internet but I found the signal too weak to connect.) And parking can be confusing. (In my case, I needed to drive to a dinner after checkin. But if possible it's easier to drop off a rental car first and then just take the elevator to the hotel.) But overall this hotel almost took the pain out of a 7am departure.

Reviews.Title: “Not only super-convenient, but also a really nice place”
Reviews.Author: cyberluddite
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels are often mostly judged on their convenience, because they tend to be boring and overpriced. If convenience alone were the criterion on which the Hyatt Recency at Orlando airport is to be judged, then you couldn't ask for more--it's RIGHT INSIDE the airport, and you literally step out of the hotel right in front of the security checkpoints. But even putting the convenience aside, this is actually a really nice hotel, at a very reasonable price. The guest rooms are on the 5th through 9th floors of the airport, and they encircle main terminal area, so that the terminal itself serves as an atrium for the hotel. Interior rooms face the main terminal below, the others face the airport runways. All are reasonably quiet, despite the airport location. The rooms are modern, spacious, and nicely furnished, as is usually the case with Hyatt Regency properties. The bed, bedding, and HVAC system are all designed for maximum comfort and sleep quality. There is free wi-fi internet access (provided by the airport itself, not by the hotel--the hotel provides wired access for a fee). The staff is very friendly and accomodating. There are two restaurants on-site (I didn't try them, but the menus did look appealing, though as is usually the case with hotel restaurants they were a bit pricey ) and a couple of bars (including a poolside lounge), plus the typical range of airport restaurants, shops, and services in the main terminal downstairs. Even if you don't plan on going swimming (and I didn't, because the weather was bad during both of my recent one-night stays), be sure to check out the rooftop pool area. It is one of those beautiful , artistic pools that is filled to the brim and the the water constantly overflows the top and and is recirculated (the kind you see pictured in stories about those super-luxurious world-class resorts that cater to the rich and famous). You ordinarily don't see that sort of thing in hotels in this modest price range (and that price range, during my stays, was about $130 a night). To be honest, I'm not a big fan of Orlando as a city and typically haven't enjoyed my stays there, so I certainly wasn't expecting much out of an AIRPORT hotel in Orlando. What a pleasant surprise. This is nice hotel for anywhere, let alone for a hotel at an airport. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ckgosch
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very late flight to Orlando and booked this hotel for it's location and ease since it's in the terminal. The staff were very friendly and upgraded us to a corner suite which was very nice. We went to the restaurant and were made welcome even though it was very late. We will be staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Ransit option”
Reviews.Author: Gantravel
Reviews.Content: Was under renovation when we passes thru. Staff still courteous & helpful. Clean tidy roomy. Even tho in a busy international airport, absolutely no noise(?). Would recommend. So convenient as transit location.

Reviews.Title: “Inside the airport”
Reviews.Author: LukeOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The obvious greatest advantage of staying at this Hyatt is that it's built into the MCO international airport of Orlando, therefore it's extremely convenient for layovers. This is pretty much its best feature. Clean, prompt service. A bit overpriced, I would not define it as a luxury hotel, it feels like a 3 (almost 4) star hotel. Rooms do not entirely isolate from the airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Perfect for business traveller!”
Reviews.Author: angelambudd
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Philly around 8:30 and were settled in our room by 9 p.m. It was an executive double, which had a huge private balcony overlooking the runways and airport. Amazing view in the morning. The room was huge with a beautiful bathroom! The room was spotless and I would highly recommend this hotel for a business traveller. We were going to Disney and switched to the Hilton Bonnett Creek, which was closer to Disney and a great place. But, I would not hesitate to stay here again coming in and out of the airport! Best airport hotel in the country!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: jenjen523
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough nice things about this hotel. This hotel is beautiful. Check in was fast and the clerk was friendly. I was on the 10th floor overlooking the airport runways. The pool was also very nice. This hotel was very quiet and elegant. The location inside the Orlando Airport is convienant for traveling out of Orlando. Their is plenty to do and plenty of restaurants to choose to eat from if you choose not to eat at the hotel restaurant. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. I would definately recommend it if you are in Orlando for a short time .

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location ......”
Reviews.Author: Deroney
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest, airport hotels usually leave something ( lots!) to be desired . We've stayed here twice prior to departing for family cruises, and it's convenience can't be beat! Something about walking from your flight directly to your hotel without ever going outside is pretty cool! Along the way from your flights gate to the Hyatt, you'll pass thru myriad of varieties of shops. Our kids especially love the Ron Jons surf shop. The hotel is situated around an atrium which adjoins the airport shops common area. We know there's a pool here, but we've always gotten into the hotel too late and left too early to give it a try. The rates are higher than some of the other airport hotels,but none of them offer the convenience of the Hyatts location. FYI: if you're cruising, your shuttle or limo will pick you up right under the hotel! Again, very convenient. It's location is what sets the Hyatt apart.

Reviews.Title: “Great for travelers”
Reviews.Author: Mike_South_Florida
Reviews.Content: If you are going to be flying out of Orlando International Airport this is a great hotel to stay at to reduce all those airport headaches. The hotel is located inside the airport to make your access easier. The rooms are well built to cut down on all the noise. You also have access to the food court and all the shops on the third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover or cruise”
Reviews.Author: ChefFatCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt because we were going to Port Canaveral the next day to go on a Disney dream cruise. We thought that this was the most convenient choice since we had to catch the bus directly in the downstairs terminal. For about the price of a standard 3 star hotel we got a very nice room with a nice view of the great lobby. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants right in the lobby so you wont get bored. The outdoor pool is decent enough but not spectacular. There is no free breakfast here (downside), but plenty of places to grab a cheap meal in the morning before heading out. All and all this was a very nice, clean, modern hotel that is great if you need a stopover or have to catch a bus for a cruise the next morning. They even took care of our luggage for us and had it placed on the Disney bus so we did not have to. We would definitely stay here again the next time we cruise.

Reviews.Title: “so convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget1234
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very convenient when flying to and from Orlando. We had rented a car and returned it right there in the airport ( no shuttle needed). went right upstairs and checked in. Greeted by Stephanie who was very nice,quick check in. Great room, with balcony looking toward runways. Nice pool ( unfortunately filled with kids with tons of energy after disney) room nice,service nice, printed my boarding passes for me. so easy the morning of our flight, go down elevator, check in for flight and away you go. We got a good price on the room. Hopefully next time will be the same!

Reviews.Title: “Inside the Terminal”
Reviews.Author: NOAAtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located inside the terminal, how convenient is that! You can wander the airport for food, drink, and shopping and head right back up to your room. The huge lobby is first rate. The outside pool is nice and the fitness center first rate. The rooms are not all that big but are nicely decorated. This hotel is probably a little pricier than those around the Disney area but if you can get a decent price and are flying in/out of Orlando Airport, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaBrazil
Reviews.Content: I stayed two times on Hyatt this year. I arrived on May 26th , one day before my cruise . The check-in time was 4pm, but I could got in the room before 12:00. It was very good because my husband and I was very tired from a long flight from Brazil. The room was perfect!!! Very spacious, big bed, beautiful bathroom, very clean. The breakfast is good, about U$15 dólars per person. The waitress who served us was very kind and called us for the last name all the time. The hotel's location is very convenient if you need to go to Port Canaveral for a cruise. In my case , we did the check-out very fast and then take a bus to the Port Canaveral. The Carnival company has a staff to organize the passangers inside the airport. On the second time that we stayed at the hotel was when i returned from a cruise. June 4th. I arrived very early at the hotel , did the check-in and again could entered in the room before the check-in time . I stayed one night before my flight to Las vegas in the next morning. Mr.Richard the concierge was very kind with me. I asked him to call to Las Vegas to confirm a Grand Canyon tour because for me it was a little difficult to talk on the phone. Great service they have if you need a concierge. Before my flight we took another good breakfast in a beautiful lounge. Unfortunately we don't have time to use the swmming pool. The location of the hotel is perfect. If you arrived from another country and need to wait a long time for another flight connection,you can rest on the Hyatt with a great service. There are a lot of restaurantes, coffe shops, stores..., inside the airport. I definitely plan to return in another occasion to this hotel. My husband and I liked very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: travelerUSA21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night as I had an early flight the next day and wanted to be close to the airport. The hotel location can’t be beat. You are right in the middle of the terminal. I arrived and took the escalator to the 4th level which is what they call the main level/lobby. I was quickly checked in and off to my room. The hotel guest floors are large and it was a long walk to the room from elevator, but it was amazing quiet. I figured being at an airport I would hear jet noise, etc. The room was a standard king with large sitting area. The bathroom had a tub and shower stall. The room was clean and functional. I did use the pool which is on a roof overlooking the runways. The pool is not huge, but perfect for a quick dip. I ate dinner at their hotel restaurant and the food was excellent and service extremely friendly. Overall this Hyatt is a perfect place for an overnight stay if your travel plans call for it in Orlando. I learned that they also offer rooms and use of facility for a day rate if you have a long layover. It was 89.00.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for early morning departures”
Reviews.Author: P42DC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before an early morning flight back to west coast. Instead of staying in Lake Mary and having to get up an hour earlier and drive 30 miles. I opted to stay at the Hyatt MCO even though it cost about $20.00 more than staying in Lake Mary. The rooms are clean, staff friendly, and beds cozy. There is ample space in the room for suitcases, however the work desk in a regular room is a bit on the small size. If you don't mind the smell of ginger in your soap and shampoo, then use the provided amenities. However, if you have an allergy to fragrance soaps/shampoos, bring your own as those provided are quite strong. The room offers an LG 37" LED TV, however, it does not have digital (HDTV) service, only analog. The remote control for the TV is an old On Command (circa 1990's) which has seen better days. The room also has wired internet, but when I tried to use it, it was not working. I was able to the the MCO airport free Wi-Fi without issues in my room. There is an in-room coffee maker under the sink as well as an iron/board, hair dryer and refrigerator. There is no safe in the closet. A look under the sheets revealed a well worn mattress pad and a few stains on the king size sheets. The towels were not the quality that I would expect for a Hyatt (Westin has much better for comparison). The carpet was in good condition and no stains were evident. Over all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of Orlando's Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: crazyhotelguy
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando, but stay at the Hyatt MCO quite frequently due to my travel for work and leisure. This hotel takes convenient to a new level when it comes to flying out of the Orlando Airport, but it is so much more than an airport hotel. My partner and I always make it a point to arrive at a decent hour so that we can enjoy the hotel and not just use it for a stay before a flight. They have a great pool deck with excellent views of the runways and it can be cool to watch the planes depart and land while sipping a cocktail and enjoying warm FL weather. The rooms are large and confortable. I have not had a bad room, but I do prefer the atrium rooms as I like to people watch. I also like to see how long the security line is before going downstairs. Breakfast in Hemispheres on the 9th floor is nice as well. It has a panoramic view of the runways and is great for plane watching. The staff is very friendly and goes out of their way to accommodate. I will continue to enjoy this home away from home in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank3355
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and did again twice in the past week. As usual, I had great stays with rooms facing inward to watch all the people running around below. For whatever reason I really enjoy standing on the balcony and watching that, and I've never had any trouble with noise from below nor from planes above. I also enjoyed sitting by the pool and watching the planes take off above me. And for dinner I had their crawfish chowder at McCoys. It is a hefty $7 for a bowl, but it is one of the best soups I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “best airport hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: desi3
Reviews.Content: the hyatt hotel at orlando airport , is built into the airport .this is definatly the closest hotel you will get to any airport in the world .this hotel has pamoramic views of the runways and rooms over looking inside the airport itself . staff are really friendly and helpful , the rooms are are a good size with marble bathrooms with a really powerful shower . the beds are 2 queen beds or 1 king size bed ,we had a king size bed which was really big and it has to be said one of the most comfortable beds i ever slept on . the room has a large plasma tv with fridge .again for a airport hotel soundproof rooms really quiet at night .their is also a swimming pool on the 6th floor you can sunbath or like me do some plane spotting with great runway views .at check in their is loovely big soft sofa,s to relax in .we always spend the last night of our holiday here for a good nights sleep before our overnight flight the next day .this hotel really makes you feel welcome . desi hunter n.ireland .virgin atlantic customer

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if u wanna delay ur trip home by one night”
Reviews.Author: intangibleve
Reviews.Content: Awesome room and service. Great eats within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location.”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: Every time I have an early morning flight I wished I could just roll out of bed and get on my plane, rather than drive the 40 miles between my home and the airport. On our last trip we decided to see how effective staying right at the airport would be. We loved it. Now I wished every airport we ever used was located right in the airport. It was exceptionally convenient to dress, call a bell hop and go directly to luggage drop. There were no worries about a flat tire delaying our drive to the airport. We did not even have to worry about managing all of our luggage. The Hyatt lives up to the standards of a good four star hotel. The rooms are spacious. The beds were exceptionally comfortable, and the pillows were outstanding. The linens were high quality. The glasses were made from heavy, well-weighted glass and the amenities were excellent. We requested, and received a room overlooking the inside of the airport. We could stand on our balcony and watch passengers hurrying to security lines. We did not eat at the hotel because both restaurants were more expensive than we wished to pay for a hotel meal. There are plenty of dining options in the airport itself. We opted for the Macaroni Grill. I cannot say enough good things about the service. When we arrived a bell man greeted us, loaded up our luggage and told us he would deliver it to our room. Check-in was quick and painless. When our luggage arrived the bell man identified us by our names, as did every other employee we encountered in the hotel. I really appreciated the assistance with the luggage, and when it was delivered the man asked for the time of our departure and told us he would make sure someone came and picked it up and took it to luggage check-in. This happened very smoothly. In addition to a generous tip for luggage service, the hotel also has a charge for luggage delivered to the luggage drop of the airport, but it was only $10, and that is no more than I pay when I do curbside check-in. Of course, the tip to the bell man was more, but it was really worth it. Our balcony had not been cleaned when we arrived in our room. A quick call to housekeeping produced someone who cleaned it quickly, and wished us well using our name. I had two unique issues with this hotel. My first issue was with the hot water. I had planned on a long bath before bed. When I got into the tub the water was only tepid. I let it run for a long time, and the temperature did not improve. A call to the front desk revealed that a water heater was not functioning. I checked it occasionally through out the night. Hot water was not available until 6am. We mentioned this problem when we checked out, and received a fair compensation for the inconvenience. My second problem was a bit more serious. When I received my bank statement the room charge was accurately subtracted, but there was an additional charge for $70.58. A call to the hotel revealed that this charge was for a lunch eaten in the hotel three days after we checked out. I was a little disturbed by the fact that it seemed like the hotel could so easily charge this meal to our portfolio, which should have indicated that we had left long before this lunch. The lady that managed this issue was not particularly polite. After several assurances that we did not eat at the hotel three days after we left, I offered to produce our boarding passes. I really did not think it was my obligation to prove I was innocent of the charges. Eventually she agreed to credit our account, but she was not happy. I asked her how something like this could happen, and she said it happens all of the time. She said guests often charge meals to their rooms, but they forget their room numbers and charges often go to the wrong guest. She did not have a good explanation for why they would charge something to a portfolio that indicated the guests had been gone for three days. I was quite concerned because she said this situation happens "all the time". This problem was not sufficient to prevent us from making reservations for a trip we are taking soon, but I will be watching my credit card account online to make sure that no additional charges appear after we have checked out. This would be my suggestion to any other guest staying at this hotel. Overall, we had a very enjoyable experience at the Hyatt located in the airport, and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: vancouverpatel
Reviews.Content: I had booked 2 rooms and had confirmed the number of people in each group and was shocked when the group of 3 were given a room with one King size bed! That was after I had called ahead of the arrival date to confirm the room arrangement. When I questioned the person working at the Guest Services, I was told that because I had booked rooms via a travel agency and not directly online with them, they do not need to guarantee the room type. I could not believe what I was hearing and decided to talk to the Conceirge, who was a really professional lady by the name of Heerena. She listened patiently to me while I told her that its absurd that bookings made via a travel agent does not provide a bed per person! Afterall, even that much is obtained checking into the cheapest motels and we are talking about a high end hotel like Hyatt. She promptly rectified the situation and saved the day.Needless to say, the person who worked at Guest Services needs to know that customers are not dumb and will not buy any ridiculous story/excuses they give because they had overbooked their rooms. The rooms were nice, but the noise level was again quite bad. NO, not from the airport traffic, but inconsiderate guests who were screaming and kids running down the hall, slamming their room doors etc late into the night and early hours of the morning, which made is very difficult to sleep. Not sure I would stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloPundit
Reviews.Content: It's a hotel airport, so you pay a premium for unbelievable convenience. We stayed in a room with two double beds on the 6th floor with an outside view towards the east (we were treated to a gorgeous sunrise in the morning). The room was quite large - bigger than expected. The bathroom was also quite large and well appointed - everything in the room seemed to have been recently updated and was new and clean. We had a relatively early flight, and my request for a wake-up call, made at check-in, was honored, and not by a robot, but by a person. We hung a morning room service breakfast order out, and it was delivered exactly on time at 6am, as requested, by a friendly waiter. The room was quite warm when we arrived, but we cranked the air and it quickly cooled down wonderfully. As for the convenience? We had a 7:45 flight at gate 122. Having checked in with Southwest the night before (right downstairs at a kiosk), we checked out at 7 and had time to do some last-minute shopping at the Disney store before joining the security line. We were at our gate within minutes. It enabled us to get some extra, much-needed, rest after a busy day at the Harry Potter park at Universal. I would definitely recommend to anyone who needs to get in and out of MCO quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for early departure and when travelling with a child!”
Reviews.Author: Heaven28
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night after our Disney cruise as our next day flight had an early departure. It was sooo conveniently located! We had a good evening shopping in the airport and even ate there since we were too tired to go out and explore any further. It's a bit more expensive but it was so well worth it. I was a little frustrated with the front desk woman who was checking us in. She lacked major communication skills and when I asked her to repeat things cause I couldn't figure out what she's saying, she would repeat it as though I was the one with the language barrier! We had requested a runway view (for an additional cost) and to be at a higher level and with a balcony. They assured we had all of that in the room, and we did except that the runway was obstructed by a part of the building by more than half! So our balcony was facing a big brick wall and a bit of the runway. The room (king size bed) was ok sized and nicely designed but our bathroom was clogged and it made showers and bathing our toddler really inconvenient. We requested a bed for our toddler but it wasn't there when we got in the room and had to call and remind them. It was an actual metal crib (smaller sized) and not a pack'n'play. Overall good stay, minus a couple of issues.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: DebOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel with excellent service. Everyone was very welcoming. Room service was prompt, the food was good, and though you are in the heart of the Orlando airport, the room was quiet and peaceful. It was nice to have the patio space outside, even though the noise of the airport came with it. The only issue is that the elevators get really jammed up at peak times, so book a low floor if you have more bags than you can carry, and need to check out during the morning rush (7-9am).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. The convenience can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: rpach10115
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in late August before our Disney trip. I like to fly in the night before and stay here before we do Disney. This is our 4th time doing this and the convenience can't be beat. This is a sanctuary in the middle of a very busy place. The front desk attendee's are very professional and will research any request you may have. We like this place because we can wake up the next morning, grab the rental car from the counters downstairs in the airport, and go. The rooms are typical Hyatt, which means they are top-notch. Very clean,and comfortable. Our flight from NY was delayed 5 hours. We arrived @ 1am and they gave us a room right away. We were in bed 30 minutes after stepping off the plane!

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: Floridalynn28
Reviews.Content: If you are taking an early flight out of Orlando International Airport this is the best place to stay. On other trips with early departures I stayed at local hotels and got shuttled to the airport. I was always worried that the shuttle wouldn't be there on time. At the Hyatt you walk out of the Hyatt into the airport. This was great and worth spending a little more.

Reviews.Title: “A great place and great service”
Reviews.Author: SamuelChamplain
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights because our flight was cancelled because of an hurricane. I was amazed at the room size. Our room was facing outside the building and add a large bacony with a small table and two chairs, to relax outside. The insonorisation is perfect and we were not annoyed by airplanes. The bathroom is great, I haven't seen anything like that I my modest hotel resident experience. There is a separate shower from the bath and a complete and separate sink and counter. The service was great. My son was celebrating a birthday so when we ordered a piece of cake from the room service they accepted to add a candle and provide matches so we could have a small celebration. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. The only downside is the internet. They charge for a wired service and propopse that we use the airport wireless service for free access. The problem is that the airport system is unreliable and the connection is always interrupted.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulEBNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a before the crack of dawn flight. This was a great choice. It is nice to roll our of bed and through airport security without having to deal with shuttle vans. The hotel is well maintained and appointed. The location, perfect. The value was great especially when look at with the convenience factor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Rockinjla
Reviews.Content: I had a national sales meeting at the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport and was skeptical about staying in a hotel attached to an airport. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. The hotel was quite clean and lots of nice, open public spaces. The meeting space was quite extensive and not what I would expect for an airport hotel. Even the majority of the meals I had at the meeting were not bad (for hotel food). The only negative, I think, for the meeting space was the staff. You could not seem to find someone when you needed an extra chair, flip chart, etc. The guest rooms were nice, but I would request a room facing the outside, not the atrium of the airport. A few mornings the noise of the airport woke me up and my view was the TSA line. Not the best view I have had. The room was a decent size and comfortable, but I have to say needed a good dusting. The convenience factor for flying in and out was quite nice and I was impressed with the outside pool area. Not a bad place to be for a business meeting…. But you do get a little stir crazy being inside all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelcoleen
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay when you have a flight the following day. We enjoyed the airport location and the fact that we just rolled our suitcases from the room and checked into our flight. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Been To”
Reviews.Author: ferrari2197
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Orlando Airport was honeslty the best hotel I've ever stayed at. The rooms were modern, comfy, large, and the bathroom was amazing. The hotel itself was in the airport which is a great advantage. It was modern and the service was spectacular. They have a full Fitness Center and pool was very unique, out on the roof overlooking the airport. I stayed here because Delta overbooked out flight and put us in a room for free. Great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful room for a tired family”
Reviews.Author: sprout5
Reviews.Content: After our flight put us into Orlando in the wee hours of the morning, my children and I decided not to drive home, but stay the night 'upstairs' in the Hyatt. We had a reservation for a room with 2 full-sized beds, but upon check-in, I inquired about other room availability to give us more sleeping space. The check-in gentleman gave us an upgraded room at the same cost which was wonderful. Mind you, it was after 2 a.m.! This hotel sits on top of Orlando International Airport and we've used it in the past for early morning flights. The elevator from the airport leads you only to the check-in level. You can only access the room levels and restaurants with your room card. This is an added security comfort for hotel guests. The rooms can be quite a walk from the reception area, but the halls are wide, have fountains (which shut off at night), and greenery for a peaceful, relaxed atmosphere. We've had rooms overlooking the garage area and rooms overlooking the airport lobby and they are so quiet! It's quite unbelievable. Our room had a king bed and a pullout sofa bed. The linens and pillows, etc were clean, not worn, and well-presented. There was ample room for luggage. There was a bathtub and a separate shower in the bathroom. Lots of room in the bathroom, too. There was a big walk-in closet with robe, a desk, and more that I didn't really pay attention to as our goal was just to sleep! It was a treat to have such a clean room with ample space for us to sleep after a long travel day. We've never been disappointed at this hotel. In the morning, we did go upstairs to the restaurant for breakfast. We ate at the buffet which had child and adult prices. They also had a menu you could order from, due to a time issue, we just ate at the buffet. The restaurant overlooks the runways and is an elegant restaurant. The servers were professional and the food was fresh, varied, and delicious. Absolutely no complaints. Even though the restaurant was more elegant than usual restaurant buffets, the clientele attire was family casual. We will not hesitate to use or recommend this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A very Convenient Respite from Travel”
Reviews.Author: eugene712
Reviews.Content: This is a very delayed review of this well located hotel. We (me, my wife and 5 year old daughter) came in from Long Island barely escaping a snowstorm in March 2007. Our flight was delayed by several hours and we finally left McArthur Airport past 8PM. So we arrived at Orlando International almost 11 PM. Luckily I had booked this hotel in transition to our Cruise with the Carnival Sensation to the Bahamas. The delays caused by the unforseen snowstorm nearly put a damper on our plans. Luckily, We had booked one night at this hotel prior to departing for Cocoa Beach/Cape Canaveral. Let me tell you, the convenience of getting one's luggage knowing your hotel is a few steps away from the luggage carousel spells R-E-L-I-E-F. Thank goodness I did not have to think of any Airport Transfer. The bed is really something one needs to experience or was I that tired? All I can say...is that, it was an Oasis. Clean Room with sound proofing. All the amenities were in the bathroom. I cannot say enough about how I slept after my shower. The next morning..We woke up refreshed and ready for the cruise. We will be coming back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuckert
Reviews.Content: Oh man, I love this place. The rooms and beds are VERY comfortable. My wife and I took our niece to Disney this past week, and our flight got in about 9pm. I can't tell you how happy I was to book this hotel since we pretty much just walked off the plane, walked out past security and went up the escalator to check right in. The convenience of not having to haul your luggage down to baggage claim and waiting to take a shuttle bus to a hotel was worth every penny I paid for that room. The swimming pool was awesome and we got to enjoy it for about an hour after we checked in! And let me tell you, having the food court downstairs right around the corner was just the icing on the cake. People with a budget on food can definitely appreciate that. The staff was very warm and friendly too. I can't wait to travel down to Orlando again so I can book this hotel again. Looking forward to it already.

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Leshaface
Reviews.Content: My husband, my brother, my sister in law, and I all stayed here the night before our Disney Bahamian Cruise. I must say it was SO nice to be able to step off the plane, grab our luggage from Baggage Claim, and walk straight to the hotel check-in, without having to worry about taking cabs/rental cars to our destination. The rooms were VERY large and comfortable with lots of room to spread out. There was even a verandah that looked out into the middle of the airport. Bathrooms were very clean and spacious as well. The fitness center was a little on the small side, but had very up-to-date fitness equipment. Clean and nice. There is even a pool outside, along with a large deck area, where my brother and husband shared some beer and a cigar. I MUST recommend McCoy's Bar and Grill located in the hotel. We ordered some of the sushi on their menu, and it was fresh and yummy. They have a full bar here. I would DEFINITELY recommend staying at the Hyatt Regency again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great choice before or after cruising”
Reviews.Author: dballou
Reviews.Content: We had never considered staying at an airport hotel, but now that we have, we thought it was the coolest thing and obviously the most convenient. Staff was super helpful, rooms were clean and surprisingly quiet. We all loved being in the airport when it was practically empty. We loved going out on our balcony to watch the air traffic. Pool on the roof was pretty and fun. Best part is that for Disney cruises, they take your bags and check them the whole way to your cabin (maybe other cruise lines have this too I don't know) and we were able to handle all of our cruise check in right there and just enjoy our travel to the ship and get right on.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: 1234lolola
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport before an early flight to New York the next morning. The hotel is conveniently located in the airport terminal and serves as a great place to relax before an early flight. The hotel has all the amenities of a four star hotel (business center, great staff, room service etc. (which I did not use, but noticed that they were available) plus the added benefit of being in airport which gives you the ability to cheaper food and entertainment options. The rooms were will appointed with up-to-date furniture, fixtures, and appliances. Nothing too special but everything that you would need in a hotel was there. Rooms have balconies which is a nice added touch. Didn't really interact with staff (used kiosk check-in and check-out; was only there for one night so did not have housekeeping) but I am sure those are up-to-standard services that one would expect from a Hyatt Regency Hotel. Hotel was booked through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, planning our next trip”
Reviews.Author: PunkyBrewster57
Reviews.Content: Our local airport does direct flights to Orlando three times weekly for a great price, so when we went on our latest cruise in May, 2011 we stayed at the Hyatt overnight and caught the boat the next day. We didn't get to check in until after midnight due to weather conditions and a lay over but the staff was very helpful and welcoming. Our room was awesome. It is by far one of the nicest room I've stayed in. Very clean and very welcoming. I thought the noise would be an issue with it being in the airport but it actually was not. We had a nice overlook of the inside of the airport which made it fun to people watch the next am. Overall we are planning our next cruise and staying here again is already in the works! The only bad thing is the pool was closed. I am unsure if it was just early in the season or if there was other things going on. Pool area looked nice from what you could see.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eblis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night between our honeymoon in Disney World and our flight home. What a great idea it was to stay at this Hyatt. FIrst of all, being right in the airport terminal, the hotel was literally steps from our check in desk. In the morning we got up early, went downstairs with our luggage and checked in with our airline. Then we had a couple hours until we needed to go through security so we were able to go back to the hotel and have a nice breakfast before we had to fly. The hotel room itself was very nice. Our room had a great view of some of the tarmac at the airport. The noise level was very good, especially considering that we were only a few hundred feet away from jets taking off and landing. We had a very large room with a king-sized bed, a small sitting area with a couch and two chairs and a large bathroom that had both a shower and bathtub. Service was fantastic and the cleanliness was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawk1tdh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel several times. Never a bad time!! The staff is the ultimate best ever!! I have never been in such a place where they ask a million times if their is anything they can do for you. The rooms are very clean and the maids work their butts off!! The lobby bar and Mccoy's are great with some great people working their!! Food is outstanding!!! An airport hotel thats a little pricey at times but very well worth it!!! The entire staff makes you feel welcome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Truly Wonderful Stay at a Beautiful Hyatt with AMAZING Service!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyVin
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport Dates of Stay: Wednesday 7/27/11 - Thursday, 7/28/11 Total Nights: 1 In a nutshell, this Hyatt offers stellar customer service, beautiful rooms and is in the perfect location at the Orlando International Airport -- this property should not be missed by anyone traveling to or from Orlando International. Now, for my detailed review: First, I need to preface this review by stating that it builds upon my detailed prior review of this property. I have posted one prior review of this property, and the service continues to exceed my expectations! Please see that prior review for further information on this property: “An absolutely amazing start to my honeymoon! A perfect honeymoon stay!” - September 11, 2011 My wife and I have previously stayed at this property twice, the last time being the start to our honeymoon. As we approached our one-year anniversary and had an early flight out to Jamaica, we could think of no better place to kick off our anniversary trip! And, true to my prior experiences, the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport continued to far exceed my expectations! For those who do not know much about this property, it is actually located within the Atrium area of the Orlando International Airport -- conveniently located above a main TSA Security Checkpoint. The lobby is located on the 4th Floor of the airport, with convenient access directly into the airport's Terminal Top Parking Garage -- allowing for quick and easy park and fly ability. As for parking, this property has 4 and 7-day "Park and Fly" rates that can be booked to allow one to stay for one night prior to his or her trip yet park for the entire trip. Additionally, should you not wish to pay for such a rate, the hotel does offer discounted parking for the period that you are actually staying. Guests have a choice of Valet of Self Park in the Terminal Top Garage, and rates are quite economical. For your nights actually at the Hyatt, Self Parking is $12/day and Valet is $16/day; for nights subsequent to your stay, you will be charged the normal airport rate of $17/day for Self Parking or $25/day for Valet Parking. Compared to most airports, this is a very economical option, and I highly suggest actually parking at the airport. Upon check-in, you will be given a "Parking Exit Pass" to show to the Parking Agent so that your rates can be charged accordingly. This option worked perfectly for us, and very easily exited the garage with the first night's parking properly discounted without issue. One tip -- if at all possible, try to park on Level 4 of the Terminal Top Garage, as that is the floor with direct access to the Hyatt. After we had parked, we were able to enter the Hyatt's beautiful main lobby quickly, and check-in was, as always, extremely polite and efficient. We were greeted by name, and the Front Desk Agent immediately wished us "Happy Anniversary." The level of customer service at this property is truly top-notch, and repeat guests are always warmly welcomed back by name. She checked us in extremely quickly and kindly, and within a matter of minutes, we were relaxing in our VIP Suite for the night. If you have read my prior review, you saw a detailed description of a VIP Suite at this property. This VIP Suite, however, was slightly different -- and, in fact, I much preferred this room. We had been assigned room 6121, and it was located in the perfect location -- on the 6th floor, directly adjacent to the swimming pool, and extremely close to the StayFit Gym. As you walk into the room, you enter into a beautifully decorated dining area, with a large dining table, perfectly suited for in-room dining. However, the thing that most caught my eye upon entering the room was the bathroom -- this VIP Suite has one of the most amazing bathrooms that I have seen! It is located immediately to your right upon entry into the room, and the first thing one will notice is the massive whirlpool bathtub. Large steps allow one entry into this huge tub, perfectly suited to handle more than one person comfortably. There is also an extremely large glass shower, a beautiful vanity and dressing area, along with a toilet area and a second sink. This definitely surprised me, as I had no idea that this property had such lavish bathrooms available! But, it was not just the bathroom -- this room truly was amazing. As you continue into the room from the dining area, you enter a large sitting area with extremely comfortable couches and a large HD-television. This room is partially separated by a divider wall to the bedroom area, which features an extremely comfortable Hyatt Grand Bed, a chair and ottoman, and a work desk with wired internet port. Then, both the bedroom and the sitting room have separate balconies, which offer plush and comfortable lounge chairs to sit out and get some sun while allowing for a beautiful view of the runways. And, in case you are worried about noise, this property is sound-proofed extremely well, and when inside the room, we were unable to hear any plane noise. All in all, an extremely beautiful room that allowed for a wonderfully relaxing evening to start our anniversary trip. As for dining on property, the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport offers a number of dining options -- we opted for a romantic room service dinner. I must say, the room service food was excellent! The food was extremely delicious, and the service was amazing. Food arrived quickly and was still piping hot. I would highly recommend utilizing room service at this property, as it is some of the best room service around! And, in addition to our room service dinner, I had requested my Diamond Amenity as a food option, and I promptly received a bottle of Merlot and the cookies and chocolate, which served as a truly perfect dessert to an excellent dinner! But, on top of that, the General Manager sent us a bottle of champagne and some heavenly chocolate covered strawberries in recognition of our anniversary. Such amazing customer service is common place at this property, which is why it is not to be missed! Especially as this property offers some truly high quality Diamond Amenity choices to loyal Diamond Level Members of the Hyatt Gold Passport Program. One final word about dining, this property offers and excellent breakfast at Hemispheres, located on the 9th Floor. There is a wonderful buffet, along with the typical Hyatt breakfast menu. Service is excellent, and the runway views are beautiful. It truly is a great breakfast -- and, there are many rate options under which this breakfast is included, so keep a look out. All-in-all, the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport is a truly wonderful property in the perfect location, with customer service that continues to excel with each visit. If you need a place to stay before or after a flight, this is one property that you definitely must not miss!

Reviews.Title: “Soooooo Convenient”
Reviews.Author: OcalaGator
Reviews.Content: If you are flying from Orlando International Airport park at "Fast Park and Relax" stay overnight at the Hyatt Orlando International Airport. It is so easy to wake up and be at the airport in a very nice and comfortable hotel. This place was buit at the airport so it was very well soundproofed. Get an "inside" room and you cant hear much of anything, much less the planes. It was pretty expensive but they have many discounts (AAA, AARP, Govt. etc).
