Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are flying in and don't have a car.”
Reviews.Author: HollyGio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because my son was playing in a chess tournament which took place in one of the ballrooms. If we were flying in from out of town, this would be perfect! Since we drove, we had to pay $12/day to park because parking is inside the airport parking lot. That is $5 less than normal airport parking, but still pretty steep. Be sure to ask the front desk for a parking voucher to use on your way out. The signs for parking are not very clear. They also have valet parking if you continue past the sign for the hotel parking, you will see the valet parking just ahead. The rooms are nice and the bathrooms are great with a separate shower and bath and two sink areas. Our room also had a fridge which was great. The hotel itself does not offer internet because the airport has free wifi (which may not work on all floors). We booked through AAA so our room came with free breakfast for 2 (although we are a family of 4). They have a great breakfast buffet open from 6:30-noon. We ate dinner one night in their restaurant on the lobby level. The food was good and I loved that they offer a tapas menu where you can select 3 items for $16.95. Yum! If you want to save on eating out, just take the escalator down one level to the airport straight ahead to the food court. There are several options there and if you continue ahead, there is a Chili's Too. That part of the airport is almost like a mall with shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the terminal. In fact, some of the rooms overlook the concourse. I loved the fact that I walked out of my room and right to security a few levels below. The room is a basic room, but it had a nice balcony and was across from the fitness center. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location good if your catching a flight”
Reviews.Author: labcoatwearer
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for a conference.Cool location inside the airport. Airport mall is a short walk away with nice shopping and a foodcourt. Service was a disappointment at every instance. Would stay here only if I had to catch a flight at an inconvenient hour and needed some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport but Not Overly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: T32137
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for an early morning flight. I asked for a room with two beds but when we arrived at the appointed room it was a king size bed. We were promptly switched to a room w/two beds however, it appeared to be in the family section with lots of kids! The air didn't work in the new room so two maintenance guys were dispatched to work on it . While the air was being worked on we realized there was no tv remote anywhere - fortunately one of the maintenance men was able to rustle one up. Also discovered there was not a room service menu or information book in the room. Ended up having dinner at McCoy's Bar & Grill which was OK but nothing special for the price & service was not up to par! Upon returning to the room we realized the air conditioning was still not cooling well but it was late so we decided to "live with it", but the room was quiet warm during the night. The beds however were comfy! Oh yeah ... didn't realize it at first but the room was a handicapped room with no bathtub but a big open shower to roll a wheelchair in ... kinda weird! I did mention at checkout the problems we encountered and after a nice apology I was not charged for the cost of an in-room movie. Valet parking was convenient and easy and the parking staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Tech/Media Deficiencies Persist; Serious Problems @ Pool; Still, Tho, A Quality Property In Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Writingandtravel
Reviews.Content: We visited a Year and a half ago, and they put us in a king-room that was close to where we stayed last time. Overall: The reason we returned was precisely because the Hyatt sits atop Orlando/MCO Airport. Hugely convenient! Sixty seconds and you are in the A/P. It's got two good restaurants, a rooftop pool (with bar and bar-menu service), and an excellent fitness center. No WiFI here in this room on the ninth floor. It's too far from the free MCO Airport WiFi. So my option was to pay for it. I realized then that it would have been nicer to have the same kind of room on one of the balcony rooms that overlooks the pool (which is on a piece of the roof of the sixth floor) or that overlooks the inside of the airport. We didn't call the person assigned t me as a Passport member. My mistake; the front desk was this nice guy who would have moved me if I asked. So moving on... I had movies DLed from PB on my hard-drive, so I figured we'd watch them on the laptop. This is a very insulated building and is very quiet! Kids were screaming in the atrium outside our door around 10:00 PM, but that's a clientele problem that the hotel also suffers with, like we did. Otherwise, a very good room. I got it free on my Hyatt Passport (from staying in the Hollywood and Mexico Hyatts). We got two drinks each (two Sam Adams and two bloody marys) at the pool: 42 bucks, and I added a couple more bucks, even though a 6 dollar tip already had been added. Expensive, but it's travel, right? We want to make the most of the non-business times, i.e., the evenings. What always surprises me at Hyatt is how they think they're catering to "business" travelers with expensive and archaic technology/media. For instance, our room had three landlines--two within reach of each other in the room and one in the WC, which always makes me think of the 1980s and yuppies. One would be needed for intra-hotel calls. Who, I wonder, doesn't use his/her cell primarily? Then they drop the paper version of the Wall Street Journal at the door in the morning, which is to say they think I want to read some day-old Rupert Murdoch ideology that I can access easy enough online, "IF" I had WiFi. I'll bet most of their business travelers don't use either the landlines or read the newspapers. Why not put the things we need in the rooms? How about a plug/outlet thing for our devices on the desk and get rid of the stationary--like I'm gonna write a card to someone??? Having access to a monitor and basic sound-system, which could be primarily for the shrinking pool of cable-viewing old folks and families, would allow those of us in the current tech/media ecology to be productive during our stay. Run-of-the-mill, i.e., your current and regular business visitors are going to be new-tech-connected business visitors (80% of their trade). They will have AV, HDMI, and VGA adaptors and cords. And they won't opt for the wired (i.e., obsolete) connection that is ten bucks a day (i.e., rip-off!) Probably only about 20% of their trade has pad-able travel expense accounts and pay 10 bucks a day for WiFi. I'm talking to you, Hyatt Central: We need WiFi in every room at every Hyatt because that's what we use for business. I'm out of touch, laptop-wise, when I stay at a Hyatt. All I have is my phone for a connection to my work. Here at Orlando, they need to insure that every room gets free MCO WiFi, and where it isn't available, take care of the problem, but not by charging some rooms when others get it free!!! A nice surprise was to see that the room's television monitor would easily accept an HDMI cord, so that was a plus. I mean, come on, I'm going to be honest here. I might want to UL or DL a movie from PB and then out-port it to the monitor to watch later. Generally, I'm not going to pay for content when I can get it for free, especially when Hyatt charges ten bucks per PPV. This next one is looking toward the future, but some hotels might want to think about culling back their cable choices. Again: ideology, People!!!! Don't be such an obvious tool of the right, Hyatt!!!! I don't need Fox Business Channel! Like I want to watch people who know less about the market than I do. And you can start seeing how many visitors actually want the rest of the angry-scream-athon channels that parade as news, fact-free opinions, and waste-of-time information. Help me here, Hyatt. Get me connected and dump the 1980s' business amenities. Help me get my work done when I stay with you, and to do that, you need to get on top of the tech problem you're getting swallowed by. Doubletrees all offer free WiFi, but they are not as nice as Hyatts. That's one thing I think about when I book hotels. HIltons are like you: still offering old-people business amenities. You've got style in your rooms and public spaces (not so much here, but generally speaking Hyatts are pretty upscale and stylish). Now why don't you put what we need in the rooms so that staying there offers us the same tech/media amenities as home? Otherwise, very comfortable king mattress, great linens on the bed, although the bath towels were a bit worn, and amenities were all as good as we would use at home: our standard for assessment. Their channel 5, I think it is, shows a marketing loop of Hyatt hotels and resorts, and there was something wrong with it all evening: it kept repeating every ten seconds. Now I know that Hyatt can do better because in the Cancun, Mexico, Hyatt there were three or so 20-minute loops, and the music was just right on them, so we actually watched them voluntarily to check out the visuals for some other Hyatt properties. Orlando lost a valuable opportunity to showcase other Hyatt properties to us last night. But technology, as in Mexico--where the WiFi needs to be free and strong since cell phone and data plan coverage costs US travelers extra--is not Hyatt's forte. They need to get the same tech emphasis that they are showing in their decor. One final note: the pool is in terrible shape: the liner is literally coming up throughout the whole pool (Hello, Property Manager! Get on this pronto! It's potentially dangerous for children!!!), the place out there needs a coat of paint and some renovations, too, and they play music from the 1980s, which, after seeing the 1980s' tech/media in the rooms, makes me wonder if someone with some ironic self-awareness was making a subtle joke. Another joke is how both restaurants, which are nice (except for having like zero vegetarian entrees!!!) subject diners to an unwanted survey by the hostess. Both restaurants need to seat diners immediately, not subject them to questions about my name and room number--I'm staying there; figure it out when I charge it to my room! This happened a year ago last January, when we stayed there before. The front desk guy pitched a reservation at the restaurant, which we could see was not packed, at check-in, when we were only interested in getting the bags into the room and planning out our next stage of the day. Hello! I'm staying here, it's the airport, you've got to be kidding if you think I'm going to go down and thru TSA to eat. Last year, on the next morning, we went to the ninth floor Hemisphere Restaurant, where the view is great and the buffet is quite good but overpriced, and before we were brought to a table, we were questioned, while the answers were written in pencil, for what I can only imagine is some corporate assessment: "Name? How do you spell that? Staying here? What room?" This inane surveying continues, and it is a total waste of my time and transparently the brainchild of some genius at what? Morgan-Stanley or whichever one of the other unaccountable big-bankster holding companies that, unfortunately, owns Hyatt??? Total waste of our time and a great way to alienate customers. One other thing: much of the clientele is fly-over state rubes who think flambe classes up a menu and doesn't worry if their ill-behaving-kids run around and do whatever they want. Orlando is a magnet for square-state families that eat American cheese on white bread. Many downtown hotels and ones near the Orlando resorts cater to these people, and so the bar is lowered all over the place: the best beer on the menu will be Sam Adams and Rodney Strong will be the best red. The wear and tear from the clientele will not be noticed by the self-same clientele, because "back home," they live porcinely. It's a shame that Hyatt doesn't try harder to be better than their competitors in this environment of lowered expectations. There's a video of our stay at my profile: Jeffhfromoxford; use the hotel name to search YouTube.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: benhochschwender
Reviews.Content: Did not spend alot of time here. But we deffinetly spent enough time at this place to know it was an awesome hotel. Not noisy at all with the airplanes.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, It is Good---But It Is In the Airport, that's the Problem!”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: My wife had some friends flying into Orlando. So we flew from Atlanta into Tampa Airport (yes, Tampa because it was half the fare vs. Orlando International) and took a rental car to Orlando. I thought getting a decent hotel at a decent rate would be no problem in Orlando. Well that didn't work out that well. So I hopped to priceline and aimed for store near the amusement parks with a bid of about $48 ($50 or less is my favorite). That didn't work so I expanded the search to the Orlando airport area and raised the bid about $4. To my shock instead of LaQuinta, Comfort Inn or others in the area that I was familiar with, the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport, took the bid. Should have been excited right? Well, no! I knew the hotel would be good. But unless you are actually flying into and out of that airport, then stay away. Location: I love a bargain and the hotel was nice, upscale, clean and have a great view of the main travel lobby. However, it is a major pain getting into the airport. We arrived at night and literally rolled around the airport at least three times because of the poor signage for the hotel. You finally realize it was Terminal B parking. The signs lead you almost all the way to the top of the parking garage and then the signs kind of disappear again. Again signage is the issue. You come into the terminal and walk about a good ten minutes and finally someone point you out of your confusion to the welcome desk for the hotel. You may say why do I focus on this? Simple, getting a bargain is a good thing, but if you have to go to excessive amounts of hassle to take advantage of that bargain, then is it really a bargain? For me, getting a good price, zipping into a free parking lot ($17 for parking here), and finding a really nice hotel for a price that is noticeably less than expected, that is a bargain. Again, no problems with the hotel, and if you are flying out of this airport then this is great. But if you just want a nice hotel in the Orlando area and are not flying out of the airport, then avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: powerplantop
Reviews.Content: I arrived at MCO late and had an early morning flight so I did not check out eveything. But the room was very nice, clean, comfy and very quite. I had a great few hour sleep before my flight.

Reviews.Title: “So very convenient when taking an early flight or arriving late”
Reviews.Author: Loves2TravelALOT_11
Reviews.Content: This place is right in the center of the Orlando airport so its perfect if you arrive late or have an early morning flight. I've stayed here before but this time it wasn't quite as restful. True, it is summer but there were many families staying here with children running up and down the halls until very late. The rooms are very nice and the restaurant is as well. Reasonable room pricing too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel - avoid shuttles!”
Reviews.Author: JohnDougall
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. If you need to stay around the airport - stay AT the airport. I flew in from Europe and decided to bed down for the night and take advantage of my jetlag for an early start next morning. Got a GREAT rate and actually enjoyed standing on my balcony watching the airport hussle and bussle. It also means you have access to the free airport WiFi and all its' stores and restaurants (so a cheapie McD's breakfast next morning!). Rooms and all public areas are spotlessly clean and just cool.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yunwwang
Reviews.Content: Arrived around midnight. The front desk agent was very kind. Welcomed me by name. One strange thing is that I asked to have higher floor room with my booking but was given a room in the middle (6th floor). Not a big problem. The hotel itself doesn't have WIFI but I was told that all rooms having access to airport's free WIFI. Not so true. My room is a corner room facing outside. There's no signal in my room. I asked the front desk the 2nd morning and was given another room facing inside. This time I could access airport WIFI. The room does have wired network. Another issue is that the number of power outlets in the guest room is really limited. I found only two which are hidden under desks. I cannot charge my laptop, tablet and cell phone at the same time. The room is nice and clean. I thought it's going to be noisy because of the airport but the room is surprisingly quiet. I overslept for the first two nights and had to setup a clock alarm after. Restaurant at 9th floor is really good. It could be crowded for breakfast during weekend. So go there earlier if you don't want to wait. The location is really convenient. Just inside airport. About 20-30 minutes drive to downtown or Disney. Overall, this is a good hotel. Some furniture need to be updated (e.g. lamp with outlets). And if you need WIFI, ask for a room facing inside.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gbpackerfan62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at te Hyatt MCO many times now and I am never disappointed. The staff is friendly and helpful The rooms are clean the beds are comfortable. If you have an early morning flight, this is so hassle free. Expensive for Orlando, but you are paying for convenience. The pool is small and there is not hot tub. A very nice hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey-but worth it for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: kariejeanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before an early morning flight and it really helped. Great to just be at the airport to avoid all the hassle at the crack of dawn. Plus we were traveling with two young children. Returned the rental car a day early, had dinner at the airport and shopped, swam in the pool and went to bed early. When it was time to get up and go down we were fresh rather than frazzled and so were the kids. I'd do this again, regardless of the fact that my pocketbook was def. lighter afterward. Clean and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for convenience and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_CrystalLake_IL
Reviews.Content: Flew in late Friday for a Saturday cruise and this was a great choice. We arrived late and staff was friendly and very helpful. Room was very clean and location was excellent. By far one of the best airport hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant quality and service. Best airport hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Junkie
Reviews.Content: Been satying with the Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport multiple times monthly and am NEVER disapointed! The convenience of not taking a shuttle to the property is priceless. A sincere, warm welcome is sure to follow. Accomdations are always: clean, fresh smelling, and in good working order. Restaurants/ Room Service offer a fair variety of cuisine; all prepared well and served in good time. Every member of the staff I have come into contact with is pleasant, courteous, and knowledable.

Reviews.Title: “Good again.”
Reviews.Author: Pramstroker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before and reviewed it before. A group I belong to continues to go to this hotel and I'm happy to report that it's as good as it was before. Not special or luxurious or particularly nice. Clean, great staff, good food and most of all, incredibly convenient. The lobby of the hotel is the lobby for the airport. Looking down from the inner courtyard, you are looking at the queue for security for the airport. For business meetings, this continues to be one of my favorite locations. And if the family joins me, it's not that far to the Disney or Universal attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I would go there again!”
Reviews.Author: AmberTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orlando Hyatt Airport Hotel because my business conference was there. I'm happy with my choice. I found the staff to be extremely friendly; I had a very nice/attractive comfortable room (even took picture) and thought it was neat to have a hotel in an airport terminal where I could see people coming and going and have some great food court options. I had a hotel breakfast and it was terrible; thank goodness for Starbucks and other food court staples. On the negative side; lack of signs. It was a hassle finding the hotel once I parked at the airport garage and I'm really great with directions. I saw others also asking for assistance. And, once at the terminal a simple sign showing the hotel was up the escalator would have been helpful. Once up the escalator I saw two people standing behind a long counter and had to assume that's where check in was because again, no sign. Even looking for the concierge was tough...he was hidden behind a bush!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop Over at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: travelmomoftwo42
Reviews.Content: Our family was flying in from Washington DC to catch our Disney Cruise in late May, 2011. We decided to come down the night before and get a good nights' rest before starting our vacation. The hotel staff was fantastic, the location to meet the Disney Bus was very convenient AND the hotel arranged to have our luggage picked up and delivered directly to the ship. We didn't have to schlep it downstairs to the check in desk which was a huge plus as we had quite a bit of luggage for the 6 of us. The location is inside the Orlando Airport which was convenient for travel. Our son and his friend enjoyed "shopping" at the airport and the food court was also convenient to pick up coffee in the morning on our way to the Disney Bus. Have put family up here before who were traveling in to meet us in Orlando but this is the first time I've stayed. I will definitely do so again. Beds were very comfortable, bathroom very nice with both a separate tub and shower (not a combo). Nice fluffy towels too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nothing too much trouble.”
Reviews.Author: Happyfamily09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, as landed quite late in Orlando, and couldn't have villa until next day. Staff were very friendly and helpful, room was great, we had a view over the run way, which we had asked for, which was fun watching the amazing number of flights taking off and landing, but we weren't disturbed during the night with aircraft noise. Would recommned the hotel, especialy if using airport, as it is only an elevator ride to hotel reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient stop over”
Reviews.Author: RootytootCardiff
Reviews.Content: We stopped over at the Hyatt as we had a very early flight to New York. The hotel is very impressive and bang in the middle of check in, Staff very helpful and informative, our room was on the 8th floor, very comfortable with a balcony that ovelooked the foyer, shops and fountain. Very surprised to see that the hotel had an outdoor swimming pool! towels provided so you didnt have to carry wet towels around in your suitcase the next morning and as we had checked in at 3pm made the most of the Florida sunshine, we stayed beside the pool until the sun went in. After we changed went off to find our check in desk, had a quick look around the shops and went back to our room - 4.30am start! If you dont like walking witha heavy suitcase I would suggest you ask for a room by the lift, there is only one lift and we had a long way to walk to our room!

Reviews.Title: “I am always happy when I stay here”
Reviews.Author: dwilkin999
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most convenient hotels to hold meetings and stay over without leaving the airport. The convenience of flying in, checking in immediately saves time and the rooms and people are always very courteous. I like it so much, our annual conference is being held here next week for everyone to fly from different parts of the State of Florida and experience the true essence of the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Your best bet for an early departure a.m. flight, or late p.m. arrival"”
Reviews.Author: Jackpot82
Reviews.Content: Our Monday morning flight was scheduled to depart a 6:10a, so we decided to splurge, and book the Hyatt the evening before. What a great choice that was!! I don't know if we'll travel any other way now :) We checked into the hotel at 4p on Sunday, at dinner at McCoy's, (delicious but high cost) and explored the airport shops until it was time for bed. We woke up easily the next morning, took the elevator to security and we were on our way. Piece of cake!! We were also able to check weights on our baggage the night before so we could do some arranging before finding out at the ticket counter we were overweight. That, in itself, was worth it! Monday mornings are crazy at the airport and having that out of the way was awesome! Our king executive rate was $152, which equaled $175 per night with taxes. Most rooms have a balcony, and all rooms are what they call "sound proof". Highly recommend!! A+

Reviews.Title: “Will do late arrivals just to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sapphireChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter after a 12:30 a.m. arrival. We were on our way to Disney, and did not want to deal with transportation when we knew we would be tired. The price was more than I usually pay for a one night hotel stay when traveling, but I decided the convenience would be worth it. Also, I had a rate that included breakfast, so I crossed my fingers and hoped the hotel room would be quiet and most importantly, our room would still be available when we arrived! Not only was our room available, but the attendants behind the front desk were cheerful and welcoming, even at 1:00 in the morning! They offered us ice cold water from a decanter, and check-in was quick and problem free. Our room was clean, spacious, and the beds were fantastic! We had a room that overlooked the main airport lobby, but we heard no noise at all. Upon waking, we went to the breakfast buffet, and it was similar to what we would have in a good Residence Inn or Hampton. However, the employees in the restaurant really stood out, for they were so friendly! My daughter even said that she felt like she was at Disney, with the great customer service! We also took a dip in the pool and watched the planes take off and land from the pool deck. The pool had a really unique bottom, in that it felt as if you were on a bouncy floor that was filled with air under each step. We really enjoyed playing in the pool! The only complaint I have about this hotel is that the toilet needed more water pressure (really can't stand those low flow toilets). However, the plumber that brought a plunger was also very nice, and did not seem bothered to do the task that needed to be done. Some things, though, I will take care of myself if I can; there are certain things I just don't wish to subject others to if I don't have to! I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I find myself flying into Orlando. I may even try for late flights just so I have an excuse to stay at the Hyatt Orlando Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hyatt Best Hyatt Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TracyandAlvinClark
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. We drove in from Savannah, and stayed here! The one thing I will warn you about though the hotel is in the center of an Airport terminal! All the rooms have balconies and face inward to the terminal but its an awesome experience and surprisingly the sound proofing was great! The staff is friendly, sometimes a little long getting to where you want to go but what can you expect from a hotel in an International Airport. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is attached to the airport so check in was a breeze. Beds were nice ,rooms have fridge,desk and chair,flat screen TV and if you are located in interior room you can get airport internet for free.Only complaint is that the towels were so worn and dirty looking really ruff and the bathroom had a few hairs on the floor.We got this room for less than 60 on priceline and is the best airport option.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't get any more convenient.”
Reviews.Author: hazban
Reviews.Content: After a long trans-Atlantic flight, with food and drink, it is not always the best idea to jump straight into a rental car! There are few more convenient airport hotels, no shuttle bus, just jump into the elevator. I had checked in, unpacked and showered before the last passengers from my flight had arrived in the terminal; honestly, I met them on the way for a coffee in Starbucks! Decided to unwind over a meal later in McCoy’s bar and grill, just a tad disappointed compared with previous visits, though jet lag might have dulled my taste buds. Revived after a quiet,undisturbed night’s sleep I was in a much better condition to take to the open road. It certainly works for me and in early June I will return this time for an extra night, the airport location is convenient for my plans before moving on to Miami. Facilities, housekeeping and general ambiance are what you should expect in four diamond property, predictable but reassuring and comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than it looked from the airport.”
Reviews.Author: stardustcross
Reviews.Content: After not being able to get on a flight, this hotel became my home for the night. We looked at some prices online before going to the front desk, and the associate asked whether we had CAA which would bring the rate down to something affordable (in the $150 range). Thankfully, with a corporate discount it's even cheaper. Overall, value for money? It's worth it IF you aren't paying the full rate, but you get a lot anyway. The POOL was the best ever - my travel buddy and I actually stayed the night prior to the Endeavor launching and were able to see the launch from the poolside, although it's a TINY view. The pool has water which flows over the edge and sprays water, plus it has many lawn chairs! We swam at night; there was another (large) group but the pool is big so we all enjoyed it. It was also a cool night but the pool was warm. There are also ample towels available so you don't have to use your room towels. I LOVED this pool! It's outdoors on a roof patio so you can enjoy the sun, and the pool itself is clean (not many bugs on a 6th floor patio.) Service from the people at the front desk was efficient and overall, they were pretty friendly. Downside is that there is no dedicated wifi for the hotel lobby (you can't get wifi in the rooms, only wired internet access which you must pay around $10 for, to use for 24 hours). As a result, you're sharing the airport free internet, which is SLOW. A man kept hogging the public usage computer which had fast internet despite the 15 minute rule, haha. Bring your own laptop and hotspot (i.e. iPhones etc.) if you can; I couldn't as I am not from the US and it would be roaming for me. Oddly enough, the room service/cleaning people around the hotel didn't even crack a smile or say hi - even though I get this from cheaper/most other hotels I go to. Oh well. They're good enough at what they do - my room was really clean and so is the hotel. I also really liked the products in the bathroom; smelled great. The stay was extremely comfortable. We had two double beds; lots of pillows, and I didn't want to get up. NO complimentary water and the vending machines don't have water either. You can buy the $4 Aquafina bottle in the room or go to the airport. But here's a tip... the fitness room has an awesome water cooler! FREE spring water (no nasty Florida-taste water). Bring a water bottle! There is also a fridge in the room - but no microwave. Or perhaps just my room didn't have one, so you'll have to ask in advance if you need one. Fitness room, by the way, is excellent and CLEAN and has no horrible smells. They must clean it regularly. All the machines are a good brand and in nice shape - saw a few others using it. Has 3 ellipticals (one not working when I went), 3 treadmills, 2 stationary bikes, and various other circuit machines. The machines has all the channels like the room TV. There are chilled towels too. Very nice. Can't say it's close to your Orlando destinations, since it's an airport hotel, but if there are people considering sleeping here instead of their normal hotel prior to taking off early in the morning, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you have a late night flight arrival”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel for its location as we were arriving at 1am . Only to discover they had overbooked and we were to be transferred to another hotel 15 mins away - we were a party of 3 and there were at least another 5 people affected . Whilst they gave us the accommodation free , this was not great when time was precious to us . Would have been even worse if we had young children with us .. Just beware and ring ahead would be my advice ....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: JANNYUk
Reviews.Content: Normally when we fly into Orlando we pick up our car straight away and drive to our holiday accommodation. However, this time we decided that after a long transatlantic flight, we would have a night at the Hyatt and collect our car the next day after a good night's sleep. We arrived at the airport at around 7pm and by 7.20pm we were in our executive room. Check in was extremely efficient and the young man who checked us in was very pleasant and informative. I great start to a great stay. Both my husband and I have travelled extensively for business purposes and have stayed in some of the best 5 star hotels in the world. This room was one of the best that either of us have stayed at. The room was extremely clean, quite large and comfortable. Loved the coffee machine. We don't normally make drinks in hotel rooms but we drank the lot here! We had a meal that evening in McCoy's bar. My husband had a perfect medium rare burger and I had a pulled pork sandwich. We both enjoyed the food very much and found that the prices were very reasonable indeed. Only criticism (and I'm being picky here) is that we found the air conditioning in the bar a little too cold. We would have stayed for another drink but needed to get out and warm up a little so didn't stay after we had eaten our meal. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had a perfect night's sleep in a lovely comfy bed. We had a room overlooking the outside of the hotel and it was extremely quiet. Next morning we went into the airport terminal to have breakfast as we thought the breakfast on offer in the hotel was quite pricy and we don't eat enough to make it good value for money. We then sat on the large balcony in the sun for an hour (with a coffee from our coffee machine) before we went to pick up our car. What a relaxing start to our holiday! To sum up, the location, rooms, facilities and staff at this hotel are excellent. We certainly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back next time we come to Orlando. A big thank you to all at the Hyatt for making our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Early Morning Flight”
Reviews.Author: bananafishfever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel so we could drive to Orlando the night before our early flight and not deal with traffic in the morning. We drove straight to long term parking to drop off our car, and the shuttle dropped us off at the terminal within a few minutes. The hotel was easy to locate and we were pleased with our room. It was clean, and the bed and linens were comfortable for our one night stay. It is literally in the airport, so it was very nice being able to just wake up and check in for your flight. Just a heads up, security lines at Orlando are very long so make sure you still allow plenty of time before your flight even though you're staying on the premises! We booked through a discount site online so we got a great price for the room. If flying out of Orlando again, we would definitely consider staying at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful find!”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay in the Orlando Airport area, you can't do any better. The hotel was stunning and the airport was very pleasant to walk around. Lots of nearby restaurants and shops made the evening feel like we were not in an airport at all. There is a nice rooftop pool. The front desk personnel were wonderful, and gave us a room that was quiet. The hotel seems brand new, and tastefully decorated. It is easy to catch your plane or rent a car. A nice way to start or end your trip. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST after a long flight!”
Reviews.Author: Hootsmon
Reviews.Content: After a long journey from Scotland - via Newark - this hotel was a godsend to spend the night in before an onward flight to New Orleans. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet, with a balcony overlooking the airport terminal. We forced ourselves to stay awake long enough to have a drink in the sports bar and it was just lovely! A great buzz about the place, but very relaxing at the same time. Loved it! We plan to stay here next time we fly into Orlando-so much easier than getting your hire car when tired. A must to start your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME!”
Reviews.Author: runrchicMn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the night and loved it! The room was gorgeous! The pool was amazing! Check in was super quick! Airport shop were right below the lobby. Some rooms had balconys so you can overlooking the airport.The pool was outside so you could watch airplanes take off and land. We loved it and recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our decision to stay here”
Reviews.Author: indymom10
Reviews.Content: My family and I flew in late on a Friday night. I went back and forth on whether to use our reward points and stay at a nearby hotel or pay out of pocket for the Hyatt. So happy with our decision! Our room was comfortable and our 9 and 11 yr old girls LOVED the balcony overlooking the interior of the terminal. We wanted something clean and convenient with NO surprises and no waiting for shuttles to take us to and from the airport. In the morning we wheeled our luggage from our room, down the elevator and to the rental car counter. Wheeled out to our rental car and we were on our way! I would definitely stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pre filght Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigRay54
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay - the night before our flight to Vegas The most simple hotel parking I have been in - just steps from the car to the hotel lobby Had a great room and then had dinner in McCoys - wow the Crawfish Gumbo is to die for and the service is fantastic Strongly recomend the hotel for a night before stayover

Reviews.Title: “We always stay the one night before flying out.”
Reviews.Author: aellis1161
Reviews.Content: My husband & I love this hotel, but we don't use it for our entire stay, just the night before going home. You can turn in your rental car downstairs, get on the elevator to the main airport, then walk a few steps to the hotel elevators. The rooms & beds are very nice & clean, and most rooms have a balcony looking over the main airport, which has very little noise. It's nice for early a.m. flights. You can check your flight status on the TV. One time our flight was delayed so we went back to sleep for a while, it was great!. Their nice restaurant, Hemisphere, is amazing. Their other restaurant is good too. Their bar looks over the main floor. Fun to people watch. Plus there are a lot of restaurants & shops for last minute items or for killing time.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hotel, but location isn't ideal if flight scheduled in a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: dp_action
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay @ the Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport, but the location of the hotel isn't the most convenient if you are staying more than one night. As noted my other reviewers, the hotel is in the Orlando airport, therefore access to flights is great. Getting to your car from your hotel room does take time if you are looking to dine outside of the hotel restaurants or the fast food franchises in the airport. Parking is $12 a night with in/out privileges. My room didn't have any natural light. My balcony had a view of the inside of the terminal... there are rooms where the balcony is outside. I enjoyed free WIFI access in my room via the Orlando terminal, the room had a wired internet setup but that involved a fee. Overall I enjoyed my stay, but because I was at the hotel over a couple of nights better access to the 'outside the terminal world' would have improved my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyNorthants
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night waiting for connecting flight back to UK. Really stylish and plush, check-in was excellent considering I had no reservation and was given a room on the top floor. Nice to go out on the balcony and look down on people rushing about in the atrium area while having a relaxing drink. Didn't eat at the hotel as there are lots of food outlets in the airport, particularly liked the Chinese where you can select two ready prepared dishes plus rice or noodles at a reasonable price. Room was as expected for a 5 star hotel and really quiet at night, only complaint was price, about £160 but probably worth it for convenience - out of hotel and straight to airline check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and perfect location after a long trip with kids"”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMomma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect solution after a long flight with children. We were tired after our trip into Orlando and nothing could have made it easier than just going up to our room in the Hyatt. We came in late at night and the kids were exhausted. The room was nice and clean. We had room service for breakfast which I would not do again since it was really expensive and not on par with similar room service we have had for breakfast in a comparable hotel. Check in and out was super simple. The Hyatt and Disney coordinated our luggage as well so that we didn't have to drag it around to the ship. Overall a lovely hotel in super convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, super convenient to airport terminal. Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cjg2901
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the convenience to the airport. It is the most convenient and nice airport hotel in which I have ever stayed. It is right in the terminal and was extremely clean and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...except...”
Reviews.Author: iloveulongtime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Hotel just for one night...just before coming back to Canada; it was a great idea, because the next morning, we didn't feel rushed and we were obviously on time..seeing as how it's in the airport...The hotel itself is amazing, beautiful and extremely modern. Hotel staff, pretty nice.....The pool is located outside...on top of the building...and there's an amazing view of the airplanes...and them flying over the pool. The hotel is quite large...and depending on where you are staying..., you need to walk a lot before you get to the pool. My room had the balcony view of inside the airport,..and I thought that was really unique touch....What's fun about staying here is that you have access to the airport, which is more of a mall, than an airport. The only thing I didn't like...is that when we entered our room,..there was a cigarette smell, but I'm sure if we had requested another room, they would have given us the room...One more thing: on the day of the departure.,.,.someone came to our room,..and this bellhop took our bags to the check-in....it was convenient 'cause he brought us our bags all the way to the airline.....but the guy excepted to be tipped...I gave him 10$ for like 4 bags, it was my last day in the US....it's all the american money i had left....they guy said: ''that's it'' - I found that kinda cheezy.....fine, he didn't like the tip, ok, get over it.....but don't make comments like that, especially when you work for the Hyatt luxury hotel....and plus,..it honestly, took him 5 min to bring us there. (but will this fact stop me from returning, no. I plan to return this summer...and this time, I'll bring some change.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay immediately after/prior to flights.”
Reviews.Author: Kelwood
Reviews.Content: After our 26hrs of flying from Australia we were very pleased upon arrival at this hotel.....and not because any sleep would have been a good sleep but because this hotel has all the qualities you look for in a hotel. The room was a great size (we registered for a stand by upgrade and received one at check-in), the bathroom was very clean and included complimentary toothpaste, which was great after such a long flight. We ordered room service and the food was delivered promptly and was flavorsome. The noon check out time was perfect for our long flight recovery. We stayed at the hotel the night before we departed as well and our second visit was as good as our first. Highly recommended hotel when flying to/from Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Most Interesting Hotels to Stay In”
Reviews.Author: Dguerr
Reviews.Content: As most people, I stayed here knowing that I was flying out soon. A few years ago I found myself stranded in the airport when SWA decided to cancel all flights into Baltimore due to a snowstorm. I regreted not immediately taking an available room at the Hyatt. This time I was very sick.with some kind of flu virus which was when I was flat on my back, so my experience was not good, although being in a comfortable, quiet room was, at least, some help. Despite being in the airport terminal, the room was totally quiet. In the next day I felt a little better and pulled a chair halfway out on the balcony, overlooking the terminal lobby, to drink a coffee. Checkout was at noon, allowing me to find the JetBlue counters ahead of time. If I'd felt better, there were plenty of places to eat. My only negative experience was having to walk a long distance from the rental car return to the hotel. They are in different terminal buildings. Defin

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel inside the airport!!”
Reviews.Author: SummerItalia
Reviews.Content: January 8th-2011 our way back home from the cruise we stayed at this hotel, we had a very early flight and it was very convenience to be in the hotel located in Airport. We got a very good deal when booking the rooms at the rate of $126/night. It was great as we dropped our rental car and walk to the hotel, where we was welcome by a very friendly and professional staff. The Hotel is amazing, beautiful, elegant, luxurious and very safe, the card is your key to the room and also it start the elevator. The rooms have balconies with the view of the courtyard and airport. Everything was beautiful and clean and you can just walk to any airport restaurants and stores. The hotel do not have complimentary breakfast as the other hotels we stayed in, but because we was living so early, it was not important to us. The only think I wish the rooms will have is 2 beds or sofa bed additional to one bed, as it was 3 of us in each room. Wireless internet you have to pay, but can get for free in airport We liked there very much, and yes We will stay there again, however SpringHill Orlando Airport (where we stayed week early) with the free shuttle, complimentary breakfast in the morning, free internet and parking attracts me more as I love the fresh air and nice landscaping around better than being inside of the airport. In conclusion this is a very nice luxurious Hotel and I will recommend specially to those travelers with very early or late flights.

Reviews.Title: “Day use of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: mirja_sekulovic
Reviews.Content: If your layover is long, then it is worth spending a 100$ for a day use of the room. The rooms are ok, then beds and sheets are great. The bathroom though is not impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: PaulArts
Reviews.Content: Very classy hotel right in the airport mainhall. Nice and friendly staff. The rooms are very big and clean. Only thing missing is wifi access..

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night here in Feb/11 before flying back to Canada early the next morning. It is clean and the rooms are nice.I was able to use my early check in option and paid a extra $25.00 to get a room at 10.30am! I only paid $82.00 for the night + the $25.00 early check-in fee..We used the outdoor pool on the 6th floor which is really nice, and you can watch the planes as well. The workout room has many trainers to choose from also on the 6th floor. The only semi negative is you get a lot of people arriving late and they stand and gab loudly if you room is located next to the bank of elevators like our room was. We will definitely use this airport hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!”
Reviews.Author: 60893Happytraveler
Reviews.Content: We took a day room the morning after our cruise. We had an 8 hour layover, a 10:00pm flight and wanted to rest up a bit . What a pleasant surprise. Superb! Almost hated to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport layover EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ak_jorge
Reviews.Content: By far the best airport layover experience we've ever had. The main terminal is a huge atrium that really is the Hyatt Regency hotel. The lobby elevators are literally 20' from those epic MCO security lines. I couldn't help but feel a little guilty stumbling over to the nearest Starbucks for coffee in my slippers, knowing all those other folks had been up for hours just to make it to those lines. The staff were wonderfully accommodating, happily fulfilling our request for an outside room which offered nice views of the sunset and aircraft taking off and landing. Despite facing the runways, the room was absolutely QUIET. The rooms themselves are gorgeous, with mini-fridge, large flat-screen LCD television, super comfy bed, excellent heating and air conditioning, and a very large, luxurious bathroom. McCoy's Bar & Grill would be a great place to kill a layover, even if you're not staying at the hotel overnight (but if you can, you should!). The place is really well run; the pizza was very tasty, as was the English club sandwich with egg. The new sports bar overlooking the main terminal has a smaller menu and very spotty service (we had to ask three times to have our table wiped down, and beers took 10+ minutes to arrive, despite the empty bar). Just head over to McCoy's ... better selection, and better prices. There is no WiFi in the rooms, though we were able to gain a weak connection to the airport's free WiFi service. Otherwise, I think you have to pay for an Ethernet connection. The heated outdoor pool was small, but nice to have. Business center has VERY limited hours (M-F / 7am-5pm).

Reviews.Title: “Ultra convenient and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0puns
Reviews.Content: Total time elapsed from luggage retrieval to opening our hotel room door was about 15 minutes. Obviously, there were numerous dining options at the airport and the room was modern, stylish, clean, and quiet. Really, it's the perfect place to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: NC-Bill
Reviews.Content: My travels have taken me to Orlando over 10 different times over the last year. I am so happy that I have found my home away from home. For years on my trips to Orlando I had thought how easy it must be to get off the plane and take an elevator to you room. On a trip early last year I gave it a try. And am I glad I did. What could more convenient that Hyatt quality with many restaurants, shops, a bank, fast food, and 24 hour supply of cabs or TownCars just an elevator ride and short walk away. Definitely my place to stay when flying into Orlando. Plus it makes early flights almost enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: Having flown in and out of Orlando (MCO) Airport dozens of times over the last few years, i'd always wondered what the Hyatt's rooms are like, and had the chance to find out when we booked one night here, a night before an early flight home. We were pleasantly surprised: check-in was smooth and easy despite the lobby renovations and use of a temporary check-in desk; room was much nicer than we'd expected, given that it's a prime location and we've got zero status with Hyatt. Comfortable bed, nice linens, quiet exterior room with nice, sizeable balcony. The valet was especially helpful; we had planned to check in and drop our bags, go meet friends for dinner, then return the rental car before retiring for the night, and when we let the valet know we'd only be parked for about 15 minutes, he kept our car very close and also waived the usual hourly charge. Good customer service! We did not stay long enough to try the hotel restaurant, bar or breakfast, or the wi-fi, but will be returning soon The only negative was the inability to print a boarding pass. While renovations are going on, the "business center" consists of a loaner laptop set up in one of the hallway common areas. There was a line of about 5 people waiting to use it when we tried, and while the concierge (whose "office" is the next table over from the makeshift business center) tried to print for us, her computer was too slow to even get to our airline's website. Given the number of people who will be leaving the hotel and going directly to airport security, I think this is a huge oversight. MCO first thing in the morning is a mess, and the waits to print boarding passes at many of the airlines outweigh the time savings of staying on airport property. So if you'd like a boarding pass and they've not finished their renovations, allow time to get one from your airline and don't count on the convenience of being able to do it from the hotel. Price is good but a little high considering the area. You are, after all, paying more for the convenience, and you may be able to save on your car rental bill by returning it a day early.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but if you can get an outside room.”
Reviews.Author: bflojim
Reviews.Content: Was our 2nd time in this property. Really it's first rate. The only thing I could be slightly critical on is the rooms facing the runways are first off all more interesting and surprisingly quieter. The rooms facing the inside of the terminal (and we were on 9th floor) are a bit noisy till fairly late. It's not like we did'nt sleep but the noises from down below tend to echo it seems. Many options for dining, fantastic property overall. Would not hesitate to stay again. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations become opportunity for staff to shine”
Reviews.Author: CarrieJ808
Reviews.Content: Management and staff have turned current renovations into an opportunity to showcase their capacity to provide exceptional service. The already renovated rooms are really beautiful. I stayed here 2 years ago and really notice the change. We chose the business plan which gave us an upgraded room and breakfast. The concierge desk is staffed and open to all for printing out of boarding passes, along with a customer computer if you just want to do it yourself or surf. Bellman are working hard and doing a great job - ours also took our wake up call times, and arranged for a bellman to come up at designated time to pick up luggage and escort us to security check in for luggage. The gym is medium-small sized but gets the job done and is not the usual small gym- works well with innovative equipment. The pool outside is heated and well designed, no whirlpool. Bathrooms are exceptionally well appointed - today it included a toothpaste sample, along with the magnifying mirror, great coffee maker, and all the usuals including robe. Stone tiles surround the nice tub/shower. LOTS of pillows of all types, and we enjoyed watching the people walking around the airport from our balcony. The restaurant and bar were small but comfortable and good. Also shopping at this terminal is really fun and well designed, every theme park has at least 1 shop, food court and 2 book stores, restaurants, and lots of specialty shops, all in wide, bright, immaculate aisles that were nice to walk around. We enjoyed everything about our short stay and will come again. MCO has free WiFi too.

Reviews.Title: “Almost no negatives”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: This is a most convenient hotel for early departures or late arrivals from/to orlando. I agree with most positives described by other passengers so will simply add a couple comments, in the hope that this will motivate hotel to correct its few negative aspects: 1-The free wireless internet access which is promised is...the airport wireless internet access, which simply did not work at all (in fact the front desk staff confirmed that it usually doesn't work). Free wireless internet is false advertising in this case: why risk alienating clients? 2-This is less concerning but a suggestion: one of the major appeals of this hotel is convenience for very early departures from airport. 6:30 am service start for b.fast is too late: 5:30 would make more sense. We had a bfast rate..could not use it (and it wasn't usable for room service).

Reviews.Title: “Location inside terminal means quick access.”
Reviews.Author: fbc53
Reviews.Content: Stayed there inbound and outbound. Great when family members arriving and leaving on different flights and dates. Rooms were in good condition and clean. Bell service and front desk provided good service and were knowledgeable. Rooms facing inside the terminal a bit noisy early in the morning; those with runway views quieter. entrance to hotel between A & B security checkpoints. Take escalator to hotel lobby floor for bell service before going to luggage claim. Otherwise; you will need to backtrack with luggage through lines for security checkpoint.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay at the airport, you should be satisfied”
Reviews.Author: NoVaWahoo
Reviews.Content: The inside-airport atrium hotel wouldn't be my first choice if not for a meeting there, but there is something kind of amusing about watching the people in the security lines from the corridor outside your room. A well-appointed Hyatt, with reasonable service. Food prices were what you might expect from with an airport. One obvious advantage to this hotel is that is attached to a mall/food court within the airport. Surprisingly, I was not awakened by airplane noise...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Share27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the when we had an early flight the next morning and it just couldn't be more convenient!! Check-in was easy...at first there was a mix up with our room. They said that we had booked it for two nights and had already charged us for both, but we actually only wanted one night. The woman behind the counter started to get a little defensive, but when I pointed that out to her - she completely changed her ways. She was gracious and refunded the money to our credit card and charged us just for the night. We had a beautiful room and it was just what we needed the night before our long flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before flying home!”
Reviews.Author: NurseLauraVT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here the past two years. We book a JetBlue flight home departing somewhere between 9 and 10:30am. It's so much more relaxing to turn in the rental car a day early, and stay here for the night before flying out. You don't have to deal with Orlando traffic early in the morning, you get more sleep, and save an extra day on your car rental. We always request a room with a balcony, any my boys really enjoy watching planes take off. The room service is great and not too expensive if you're looking for a late night snack or some beer/wine. There are plenty of restaurants and shops at the airport. The morning is really relaxing. You can check in your luggage and grab breakfast (Starbucks--coffee and oatmeal!) with just your kids and carry-ons in tow. The rooftop pool is beautiful, though it's really shaded in the evening and super breezy up there. It looks like they offer poolside food/beverage though that seemed to be done for the day by the time we were ready to use the pool. There is a small but very clean fitness facility--the best part is there is a fridge with chilled towels! The rooms are very clean and spacious. The last time we stayed we had some sort of executive room with a huge bathroom with a walk-in shower and a separate tub/shower combo. We will always stay here when flying out of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great In-Airport hotel! Super Service”
Reviews.Author: cruisermeg
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few nights over a couple weeks in this hotel. I'd originally booked a day room as I had a long wait to catch a train and this hotel has $89 rates from about 9 AM til 5 or 6 PM. It is right in the terminal, you just go up the elevators or escalators between some TSA screening entrances (the hotel is NOT through security) up to the 4th floor to check in. The agents are all very nice. Rooms are decent size and many overlook the airport. The hotel inside is a little noisy as doors slam and guests can be loud, but I really didn't hear any airplane sounds. The bathroom is a nice size and was very clean as well. I just hate the smell of the Hyatt toiletries! TVs had a decent selection of channels and are flat screens. Internet is not free though since I have status with Hyatt, I didn't pay. The connection speed wasn't bad. The airport also offers free WiFi which you can sometimes pick up in the rooms. There are a couple dining options: McCoys which has lunch and dinner, plus Hemisphere which has breakfast and dinner with a view of the airfield. I ate lunch/dinner in McCoys and there is a nice selection of "tapas", soups, sandwiches and entrees. Service was always excellent. The breakfast in Hemisphere was good. The buffet is the better deal but the ala carte prices are on par with any large hotel. I didn't try dinner but the food smelled good. Service here was not always as good as in the other restaurant, but it was good nonetheless. The beauty of this hotel is that you can literally wake up early, drop your bags, go back to sleep, eat and go fly! The airport at MCO is pretty nice and there are a number of options for eating and shopping as well. You have easy access to pick up rental cars and/or Disney/cruise transfers on the lower level of the airport. All in all, a very good choice if you need to crash someplace. Probably not a good choice to vacation in the area as the parking isn't cheap but to just have a place before or after a flight or cruise, this is s good choice and rates are not bad considering the airport location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best choice if you have to stay in MCO.”
Reviews.Author: puppee
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel; Located inside MCO, just steps away from luggage check-in; it would be the best choice if you have to stay overnight in MCO.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience above all”
Reviews.Author: outsdad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, in the terminal at the Orlando airport. It was so nice exiting my flight and walking to the hotel entrance on the public concourse. My room was comfortable, clean, roomy and, most importantly, ready when I checked-in. The buffet breakfast was pretty standard and I would recommend ordering a-la-carte. My one complaint, when the air conditioning in my room turned on, there was an audible, loud click which woke me more than once during the night. Hopefully this was just in my room. Every major airport should have an in-terminal hotel as good as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: LarsieB
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for one evening as we had an early flight out of Orlando, the hotel was of a very high quality and the staff were incredibly helpful. When we checked into the hotel the person serving us on reception printed out our boarding passes and that was so convenient. The room and hotel were just lovely as was the pool area. We ate dinner in the downstairs restaurant, the food was very nice and the service very good and we had a buffet breakfast in the restaurant upstairs before flying out and the food and service were terrific. We couldn't have asked for a better location for our flight as the hotel is located right inside the terminal so we only had to walk about 5 minutes in the morning to check our luggage onto the flight. We also had a hire car we had to drop off before checking into the hotel and once again this was only about a 5 minute walk to the Hyatt. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at the Hyatt after our flight from the UK. We were holidaying in St Augustine and didn't want to do the long drive in the dark when we were tired. Within an hour of getting off the plane (there were big queues in immigration) we were having a swim in the hotel's outdoor pool! After cooling off we went back to our very well appointed room to change before having dinner at Mc Coys restaurant in the hotel. Then it was into bed for a good sleep before having breakfast and collecting the hire car at 9.30 am....which with no queue took us 5 minutes!!!! A great way to start our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything After a Long Flight”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than your average airport hotel. It's not the Ritz, but it feels just as nice when you land in Orlando in the middle of the night and can collect your luggage and be in in bed within minutes. After missing our connection in ATL and landing very late in Orlando, we decided to crash at the Hyatt right in the airport and it was so very worth it. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was a nice buffet in a restaurant over looking the runway. The kids enjoyed it. The hotel arranged for a car to collect us and take us to our hotel in Orlando. The car came right to the hotel, not to the airport pick up and it was arranged quickly and easily.

Reviews.Title: “service that was above and beyond my wildest expectations”
Reviews.Author: cwpetal
Reviews.Content: I was moving my dad, who has Alzheimer's from Florida to Vermont. As the date got closer, his anxiety grew and I began to fear that he'd refuse to budge from the house on the morning of our flight. I had an ah-hah moment when I remembered seeing a hotel attached to the Airport. I was willing to pay almost anything to make this transition less stressful. I was shocked to find that the price/night stay was really quite reasonable for the location. That was just the beginning of the surprises with the Hyatt. First, the hotel is gorgeous and felt very high-class and special; I found myself wishing I was traveling for a different reason and could actually take advantage of how relaxing it was! The concierges, every last one of them, were the most amazing service people I have ever, ever had the pleasure of experiencing...and I'm no spring chicken! Their bright, smiling faces, kindness, efficiency and total lack of even one iota of being stressed or annoyed was mind-blowing to me. One actually offered to go in to the men's room with my dad; another stayed with him while I returned my rental car and in the morning, yet another walked all the way to the airline check-in with us and stood in a different line so we could see which one moved more quickly. My words are not enough to describe the entire experience. I'm only sorry that I don't normally travel much and have a need to stay in a Hyatt again. PS...the pillows...oooh my, the pillows...they were so very perfect that I did research when I returned home to see if I could find out what brand they were. Clearly, I'm not alone, they actually sell them! I think I'm going to buy myself one for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't have a room facing the inside and don't expect a decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GBland
Reviews.Content: We were forced to stay overnight when our flight was cancelled, and initially felt excited we were being put up in the hyatt. Then we got to our room which was on the eighth floor facing the inside. The room was a little tired looking but nice none the less, but the first thing we noticed was the noise. The soundproofing at the balcony doors were not adequate and we could hear the fountain within the airport and the constant automated tanoy messages (which were announced every ten minutes!). Also there was some clattering noise all night like the mechanics of the lifts, but we weren't near the lift so probably wasn't that. We barely slept despite the comfortable bed. Plus point of the room was the plush bathroom. On arriving for breakfast at 10.30 it took 30mins to get seated. We were the last party that arrived (some others arrived and couldn't wait) and stood for 10mins with tables available before we queried why we couldn't be seated and they didn't seem to know and then seated us. Food was not very nice on the buffet and not worth the $15 per head. I would have felt cheated if I had paid for the room and not the airline. We heard from fellow passengers that the external rooms were quiet and nice. Others like us who were on the inside had the same issues with the noise. Ok for staying before an early flight, but take ear plugs just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, right in the Orlando airport!”
Reviews.Author: barbtallica
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay and made our trip so easy. My friend and I had flown in from Philly to Orlando and were meeting her neice and her boyfriend who were flying in from Pittsburgh. We were all to leave for a cruise out of Miami the next morning. It was so convenient and made things easy to all meet up at the hotel. My friends neice is in a wheelchair so we wanted to make sure she would be taken care of and not have too much difficulty getting settled in before we arrived. They were very accomodating of her needs. The hotel was lovely, nice, spacious rooms, clean. A great view of the airport runways was pretty cool, We watched the sun come up as the planes taxied about. Also a nice pool that overlooked the runways. We took a quick dip, it was heated, very relaxing after the flight! You can also watch the hustle and bustle of the airport from the balcony which overlooks the inner airport. Orlando airport is really like a giant mall, with lots to do. There is also a gym and restaurants, that we didn't have time to check out. The rooms did not have free internet but you could go into the airport to use their free wifi. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who needs have quick access to the airport, ie layovers etc. A really nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: UnboundTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Hyatt for a very early morning flight out of Orlando International Airport. Service at check in and check out was very friendly and quick. Rooms are surprisingly plush with soft beds, dark woods, flat screen TVs, and iPod clock radios. Good shower pressure in the tile bathroom too. Didn't use any of the amenities but only had a 2 minute walk to the security gate of the airport. Would definitely recommend staying here for an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDPTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Orlando Airport Hyatt in August and September 2010 and had a sleeping room and conference room for a deposition each time. The reservation service was quick, coordinated and easy. The supplies I needed were handy and the staff accomodated last minute changes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very clean - hard to believe it's inside the airport”
Reviews.Author: RustyDog2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2010 before leaving for a cruise out of Port Canaveral. We originally had an evening flight and didn't want to drive to the Port at night so we opted to stay here. The room was very nice and quite. It was a king room w/ a runway view. For the extra $9, the runway view was nice to have. The sunrise was amazing. We had breakfast in the Hemisphere restaurant. It was good, the selection was typical however the coffee was awful. Aside from the coffee, we had a great stay. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet despite being on the airport.”
Reviews.Author: fairylova
Reviews.Content: I pricelined this hotel because I knew I wanted to stay at the airport for my short few hours in Orlando. I won the Hyatt. The gentleman who checked me in was very friendly and helpful and even remembered me the next day when checking out. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable and the shower was amazing. The room had a balcony that overlooked the airport (the hotel is actually located in the airport) and when the door was closed you didn't hear the airplanes at all. Without a car, it is hard to navigate the area since the hotel does not offer a shuttle, but there are plenty of places to dine (and shop) in the airport, so for a short stay, it should not be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “THE way to start your vacation”
Reviews.Author: breng2903
Reviews.Content: we live in Orlando and had a family trip planned to Wyoming/Yellowstone (2 adults and a 10 year old boy). Our flight to Salt Lake City was scheduled to leave at 6.25 AM!. We decided to stay at the airport the night before, so we could start our vacation a little bit more relaxed. We could not have done this better. At the hotel, you are actually staying on top of the airport, you can see the planes leave and arrive from your balcony. Staff is great, food was good. Best thing is, we saved over an hour and a half in the morning as we ddint have to drive to airport, park etc. For our next trip, we definitely stay at the Hyatt Orlando Airport again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: JuliaandTony
Reviews.Content: Fortunately for my family and I our flight home was cancelled and rescheduled for the next day. so our holiday company arranged for us to stay in this hotel. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable and quiet. I couldn't hear any planes take off or land as this hotel is on top of the airport. Excellent service. Pool was great. Overall a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as Hyatt Place!”
Reviews.Author: DianeCL
Reviews.Content: Place is brand new, but room starting to show poor upkeep. Room service for food was good. Food served for our business meeting was just awful. Bagged non-descript sandwiches were tasteless. Convenient for inbound flights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not for doing business.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsAlotBusiness
Reviews.Content: First room they put us in wasn't clean. Used feminine hygiene product and towels in bathroom. Wireless only in public spaces, in room you had to use the network cable. Business center was .50 a minute or $30 an hour, plus a $1.00 per page to print. After spending $135 for a night having to pay for internet and paper was over my budget. Stay at a holiday inn you'll get more free stuff, plus have money left over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient because it is located inside the airport. We stayed 2 nights and had an outside facing room on the 9th floor. We were able to see planes land and take off all day. At night, you need to put in earplugs so you don't get woken up from the airport noise. My husband does not like to use earplugs, and he did not sleep well either night. The hotel room is very well appointed with a a flat screen tv, ceiling fan, nice towels, and toiletries. The bed was also comfy. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, and it was fine. There is a Macaroni Grill, Chili's, and a Sport's bar for dinner options inside the terminal. We had a fine stay, but next time would prefer an interior room.

Reviews.Title: “I did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: HippyChic101
Reviews.Content: Words can not express my positive feeling toward Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport - I had such a fabulous time at this hotel. My room was exceptional: providing me with a clear view of a busy runway where I watched many planes land while sipping drinks on my spacious and private balcony. Sigh... Although I was in the airport, the room was soundproof. The only noise I could hear was the occasional loud guest in the hall. The bed was heavenly and I slept like a baby. The room service (as well as McCoy's restaurant) was great and I ate like a pig! I know I returned from my weekend in Orlando a bit chubbier than when I arrived. The hotel makes its own Key Lime pie which Amanda recommended and I could not get enough - yum! Amanda ran the In-room Dining order desk like a total pro and her suggestions were always spot on! Michael on Guest Services was just wonderful. He was knowledgeable and professional, and I trusted him completely to take care of any questions or concerns. The staff were overall lovely people and even the 1.5 bad seeds were absolutely minor when placed amidst all the wonderful people (98.5) at Hyatt. I would definitely return to this fantastic hotel and hope to do so in the near future. After recent and disappointing experiences at other comparable boutique hotels and chains, Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport has restored my faith in hotels. Glad to be a Passport member!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, unusual practices, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: jeanbops
Reviews.Content: Firstly the positives: Hotel is literally located in the airport so easy and rapid access to all areas of the airport Room was beautiful - king bed, plenty of pillows and cushions, lcd tv free wifi - very slow though, think it was the airports wifi and not the hotels pleasant and efficient staff - wake up call right on time, easy check in/out and aircon controls on wall as well as a ceiling fan. Unusual practices - they provide a non smoking room - fine. Then there is a room with a balcony. You can smoke on the balcony but if you leave evidence of smoking there you will be charged a 500 dollar clean up fee... Smoker friendly rooms are an extra fee per night... I have never come across this kind of tiered charge before! Found it strange! Liked that the elevators - which are accessible through main airport floor - would only work with a swipe of room card - eliminated people coming up for a "look" Nice gym, plenty of equipment and very clean. Our room looked out onto the runway of the airport - extremely noisy, very little sleep got. Could also hear people in the room next door very clearly.
