We only stayed one night, €159 room only, and it served it's purpose but wouldn't be a destination I would return to. Did not eat here or use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but don't put on the bathrobes!”
Reviews.Author: steve34609
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Orlando Airport for one night because we had a 6am flight the next morning and we live several hours away from the airport by car. We got a great rate through Delta,using a few of our skymiles and paying for the rest. Check in was a breeze.The hotel rep was polite and quickly found us a nice,outside facing room with a balcony where I could smoke.We also got early check in.We had requested a rollaway ,which was complimentary,and showed up at the hotel room's door within five minutes of us entering.Very fast housekeeping response time.We cannot say anything bad about the room itself.Lovely.Four star.Comfortable beds.A bit cramped for four,but pretty much standard in size. For the money,(what the average Joe gets charged)it would seem that Hyatt would offer suites. The pool was nice,as was the deck.We used both.The exercise facility was small,but adequate. Really,the only two negative things that that I can say about the hotel is "Do not put on,or wear the robes in the closets".My wife did.The fluffy,white robe was irresistably comfy looking.She put it on and snuggled in bed with the remote all evening...We never suspected.The itching on her neck began on the plane the next am.By the time we reached our destination,there were red spots.We googled images and,indeed,they were bedbugs.Maybe an isolated incident,but an unhygenic practice to pass on outerwear to the next guest with out cleaning it,Hyatt. The other negative is...I did not sleep a wink.I am a notoriously light sleeper.Being IN an airport it's impossible for Hyatt to muffle the roars of the jets.I just sufferred.It is what it is. I would stay here again,if I had to fly early in the AM,but not just for pleasure while staying in Orlando. I would recommend this hotel to fellow travellers using MCO airport. I would not touch the bathrobes,and would bring earplugs the next time.

Reviews.Title: “This is an airport hotel that is a breeze to get to and a joy to stay at”
Reviews.Author: ICanTravelPanama
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to go and see The Epcot Flower & Garden Show but could never seem to fit it into any of my schedules but this year I tried something different after coming back from my Chelsea tour. I flew into Orlando for two nights. I got smart and even made my hotel reservation at the Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport. That made things really easy. This hotel is at the airport and was a dream to get to from the baggage area. I had arrived late, so fell into bed and was up bright and early the next morning to catch a shuttle over to the show. The times were great for the shuttle. I could leave the show later on in the afternoon and get back to the hotel to sleep and leave the next morning for home. Perfect! I guess I was a bit excited as I didn’t need a whole lot of sleep that night…goodness knows the room was wonderful, a huge bed to splay out on and the quietness of the room surely made for slumber divine, but I guess the kid in me was excited about going to Epcot. I loved the location, the ease of getting to the shuttle from the hotel and even though it was at the airport I don't remember hearing one plane. Service was excellent at check in and out and the front desk was always helpful, even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Billed twice for my stay at the Hyatt - very shady practices by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChartChecker
Reviews.Content: Be very careful if you book this hotel with Priceline.  Even though you will prepay via Priceline, Hyatt will also charge you for your stay.  When I called them to inquire about the charge on account, without giving them any information about how the hotel was booked, they immediately said I shouldn't have been charged and would credit me within 5 days.  When I asked them what I was charged for, the representative reluctantly said I paid through Priceline.  My question is....if they already knew I should not have been charged, then why was I charged in the first place? Very shady for such a large hotel which should clearly have accounting checks in place for this.   That being said, the hotel itself is fascinating. The lobby and inside rooms overlook the terminal and gates. Great for people watching.  Our room was ample and brand new. And contrary to what another review I just read, the room was extremely quiet. We took an outer room with of view of the runways and we could't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Roach in room”
Reviews.Author: liketorelaxalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to begin our vacation in late May 2010 because our flight left early and it is attached to the airport. After settling in to our room I found a roach crawling across the bathroom floor. When guest services arrived the guy looked at the bug and told me it was a German roach and that this was "not a big deal". Well it was a big deal to us. They offered to spray our room with us in it (great idea) until we had to ask to be moved as far away as possible because I doubt the roach was living alone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience, good connection”
Reviews.Author: Krauty123
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very noisy and the experience is nowhere near confortable. The only great advantage is to get also the very early flights outbound of Orlando. Staff is only moderately friendly and the rooms our largely overpriced. Suggest to stay in another airport hotel unless your flight is earlier than 6am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, QUIET!!! Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: eatmgator
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Husband on the first night of our Honeymoon. We were to fly out the next morning at 7 am and didn't want the hassel of checking out of a hotel, parking and taking the shuttle at 5 am, so we chose to stay at the airport hotel that night and do it all the night before. Wow are we glad we did! Amazing check in and out process (they deliver your bags to your airline check in area). Very fast room service, all we needed was silverware and salt for the food we packed up from the wedding and it was there almost within seconds. The beds were so comfortable, nice bathroom and shower area. Little garden area with fountain inside the hallway between rooms so it felt extremely elegant. We couldn't hear a single plane take off - and the runway is right there! We slept like babies! We were able to get a few extra hours and not worry about parking and shuttles!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eveline_4u
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner used this hotel for an overnight stay as we were catching our cruiseship the next day. Firstly, check-in was extremely fast and our room was ready in the early am. Maybe just luck but we were very happy to get to our room by noon. The staff was very helpful answering all our questions. Our room was beautiful. We had a choice of view, either the airplane runway or the inside court of the airport. We chose the courtyard in the airport. We had use of the rooftop pool. What a way to start our vacation pre cruise. We had a nice lunch at the pool and ate dinner at one of the restaurants located in the airport recommended by the hotel and the food was fantastic. The next day we checked out and the bellboy knew we were catching a shuttle taking us to Port Canaveral. We were told by the shuttle company to just go to baggage area and look for the rep that would take us to the shuttle. Thank goodness the bellboy stepped in and said that we would be wasting our time going to the baggage area and that they would only direct us to street level anyways, and he knew where we needed to be. Well he was right. He took our luggage to street level where Carnival Cruise reps were waiting. He saved us a couple of hours by taking us directly to the the reps, no one in line, and we were the first to board the cruiseship by noon. Otherwise if we'd just gone to the baggage area on our own, struggling with our luggage on escalators, and trying to find someone in the baggage area, and then being directed to another level to sign in, it would have set us back at leat 90 minutes. Kudos to bellboy at the Hyatt for taking charge. He earned a good tip that day. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt again. Orlando airport is awesome. A shopping mall with lots of stores and places to eat. No duty free but great shopping for overnight travellers. Orlando airport is an awesome place to be for an overnight stay. The lobby of the Hyatt was only steps away from the baggage claim. Great convenience. Thanks Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - great price”
Reviews.Author: LibbyUk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel before but booked on Priceline this visit. What a bargain! Clean, comfortable rooms. Pool pleasant but could probably do with a refurb. Not a dealbreaker though as the views of the runways are great. Right in the Terminal so great hotel for arrival or departure from Mco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: orangewhte
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very comfortable and nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean,quiet,and had nice beds. The only downfall was the price of parking ($12 daily) and there is only 1 computer for hotel guest use. Overall great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay if You Have a Late Flight In or an Early Flight Out”
Reviews.Author: TamikoBold
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hyatt numerous times when we had an early flight out, but this time we flew in really late and decided to stay at the Hyatt so we could have fresh start the next morning. Our flight landed at 11:30pm, and it was so nice to just walk to the hotel, check in, and then go back and get our bags from baggage claim. Check in was quick and easy, and McCoys Restaurant was actually still open with a limited menu. The food wasn't outstanding, but it was decent, and we were just glad to have it (as all the airport restaurants were long closed by that time). The room was clean, large, and comfortable. It had a balcony that actually overlooked the runway and a couple of terminals...it was fun to watch the planes the next morning. The gym was absolutely fantastic, with all the cardio machines and weights anyone could need. The pool is also very nice...it is outdoors and also overlooks the runway. It is a lot of fun to be out there, watching the planes take off and land. The Orlando Airport is one of the best as far as things for travelers to do. It has shops (Disney and Universal included), restaurants, etc, and if you're staying at the Hyatt, you have access to all of them. This is a huge plus for the hotel. We will definitely stay at the Hyatt again anytime we fly in late or have to leave early, or anytime my husband has business there near the Orlando airport. It is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at check in.. We came off a...”
Reviews.Author: janeyntim
Reviews.Content: Great service at check in.. We came off a red eye flight but got a room at check in ,thank goodness,and rested a few hours before renting our car. Parking is $12 a day and they will give you parking passes so when you exit the garage attached to the airport you don't get charged. There are signs at the airport for hyatt guest parking..once you park in the garage and go through the sliding doors you just walk straight into to the hotel entrance. We got great service and food at the restaurant on the main floor. You can print a coupon for the restaurant at restaurant.com the hotel is very nice and clean and surprisingly quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect and Wonderful ..”
Reviews.Author: gram2cam
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Orlando and got this hotel for $39 on priceline. The parking is $13 a day. That is the absolute only negative thing. It is in the airport so you have to loop around to terminal top parking - thats a pain. But the room is amazing and comfy and beautiful and for the price you can absolutely not go wrong. If you have a few days and price is an issue but you want quality, excellent service and exceptional accomodations with spot on housekeeping - absolutely stay here. They are a true 3.5 property

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Terminal! If that's Where U want To Be....”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: HYATT HOTEL – ORLANDO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT June 2010 Before you book this high end hotel, you should be aware of the fact that it is literally inside the airport terminal. This can be good or bad, depending on why you stay there and what plans you have for while you are there. For me, it was a mixed bag because I was not flying anywhere and had simply sought a good hotel at a good price in the Orlando airport area. For the harried air traveler, there are few conveniences that can match a decent hotel right in the airport terminal. This is an elegant and attractive hotel with its interior atrium opening into the huge passenger assembly area of Terminals A and B. From some rooms you can not only watch people milling about or waiting in endless TSA lines, but you may also be able to see the departures and arrivals postings on the wall. The rooms are very well appointed and the public areas equally pleasant. I got a king bed, a bath with marble throughout and a good workspace on a nice desk. The TV was fine. The seventh floor room appeared well cared for and I had no issues with housekeeping…which is a pleasant change. Check in was fine, except that the hotel was unable to help me find a parking place for my car, even though they supposedly have an area in the garage for guest parking. There was no problem, however, with them charging me to park. It seemed like a sort of reverse strategy: get the money and let the guest worry about finding a space that isn’t a mile from the hotel! Not a policy in keeping with the four star rating they apparently have. I expect that if they have a valet service, all of this is moot, but I didn’t want someone else parking my car. For what I paid through an on-line booking service where I didn’t know the name of the property until I paid for it, this was a pretty good deal. But after adding in parking, bellman tips to help lug in baggage, internet access fee, travel distance from car to hotel room and back, initially hauling my luggage around the ninety degree garage trying to find a hotel entry and having to resolve how to get from the hotel to where I intended to go for a dinner meeting, it wasn’t the good deal I had hoped for. In addition, once in the airport parking garage, the only way I could leave was to pay and then try and get back in again later. No “in-out” permitted. The source of these problems, according to hotel sources, is the airport authority, which owns the hotel and parking areas, thus controlling what guests can do. Net reaction: If you need overnight accommodations physically inside the airport grounds and want a quality facility, this might be the right choice. This would be the ideal place to stay if you have a very early departure because you can roll out of the hotel and into the terminal. No shuttles, no carts. If, like me, you had business outside the airport, even at a low price this was not the greatest. There are plenty of good, lower priced hotels with free parking within a few minutes of the terminals. They would be a better choice. Would I stay there again? Yes, if I got the same low price, was just staying on airport property for the night, didn’t have a car to park and didn’t want to go anywhere else; like Disney, Orlando city, etc. I suspect these issues are why they are offering the deals on the unnamed hotel booking site.

Reviews.Title: “The convenience of this Hyatt property is completely discounted by the high price and poor service.”
Reviews.Author: SHOUPIII
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency @ the Orlando Airport and wanted to send a note to express my displeasure with the Hotel’s handling of my last stay. We stayed for 2 nights @ $189 per room and had two rooms. 1) The rooms requested were to be connecting rooms for my children and in-law 2) Double beds were requested 3) Crib was not present, but was sent up upon request. 4) Upon checking in I was told by the bellhop the pool was closed for a private function and was unavailable to swim until after 8pm – too late for my infant children. Freddie at the front desk was very responsive to my mother-in-law’s call to the front desk – he even offered to have somebody drive us to and from an another Hyatt property 6 minutes away. Which although seems like a helpful solution, the logistics and time of traveling to another property was not really an acceptable solution. Also, he removed the E-upgrade charge from my room ($15 charge for nothing). As a frequent business traveler – this type of service makes me very upset. The hotel must rely on one time, non repeat business from people stuck @ the airport. Over the years, I have had numerous pleasant stays at this hotel and this stay was very disappointing for me and my family. I could have saved $200+ by staying @ the nearest Embassy Suites. The convenience of this Hyatt property is completely discounted by the high price and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and fun”
Reviews.Author: bjyokums
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our flight at the Hyatt. Angie at the front desk was a sweetheart and extremely helpful to us, non frequent flyers. The bellman that helped us get to our gate and told us how to navigate security, etc was fabulous. I wish I could remember his name. Some of the staff we encountered were adequate but a bit lacking. I really wish I could remember their names. The room was clean and very comfortable. The balcony was great (Angie picked this out for us.) McCoys Bar and Grill was not so hot and I would not bother with that again. Loved the pool but more umbrellas are necessary. Really hot up there on the roof. All in all, I still hate flying but seeing all the people coming and going helped me, sort of, believe that I could fly and live to tell about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest airport hotel I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: theotherkatie
Reviews.Content: The Orlando Hyatt vastly exceeded my expectations. I did not expect an airport hotel to be so... well... nice. The location could not be more convenient, the rooms are very clean, the beds are very comfortable, and the food is quite good. I ordered room service once and ate breakfast at the restaurant once. All the staff I interacted with during my stay were courteous and helpful. My friend and I ended up checking out a day early because our plans changed. They did not charge us a penalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jsimmons58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after spending 4 days at a Disney property. It is in the airport so it was very convenient for our early morning flight home. The room appeared to have been fairly recently renovated. The bathroom was tastefully finished but not overly roomy. I was concerned about staying at an airport hotel, but plane noise was not a problem for us so they have done a good job with soundproofing their construction. The had 4 very nice pillows on the bed. We had early breakfast and although not up to the standards I would expect from Hyatt, is was well done and we were able to get in and out quickly. We booked our reservation online and find decent discounts for under $200 so make sure you plan your stay here before arriving. I think the higher rates I have seen posted online are from people who missed flights and did not plan ahead so they were at the mercy of the hotel's "rack rates."

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good quality hotel but eat elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: missfickle
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for one night after a long journey. We prebooked a room here for convenience and appreciated a comfortable night stay before next leg of our journey. We shared a room with two small double beds. The room and bathroom was clean and of good quality although we were expecting king size beds. Too tired to request a larger room but it was adequate for a night's stay. The restaurant was the only eatery nearby, all the airport restaurants were closed by the time we checked in. Food was very disappointing, the children had soup which was supposed to be Campbells but tasted weird, husband had the strangest pizza I have ever tasted and I opted for tapas style dishes which were tiny and tasteless. As a result we chose to walk over to McDonald for breakfast! Overall, hotel as one would expect for an airport, a convenient stop over which was a refreshing start to our holiday, minus the food!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jpug2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night, as we were en route to another destination and had to stay in Orlando for an early morning flight. I didn't quite know what to expect, but I have to say I was very happy with the accommodations. First of all, we were automatically upgraded TWICE, which resulted in a very spacious room overlooking the runway. It was newly renovated, clean, and had a comfortable bed and good shower. Most surprisingly, though, was how quiet it was! I thought I'd hear the semblance of a plane taking off, but nope...not at all! It was a little pricier than I would have liked, but you can't beat the convenience of being right inside of the airport: we literally had to go downstairs to get to our gate! We figured we would have spent that extra money anyway had we taken a cab to the airport and, as mentioned before, the automatic upgrade to a bigger room made the price that much more palatable. If you're needing a great overnight stay near the Orlando airport, look no further and book here.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient”
Reviews.Author: vacasoon
Reviews.Content: My husband was coming home from a late night flight instead of driving home we decided to stay at the Hyatt. We got a great deal off of Hotwire. The staff was excellent. The rooms are beautiful. We did not have any issues with airport noise. Our room faced into the airport which was fun to people watch. When parking watch closely for the signs so that you can be in the far left hand lane. It cost $16 to valet. Thanks Hyatt for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Literally in airport, good for an overnight, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: If you need to spend one night in the Orlando Airport area, this is a great option. It is literally located inside the airport therefore allowing quick access to and from the gates. With this convenience however comes a cost - you are not near anything else. Access to the hotel lobby is done via escalator in one of the airports large atriums. It is often noisy and crowded in this area but once you get up to the lobby the noise softens. The check-in area can sometimes feel cramped if it is busy, but I've never had to wait long to be processed here. You will notice once you get in the elevator (and use your key for access) that this hotel is large. Two hallways extend from the elevators opening to more hallways. The hotel has a general open space feel to it which is nice. Soft touches like greenery and fountains make the open hallways more upscale. Rooms are very nicely furnished. A huge king size bed always greets me, along with its abundance of pillows. The rooms are decortated in a bit of a modern Victorian theme, with lighter wood furnishings and green/grey/yellow colors. Most rooms have balconies either facing outside or the airpot atrium. I always face outside and the room is dead quiet - some of my colleagues have faced the airport and found it a bit noisy. Bathrooms are very large, usually including both a shower stall and bathtub. Bath products are the higher end Hyatt brand with some nice extras such as toothpaste. Fluffy towels are a plus. Internet is provided for a fee in the room, although if you have a balcony facing the atrium you can usually pick up the MCO free wifi signal. Consequently, you can also go sit in the airport and use their free wifi. There is a functional gym, though no large by any standard especially for a hotel this big. I imagine it's not widely used since most traffic is probably quick transit passengers. The pool area is also relatively small though never usually busy. The fountains shooting into the pool with the Air Traffic Tower is a nice photo op. :) There is a pub in the hotel that is open quite late - always apprecaited by myself if we have a late arrival. The breakfast buffet also gets rave reviews from my colleagues. I generally just head into the airport for food, stopping at the large food court that has many options. Overall this is a nice, upscale hotel. Its location isn't the greatest if you are spending multiple nights here but it is perfect for an evening. You can get some sun on the pool deck, some food at the airport and have almost no travel time to your gate. Exactly what an airport hotel should be!

Reviews.Title: “Literally the most convenient airport hotel anywhere.....”
Reviews.Author: geezer715
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is directly in the main concourse of the Orlando airport.....20 FEET from where you enter the security area. No shuttle needed...no long walk...no taxi. You literaly get off the plane and check in. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. No hassles or noise from the planes or concourse. Rooms spacious and freshly renovated. Great view of the runways from the balcony most rooms have. Overall wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...Highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: mong1114
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt the night before departing on a Disney Cruise and I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! I am very picky, and have extensive experience both working in the hospitality industry and travelling for business and I was very happy here. The location is terrific and easy to get to from inside the airport. An added bonus is that you can walk right out into the airport and there are plenty of family-friendly dining options (food court, Macaroni Grill, etc.) if you choose not to eat in the hotel. We also passed some time in the airport shops as Disney World, Sea World, etc. all have shops here which kept the children entertained. From the time we arrived, I was impressed with the staff and how professional and courteous they were. The bellman explained the layout of the hotel, told us about the pool and fitness center, restaurants, etc. The concierge and front desk staff were also top notch. There was a nice rooftop pool that the kids enjoyed as well. The beds were sooo comfortable, it was the best night's sleep I had in a long time!!! We had a room overlooking the runway, which I highly recommend if you have children. My 5 year old and 8 year old were up at dawn, watching the planes take off. They thought it was the coolest thing!!!! Although some people complained that you could hear the planes, I can tell you that we did not. Our room was pretty soundproof...I was actually shocked at how little outside noise we heard. Maybe a few times we heard a VERY low, distant rumble, but nothing that would disturb sleep or interfere with conversation. Rooms were clean and bathrooms were updated and spacious. Our only disappointment was the breakfast buffet. It was limited (no pancakes, waffles, french toast) on the day we were there, which was a disappointment to the kids. We were going to order for them off the menu, but the staff discouraged it, saying it would take at least 20 minutes to arrive. If you are taking a Disney cruise, this hotel is so convenient. They brought our luggage to the terminal and the next time we saw it, it was in our stateroom. It is very convenient!!! We had a very pleasant stay and I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Was fine as hotels go, but not without its faults”
Reviews.Author: faithbeckynick
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay at Florida International Airport when my husband was unexpectedly unable to take the flight from Heathrow to Florida with us. I was travelling with my 3 children and booked into the Hyatt to wait for his flight to arrive 24 hours later. Although my husband had booked and paid for the hotel from the UK, when I arrived there after travelling for 20 hours, the chap on reception was adamant that we had no booking with them and I stood for 10 minutes arguing before the Concierge arrived and my booking miraculously appeared. To be fair, the concierge was extremely good, and faxed some important documents to my husband in the UK for me. The hotel itself was very pleasant, with a nice rooftop swimming pool. The room was clean, with two double beds, but they seemed very narrow and not overly comfortable. I stayed for 2 nights, and the hotel was adequate for my needs. The problem came later when after my husband arrived and we continued to our destination, the hotel deducted an extra nights money from our credit card. We contacted them and they said it would take 5-7 days. This was a real inconvenience to us as we needed the money for our holiday and already had not budgeted for spending and paying for 2 nights in the hotel, let alone paying for a third night that we did not book nor use. We chased the Hyatt up daily, and eventually they agreed to replace the money within 72 hours. It turned up in our account whilst we were waiting at the airport for our flight home!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Top notch service”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingbunch
Reviews.Content: We were returning from a Cruise in Port Canaveral and had 2 days before our Early morning flight back to Toronto. We booked with Priceline and got an amazing deal. We wanted to be IN the airport for an early morning flight and we had stayed in this hotel previously. The last time we stayed here were were not impressed by the service but impressed how easy it is to return a rental car and make an early morning flight. Well the service has certainly improved since our stay 2 years ago. We explained when we arrived that we would prefer a room that we could bring in an extra cot (travelling 2 adults, 9 year old and 14 year old) so our kids could get some sleep and not kill each other in the same bed. They offered us a business suite that had a murphy bed, roll away and a pull out couch. We gladly accepted the offer. ALL of the beds were comfy - the room was enormous with a boardroom table a few sofas and coffee tables and lots of space. The room was super clean, the service was great and the bathroom supplies were well stocked. The valet parking was quick and friendly and they gladly answered all questions. The airport terminal is steps away and easy access to Starbucks, crispy cream, and lots of food options. The pool is nice with views of airplanes taking off. I would recommend this for anyone with an early flight and the convenience of being in the airport, it would not be a place that you would stay for an extended holiday. We will stay here again if we have an early flight out. Good work Hyatt - your service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnitainNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt one night on our way to a cruise. We were met with a friendly receptionist at check-in who quickly got us a room. We followed our porter escort to our room and along the way he got us familiar with the hotel, suggesting restaurants and features (fitness center, pool, stairway, etc.) we would most likely want to utilize. Our room was spacious with a nice balcony overlooking the airport, desk and TV. Bathroom was a good size for our family of 4 as well. We were situated close to the heated outdoor pool, which was great for our kids. Shopping can be done right on-site at the airport and a food court is a short walk away. While we only stayed one night, I wouldn't hesitate to come back to the Orlando Airport Hyatt. If taking a Disney cruise, your luggage will be picked up and transported directly to the ship terminal. Nothing to take but your carry-on. Very friendly staff, nice amenities and short walk to terminal made this an ideal place to stay

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt Regency Orlando Airport is my 'go to' hotel coming /going to MCO”
Reviews.Author: mkraemer
Reviews.Content: I fly cross country to get to Orlando, and very often that means late arrivals and early departures. I find it a wonderful thing to simply pick up my bags, go 'upstairs' and check in to a lovely hotel that has comfortable beds and nice amenities. On my most recent trip, I stayed on Friday evening, after arrival, and then on Monday, before a super-early flight on Tuesday. Everything was perfect, and I'll be happy to be back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel considering its in the airport”
Reviews.Author: JudithCharmers123
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be found actually in Orlando airport. Because of this they are used to people coming and going at all times of the day. The check-in was very smooth and the staff very pleasant. Once you are in your room, you would never know that you were in one of America's busiest airports. The beds are very comforable and the bathroom is large with everything that you need. There was also a nice swimming pool outside if you have time for a swim. The bar was open late (but its not a noisy bar) and the staff were excellent here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here because it was so convenient after flying in from San Antonio, and booked an Executive Room overlooking the airport. The room was quite large and had a huge terrace area as well. Shame it was raining! There was a large bathroom, with separate bath and shower and an adjoining wash basin area with a coffee maker. We were on the same floor as the gym, which was well equipped and overlooked the terminal. We ate at McCoy's restaurant, which although lacking in atmosphere offered good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for one night”
Reviews.Author: Babbi18
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed here the first night of our trip. We stayed at disney and went on the disney cruise for the rest of our trip. This was a good hotel for one night. The airport has restaurants and shopping places for everyone. the pool was ok. The rooms were nice but you could here planes. But what do you expect at an airport. Overall, a nice hotel. *Airport restaurants close early

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit”
Reviews.Author: bombshell
Reviews.Content: Stay here on arrival for the night, third time, as usual perfection. As a 9 hour flight just to wheel your suitcase to the check in desk is bliss. As usual friendly reception, room comfortable and clean with large walk in shower, new sushi bar for a light snack very welcome, breakfast fabulous though we did have to pay as not included in our rate this time. Free use of internet for 15 minutes in reception. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: casey+jenny
Reviews.Content: We were put into this hotel over night as our flight to washington was cancelled!! so not really good reasoning for us to be staying there. Friendly, helpful reception staff when we checked in! we were also given food and drink voucher but did not use them as we had already eaten before we found out our flight was cancelled. The location of this hotel is amazing! Literally in the airport itself! you definatly can't be late for a flight if staying in this hotel! Rooms were a nice size with a nice sized bathroom and a good T.V! view out of you're window was down into the airport lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: island-gal-in-NJ
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for more convinience at the airport. Wonderful hotel - excellent gym facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. Definitely.”
Reviews.Author: Leeann_Saskatchewan
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous. So convenient (especially after a long flight). And - when we lost something on our trip, the staff were so helpful about looking for it. We stayed here when we arrived in Orlando. Wish we had stayed when we were flying out, as well. The security line-up is right outside the hotel door. How can you beat that?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet, Convenient, Some Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: Writingandtravel
Reviews.Content: I tried to book on Yahoo and the price for a King-bed room was 150; the Hyatt homepage gave me a rate of 109 (with an AAA discount); with taxes, 140. Not bad. The room was comfortable, good cable (free HBO), too far from the free airport WiFi to get it (and I never pay for the in-room WiFi--rip-off!). Two complaints: the towels were a bit cheap--the usual washed-a-million-times white ones that are rough and thin. The bathroom was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and there were a lot of pillows and a soft microfiber throw blanket. The restaurant on the hotel lobby floor took too long to seat us, and we walked by over a dozen empty, clean tables to wait in the bar and the hostess did not call my name. I had to go abck and ask. Food was good but a bit pricy. Breakfast on the 9th floor restaurant was buffet--34 with taxes for two, and the service was TOO slow. The fitness center is excellent, and you can see a video of my room at youtube under jeffhfromoxford

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an overnight at the airport”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: This property could not be more convenient to the airport. It is literally in the middle of the airport between the A and B terminals. Rooms are nice and staff were friendly. The property also has kiosks to help speed up arrival and departure. My only recommendation would be to avoid rooms on the floor that has the restaurant (I believe it was 8). During our stay (only one night) there was a fair amount of hallway traffic to / from the restaurant and it was audible from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convient Stay for Traveling”
Reviews.Author: MACJacksonville_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before we flew to NYC. Our room was very spacious and nice, service was awesome as usual. We also stayend here on our return night back to Orlando,which was great since our flight from JFK was delayed. The room that we were put in was even better than the last stay. HUGE bathroom with a dual vanity, room service was very courteous. Beds very comfortable and lovely nice flat screen TV. We've stayed here before and will continue again when traveling out of Orlando!!! Highly recommend the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great stay”
Reviews.Author: endicott1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the airport Hyatt the night before our Disney Cruise. Since we'd puchased transfers to the port of call from the airport, we thought it would be convenient to just walk downstairs to the bus--and we were right. It's a very nice hotel--the staff was friendly and pleasant, the room was pretty clean with updated amenities; also to be inside the airport, it was quiet as well. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which was just okay, but overall, the hotel more than served our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linemon
Reviews.Content: For a Saturday night stay over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend, couldn't have asked for a better bargain ($119 before taxes). Excellent location making it a no stress travel time, being right there, having already returned the car and able to keep an eye on the security lines for terminal B from the hotel lobby levels or elevator. Having never stayed at a Hyatt, the staff is professional in demeanor and dress (love the ear pieces for the radios, no blaring two way radios heard around here). Very polite, they even address you by last name at the front desk counter and over the phone. Key card access to room levels (keeping the vagrants out) and for a aviation fan/pilot, you have to ask for a runway view to view/grade landings and watch the commercial traffic. The rooms are nothing to scoff at either. Plush king size bed, flat screen tv and fancy fixtures in the bathroom (they not only give you the standard shampoo/conditioner, they even give you a plus size travel toothpaste). The outdoor air temperture was 51 degrees at 10PM, but the heated pool was still too cold for us this evening. A nice touch with it being on the roof level, too bad there was no hottub.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and complete”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Airport hotel in Orlando is attached directly to the airport just ouside of security for gates 60-100, so it is as convenient as possible for stopovers, late arrivals, and early departures. The main lobby is up an escalator or elevator from the airport floor, curiously, there is only elevator access back down (remember the main airport is at floor 3, not floor 1).. The check-in kiosk is miserably slow, you are better off to wait in the short lines to be served by one of the receptionists. The hotel is surprisingly large, and there was a considerable walk to get around the perimeter to my room: be sure to ask for something close to the elevators if you are carrying a load. The room itself is plush Hyatt comfort: a large king bed, ample pillows and blankets, a sitting and work area. There is a large-screen TV, minibar, coffeemaker in the bathroom (mine was broken), clock with iPod player (mis-set by half an hour), and fast wired and wireless internet connection for $10 per day. The room overlooks the atrium with a door that opens to a small balcony. There is suprisingly little 'street noise' considering the position: the room was quiet and easy to work in. The bathroom was clean and well-outfitted; the hot water had good pressure and moderate temperature. The hotel offers the full range of business services, restaurants, fitness facilities, and guest services you would expect, and the staff was helpful when I needed to print some documents. There is an automatic $1 fee for bag check, but overall the hotel is professional and stylish. The location and appointments don't come cheaply, but it is a comfortable and quiet stay

Reviews.Title: “On Airport Luxury”
Reviews.Author: geminigirlengland
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay one night in the Hyatt Regency Hotel Orlando after a long flight from Lon/Gatwick as we had a two hour drive to our destination. It was nice to just check in to a hotel right on the airport terminal to freshen up, relax and get a good nights sleep before picking up a rental car next day. Check in was quick and the room very spacious and well appointed. We asked for a quiet room which we got one. There was a coffee machine but tea making would be nice as well for us Brits who like a cuppa in the morning. Buffet breakfast was ok but some dishes were empty and not replenished often enough and when I asked a member of staff for some butter he asked how many I needed to which I replied enough for two but other people will need some too. When he came back with twp pats he gave them to the wrong person!! The pot of tea also was awful so have coffee. We would check out next time and go elsewhere for breakfast. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, elegant, and right in the terminal.”
Reviews.Author: Swarton
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly luxurious and wonderfully convenient. The main restaurant was closed on Sunday evening, but the more casual Bar & Grill had innovative, delicious food. It could use more towels, more bathroom counter space, and a table as well as chairs on the balcony. But overall, this is as fine an airport hotel as I can recall anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Hyatt before an early flight home. The location within the airport is perfect, its lovely to get up in the morning and just go downstairs to check in. Pool is nice and its great to watch the planes coming and going. Rooms are really clean and comfortable. We keep saying that one of these times we'll spend more than a night there as we like it so much. My only criticism is that the food in McCoys restaurant was not great the evening that we went but there are plenty of other restaurants in the airport. One tip is that if you decide to get a drink at one of the bars in the airport itself be sure to take your ID whatever your age as they ID everyone and wont serve you without it. We saw a 70 year old having to produce his driving license so beware !

Reviews.Title: “Vey convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ginota
Reviews.Content: Best location if you have early or very late flights .Rooms large e\nough , typicallu american though they need a renovation.Especially the bathrooms. As there is a huge food court in the airport lobby there is choice 24 hours a day .Also buses form the airport run almost to every attraction so who needs a cab Breakfast was ok and overall apositive expereience.

Reviews.Title: “NO HASSLE IN THE HEART OF THE AIRPORT”
Reviews.Author: WINTERDEVEREUX
Reviews.Content: This is the second occasion we have stayed at this hotel.Check in was early as we had just got in from an early docking cruise ship-we booked the ''awaken package'' SO that gave us a late check out next day. great family room,great resturaunt ,best breakfast out there!!! Staff are so hospitable and will do their utmost to help you. Our room was so quiett-no mean feat considering it overlooked the runway!! Bathroom was good too. We love this hotel and will be staying here again. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone whether on business or vaccation as we were.Great place to relax before a long overnight flight! SUPERB

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night following our flight from the UK on October 7th. It was so nice just to be able to get our luggage then go stright into the hotel. Our room was spacious and clean with a super bathroom. The only thing missing was a safe. We had a balcony that overlooked a carpark but it was nice to be able to go out there for a while. We were able to have a cooling swim in the hotel pool, followed by a very good dinner in McCoys restaurant, then bed. In the morning we had the excellent breakfast buffet in the hotel before collecting our hire car and driving down to Clearwater. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: J_from_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this hotel because of an early morning flight the next day (hotel is located inside OIA). When I arrived at the hotel, there was a line of guests waiting to be checked in. A somewhat disorganized line. Luckily, it did not take too long to get checked in. The rooms are very nice and quite quiet for being located in an airport. As far as hotel dining, there is a fancy restaurant overlooking the runways (quite pricey) as well as a bar/grill option. I decided against both, and went down into OIA and dined at the Macaroni Grill. Plenty of cheaper food options in the airport. Note that breakfast is served starting at 6 a.m., which may not be helpful if you have an early flight. However, the airport concessions are open by then, so you can always grab a pastry there. Also, on rates: if you have a AAA/CAA membership, you might get better terms then the quote "best rate available". Usually the first rate quoted is pretty draconian re: cancellations, but the AAA rate allows you to cancel up to 24 hours before arrival and get the same price as the "best rate".

Reviews.Title: “hyatt.great hotel and venue”
Reviews.Author: johndavies68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after a long flight from the u.k. When coming out of us border control there are massive letters A and B on alternative walls in the airport concourse. In between the letters there is the fountain look directly in front of you see the word Hyatt, behind the word are lifts to get to the reception at the Hyatt. Once we checked in we were given a twin queen room overlooking the airport concourse. Room very plush, nice decor and beautiful bathroom. This room comes with a fridge but no safe. Room also has a balcony which isn't recommended for very small children. We had this room for £44 with Hotwire. Will be staying here again next year. Also, pool very nice and a great view of the runways.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with a great business plan”
Reviews.Author: monicam00
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. The business plan was great and included free breakfast in the restaurant overlooking the tarmac!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for travelers leaving Orlando early”
Reviews.Author: CrizM
Reviews.Content: A friend and I needed to rent a car and travel to Cocoa Beach early in the morning to take a cruise to the Bahamas. Since we didn't need a car until the next morning and still needed a place to stay, we decided to stay at the Hyatt. We got the best deal online and were so amazed by the luxury of the hotel. We worked out inside their gym, had dinner at one of the restaurants inside the airport, and hung out at the hotel bar. The next morning, we checked out of our room and walked to the rental car agency. When we returned from our cruise, we decided to check back into the hotel since we both had flights out the next morning. We woke up, checked our bags into our flight, had breakfast and hung out in our room until 40 min. before our flight. The rooms are so updated. The bed and linen are plush. We had a room facing the airport lobby and just sat out on the balcony people watching. We even went shopping in the airport. I highly recommend this hotel for your last night in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melaniejade31
Reviews.Content: Initial Impression A+ This hotel is beautiful inside and out. There's a gorgeous fountain as you drive up with palm trees all around. Rooms A+ Incredibly comfortable bed and pillows. I wanted to buy a mattress just like theirs, but I forgot to take down the name. The room was luxurious and spacious. The bathroom was beautiful and had plenty of room. Our room was so quiet. It was wonderful! Location A+ The reason I say this is an A+ location is because my fiance and I had a 7AM flight. We stayed here the night before, woke up an hour before and just took the elevator into the airport. The convenience was worth a million dollars. We didn't get to try any of the food, room service, or see more than the lobby, check-in and our room, but everything we did experience was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for early morning departures”
Reviews.Author: ilovehyatt
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! This is the best spot for early departures because you are literally inside the airport. The rooms are clean, the staff is great and the restaurants are good. There are rooms with balconies that over look the terminal and you can watch the travelers below rushing about. Other rooms with balconies that face the runways so I was watching planes take off and land all day but once night fell and I shut the balcony door I did not hear the outside noise. The pool and fitness center were nice. The theme parks are close by and other restaurants are just outside of the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “average+ hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertafamily
Reviews.Content: We had any early flight in out in the morning so stayed here for one night on our way back home from our disney vacation.The location is perfect, right out your door to airline check-in. Staff were very nice to deal with,pleasent and friendly.The rooms I found to be a bit dated, we were assigned a room on the lobby/airport concourse side even though when I booked online I requested a room on the runway/pool side. It was a bit noisy on this side and could always seem to here someone or something throught out the night.The beds were comfortable but are only doubles so for two people on one bed you don't have alot of room.The rooms were clean but I expected more considering it is a Hyatt. This is an average to better than average hotel, for the rate I paid I expected more,maybe the rooms on the runway side are better/updated. I would not stay here again for the same rate, instead I think I would consider the Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza nearby for a much lower rate and probably nicer room than this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sannmarie9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 day in my opinion I recieved first class service from start to finish. This hotel is adequately placed inside of the airport. The staff are very courteous, friendly, professional and accomodating. The rooms are decorated to the highest standard, (gold plated bathroom fixtures which are off set by dark wood cupboards etc) very plush. The beds are very high and the quilts and pillows are ultra soft. I stayed in a room which faced the run-way.(A very beautiful and interesting view).We had a huge balcony for which you could easily sit around all day and catch a tan. Surprisingly, I could not hear any noises from outside . We paid for a room which included a buffet breakfast and late check out which included all taxes and gratuities. Therefore in the morning we had to go to the nineth floor to the hotels restaurant to get our breakfast buffet. It was fine dining all the way, the waiters were polite courteous and very friendly. There is an outside pool and sun bathing area on the 7th floor. This area reminded me of the garden of eden, very plush. The gym in which I did not use also contained state of the art equipment. When we had checked out and because we had an evening flight we ate in their McCoy's restaurant and the food was reasonably priced and the portions were huge. On the first night we ate outside of the hotel at one of the food courts in the airport. The food is not very nice the hotel food is better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- Forgot we we're in an Airport!!”
Reviews.Author: ReeciePeicie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Hyatt Regency Orlando Int. Airport and it was absolutely wonderful. Once we stepped into the actual hotel hallways we forgot we were still in an airport! It was very clean and the noise of the airport just disappeared. The workout facility was up to date and clean. Each cardio machine has it's own TV, which you can plug earphones into while you work out. There are also a basket of clean individually wrapped headphones that you can use for free! Towels and water were also provided at the gym. The pool was also very nice and relaxing. The room was clean and impressive. The decor was very sophisticated and contemporary. We are really glad we booked here.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: bmasurat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my teenaged daughter. We were attending a dance convention. Everything about this hotel is wonderful. You are right inside the airport, but you cannot hear any planes taking off from anywhere inside. The rooms are very, very nice - housekeeping at this hotel is the best I've experienced anywhere. Our room was spotless - really spotless. We requested extra towels and they were brought promptly and cheerfully. The front desk staff was helpful and accomodating - they helped me straighten out a parking issue. There is a very nice pool on the roof. I would not, however, recommend either of the hotel restaurants. They are expensive, but the real reason is that the staff in both restaurants are rude and have no idea what customer service means. I don't like to spend alot of money and be treated like I'm a bother to the wait staff. However, there is a food court and several other restaurant choices in the airport (Chilis, Fox Sports and Macaroni Grill), so you have lots of choices. But back to the hotel, everything about this hotel is pleasant. Beds are comfortable and staff is the best. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice end of vacation...cruising!”
Reviews.Author: akersjr
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we've stayed at the Hyatt Orlando Airport. It just reinforces that if I'm cruising in/out of Port Canaveral...I'll want to stay here! We had another great experience! Our rate wasn't as good this time :( but the service was wonderful, as were the rooms! We had two rooms that we were able to check in at 9A in the morning after getting off the ship. The parking staff was wonderful...as they graciously allowed us to "temporarily" leave our rental car in the check in area as we checked in, changed clothes and made plans for the day. Normally you have to quickly decide to valet or self park...which isn't very convenient (or cost effective). Rooms were GREAT. After a day at Universal studios...we came back to relax at the pool...and then have dinner at McCoy's...great food and great service. Then...as I checked in for our flights in the hotel lobby online (a free service), the hotel staff was checking on me to make sure I had everything I needed and the computer/website/printer was working for me. We checked out just fine early next morning. Walked just downstairs to get bags checked in line for security ...and that was that! Well...security was a bit long...but not as bad as if we'd had to actually GO to airport! A tip: if you rent a car at all: rent from onsite place...like budget...easy return...in the airport...you can just walk to hotel through airport. And, there's basically a shopping mall IN the airport, and other restaurants (you don't have to go through security for these). Very easy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: HollidaySlim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a cruise cause of all the great things I had heard about the hotel. The Hyatt was spot on! When I booked I asked for a room that had a view of the runways (love to watch the planes take off and land!) When we check in the font desk clerk told me that the room type i booked did not have any views of the runways...So they upgraded my room type! The room was extremely clean, and the room service was prompt. Check out was painless and even through we were only there for short time cause we had an early flight the experience was awesome! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: NVOttawa
Reviews.Content: Based on the review on Tripadvisor, we stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a week during the week of March 23, 2009. The hotel was clean, very well maintained and the sevice was excellent ! As recommended by some on this site, we requested and got a room facing the runway. The kids loved it ! We had a late flight and the hotel was kind enough to allow us a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt standards and unbelieveable convienence.”
Reviews.Author: agbowden
Reviews.Content: Traveling for a quick vacation, I used points for 2 nights at this gem. I had rented a car not knowing the hotel was in the center of the airport. Not needed! This hotel allows the most convienent access to the airport imaginable, and has the courteous staff, classy amenities, and high quality dining expected of the Hyatt Regency. Food service at the pool was available - and I will definately come back here any tome I fly from this airport. Tomorrow I will check out of the room, go to the lobby and get in line to be screened for boarding - need I say more??

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt, you kicked butt on this one...”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: Ok. Airport with a hotel in it. Sounded to good to be true and it was. Beautiful hotel RIGHT in the airport. If you have an early flight, stay here. Even if it costs more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: coach02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our trip. Hotel was very nice! Had nice rooms with a fridge. Didn't have a very good view maybe because we had a priceline rate. It was very nice to be in the hotel for an early morning flight. Hotel had a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: Mr G
Reviews.Content: I can't remember any airport hotel as convenient as this one. Hotel is located in the main airport building, five minutes away from getting your bags. I stayed there arriving from a transatlantic flight and drove to Tampa the next day. Then stayed one night on the return – arrived the evening before the transatlantic return. Very relaxing way to travel. It's not new, but not old either. But it's aging a bit. Room large and clean. Mini fridge and overhead fan. At least one million pillows on the bed – in fact, I had to find a place in the room to put all of them at night. Very comfortable hotel, but most of the airport shops closed before 9:30, including food places. So not much to do after that. Staff was first rate. Must the result of a great hotel manager and training program. Very professional, great personal appearance, efficient, knowledgeable and helpful. Good job Hyatt. Room was quiet despite the proximity to the runways. I made a US Government rate reservation a month prior and had a nice surprise when the reservation ($166) rate was reduced to $133 to reflect the Government rate for that day when I checked in. I didn't have to ask. I was very impressed with that. The hotel McCoy Bar had an interesting fare. The regular stuff you would expect as well as more exotic items: sushi and a tapas type approach. The tapas were a good idea, but the taste was a bit predictable. "Thai tenders" were big but with a bottled sweet chili sauce (lots of garlic). The fried calamari were nicely done, but undone by a strange sauce underneath (should have only used some lemon and pepper with a lightly salted batter). If you didn't like the sauce, it was on the bottom of the calamari., so you didn't have a choice. Coconut prawn was tasty, but so-so. All items looked prepackaged. However, a great idea (social communal food) but fresher items with a bit more thought about the sauce could have made it great. Still, a nice relaxing place to have a casual meal after getting off the plane. What I didn't like (there is always room for improvement). The room had wireless internet, but not free. Also the internet fee was not very obvious. If budget hotels can offer free internet, these larger chains could also. No free parking (it's the airport, so I suppose that's understandable). I thought the television could have had more channels (after all, it's the US). The TV was a CRT rather than a flat screen. Size was adequate, but I expected something larger. No safe in the room. It's not expensive to put a safe in every room. Breakfast not included in the room price. Breakfast was, however, very nice but the cost was pushing the high side of reasonable. Not to end on the dislikes, I would stay there again in a second. Convenient for the weary traveler, comfortable and well run. Very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or leisure!”
Reviews.Author: sjohnso6
Reviews.Content: I was here for a meeting with colleagues from all over the US; I was so pleased to walk out of my terminal and immediately find my hotel! The location is incredibly convenient; you can utilize the restaurants in the hotel or simply go down the escalator and have access to all the food court places (which I preferred to expensive hotel food). The room was large, clean, and looked into the airport, but it was not noisy at all - they must use thick glass! I had a balcony overlooking it, too, if I was so inclined. The pool is AWESOME; lots of lounge chairs and areas to sit; hardly ever any plane noise oand NO fumes; I couldn't wait to get out of my daily meetings and quickly get out there to the pool area. The breakfast area was wonderful; we all watched the sunrise each morning from the huge picture windows and wait staff were all very friendly. Yes, you are kind of closed in via "Terminal" but as a business traveler, I actually appreciated not having to deal with taxis/rental cars and having everything in one place. I was able to walk down to check in for my flight at the terminal 8 hours before it and then just go through security when the flight time neared. I can't express how much I enjoyed this beautiful hotel and all it has to offer; I plan to return here for leisure in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: CrazyInTexas
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we booked this hotel the last night of our Florida vacation due to a very early morning flight. We booked a room with two queen-sized beds. We arrived at the hotel at 10:30 p.m. after returning our rental car. We used the express check in which only took about 5 minutes. It also provided us with our key cards. A bell hop came to our rescue and loaded up our luggage. He asked when our flight was the next day and made arrangements for a bell hop to arrive at our room at 6 a.m. to load our luggage and take it to our airline for check in. The room was very clean and relaxing. It even had doors that opened onto a small balcony. The beds were the most comfortable that we slept on our entire trip. I noticed that there were a couple of restaurants in the hotel, but since our arrival was so late, they were already closed. The hotel does however have 24 hour room service, but didn't use this either. The only problem with our stay was that the remote control did not work for the TV. However, when we phoned guest services they were at our door within 10 minutes, replaced the batteries and everything was great. At 6 a.m. the following morning the bell hop phoned our room and asked if we were ready to go downstairs. He was at our door in a matter of minutes and took our luggage directly to our airline for check-in. The service, facilities, and location of this hotel are outstanding and made our last night in Orlando much easier.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Just Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jodcon
Reviews.Content: We booked our final night in Orlando at the Hyatt Regency International Airport mainly because we had an early flight and thought it would be much easier than getting up and driving across town/checking in our rental car at 5 AM. Even though the reviews we read were mostly positive, we really didn't expect to find anything more than a moderate hotel plunked in the airport with average amenities. We were dead wrong. When we found the location of our rental car return (Avis), there was an entrance to the hotel right there, so we unloaded the car and entered the hotel. Even though that entrance is not near the lobby, we were spotted by a bellhop almost immediately, and he brought a cart for our bags and took us to the lobby. The staff was very friendly and knowledgable, took the time to explain the layout of the hotel and which ammenities they offered, as well as what to expect during check-in at the airport the next morning. Very thorough. The bellhop took us to our room in one of the elevators, there are 3 or 4 right by the lobby. For security reasons the elevators will only go up if activated by a room key, which is a great security measure. He asked us when our flight was leaving the next morning, we told him the airline and flight time and he said he would have a bellhop come to our room and take us right to the flight check-in, that was a nice service we didn't expect. He also told us that there was a channel on our TV which had updated flight schedules on it and when we checked later sure enough...it was just like the big boards in the airport. Another handy service. There are 2 restaurants on the property, one close to the lobby which looked moderately priced, and one on the top floor which is more upscale and only opens in the evenings apparently. We didn't eat at either one so can't comment on the food, but they looked clean and the menus looked appetizing. The top-floor restaurant looks like it has a great view of the area. We instead chose to eat in the actual airport, as they have quite a few restaurants as well as a large food court with fast-food places. We ended up eating at a very good Italian restaurant, and noticed they had a good-sized Chili's also. Later we checked out the pool, again wasn't expecting much but was surprised to find a tropical outside setting with covered seating, a waterfall, many trees and plants, and a manned barcart. And the strange thing is that you would think having an outside pool at an airport hotel would be loud from the air traffic, but you really don't hear the planes at all, apparently the hotel must block most of the sound from the runways. We stayed poolside for a couple hours, it was really relaxing. The next morning the bellhop showed up as promised and took us to the airline check-in counter. After looking at the long line, he said "I'm taking you outside to curbside check-in, these guys will get us in faster", and we were checked in 2 minutes. Another example of going the extra mile. In closing I just can't say enough good things about the Hyatt Airport, it was so much more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to start or finish a vacation in Florida”
Reviews.Author: rygazz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times on trips to Florida and I consider it a great place to spend one night at the start or end of a holiday, especially after a long flight from the UK. Avoid the long lines for car rental as you can pick up your bags and be in the hotel in a few minutes. (It is inside the airport concourse) . Spend time by the pool or eat at Mcoys the excellent restaurant on the same floor as reception, before falling into bed. Rooms are great and the beds very comfortable. You can people watch with an inside view or plane watch with an outside view. (If you get your timing right you can save a days car rental and put it towards the cost of this hotel). If travelling from the UK you will wake early anyway and you can then pick up the car. Pool is fine and there is also a small but very well equipped fitness centre which is far better than most hotels offer. UK visitors can get the best price direct with Virgin Holidays £80 to £94.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but very loud, you won't be able to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Poodles65
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline ($90) last minute. Rooms are small but nicely appointed. Had a decent size balcony but no furniture so I took the desk chair out and sat outside. The noise of being at the airport and right across from the parkade was not the problem. The problem was the thin walls. I had an early flight and went to bed early. Between families with their kids running up and down the hallway to a group of women next door deciding to have a party between 2:00 and 3:30 am - after which they left to catch a plane I guess, I did not sleep. Even after I called the front desk to have security come up there, right after he left, they started up again but this time on their balcony, so they must have kept up other guests. I asked front desk for earplugs and they were out....an airport hotel and no earplugs... Anyways, I was only there for 12 hours, left too early to have breakfast so I didn't get a chance to eat at their restaurant, but it looked nice, large windows overlooking the runway. Very convenient location, I had already checked in the day before and had my boarding passes so I took the tram to Terminal A (Terminal B is right at the hotel) and within minutes of leaving my room, I was going through security. Staff was very pleasant, it's just too bad about the thin walls, as thicker walls would have absorbed the noise of the inconsiderate families and drunken guests who don't know how to behave in a hotel after 11:00pm.....

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Rush Back”
Reviews.Author: Terriv
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a typical overpriced Hyatt but located at the airport, literally. I could look out my door and see the security lines. I started to feel like Tom Hanks in the movie "Terminal" as I was "stuck" inside the airport with noplace to go but to walk around the airport terminal. If you are staying for business and don't have a rental car and are trying to cut travel costs, try to get a room with an outside balcony or your only options for heading outdoors will be the pool area, parking garage or airport exit. I felt that I inhaled my share of fumes in a few days to last a lifetime. Smelling jet fuel outside on the balcony and by the pool was not what I expected. The concierge told me that it would be a $80 cab fare RT to go to Universal Citywalk or Downtown Disney so I stayed at the hotel. One can take the bus to the FL Mall for $4 RT. On the plus side, the food we were served for breakfast, lunch and dinner during the meetings was some of the best hotel meeting food I have eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For an early Flight Out”
Reviews.Author: newstarr
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at Disney and I didn't want to get up at 2:30am to catch a 6:30am flight using magical express. We decided to rent a car for our last day and check out the Kennedy Center, then head to the airport where we could get a wonderful room, dinner at our favorite fast food place (Chic Fil A), repack all of our much needed mouse ears to fit on the plane, and get a great nights sleep before flying out in the morning. The Fountain in the airport lobby covered any other noise you might hear from the balcony facing the lobby (the kids loved this!). The pool was wonderful, the kids found it perfect and towels fluffy. They loved the birds inside next to the pool. The staff was friendly and helpful. I actually saw a man cleaning the vents in the empty rooms, I thought this was great. I love knowing I'm not breathing dust or mold. It was the perfect ending to a magical vacation. I don't care what they charge, if I can get 3 more hours of sleep, I'm willing to pay every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport stop over”
Reviews.Author: Horace_in_Dids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final evening of our honeymoon (which happened to be the night before Thanksgiving 2008). Due to the holiday, the hotel was very quiet, but our room was fantastic with large sitting area (2 sofas + coffee table), and oversized bathroom (2 showers). Rather than go to the resturant to eat we ordered room service which was with us within 20 minutes - the food was very good (although I seem to remember that we were a little annoyed at the 20% serv ice charge PLUS something like 15% delivery charge). On the next day our flight was not until 5.30pm, at 11.00am I went to reception to ask if we could have a late check out - the receptionist asked what time we would like and I asked for 3.00pm - she said that it would normally only be 2.00pm but as they were not busy 3 would be fine - we finally checked out around 4ish and there was no problem. TIP - if travelling through Orlando, and you have to await a connection - go to the Hyatt, sit in the VAST reception area in nice comfy chairs, order a tray of coffee (just a few $'s) and read the free newspapers - or watch the TV. Definatley better than sitting on the hard plastic chairs in the actual airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience Rules”
Reviews.Author: Plainyogurt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to a Disney Cruise. Our group had a total of 3 rooms. The floor was being renovated (new carpeting), but the rooms were very nice. We booked this room via Hotwire, and got a great rate - I would not feel the same way if I had paid over $200 ! Kids loved the pool area, with a view of the runway. So convenient to check in after a late night flight - would stay again if I could get the cheap rate !

Reviews.Title: “refreshingly wonderful after 3 busy days traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: LindaAnnDavidRoy
Reviews.Content: An oasis of sorts for me as I was winding down from 3 days of business and someone who is NOT used to traveling without my husband. Felt safe here, and could finally get some decent wifi. Wish the USA and the world had more hotels in airports!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location If You Need To Be "At" The Airport”
Reviews.Author: truconosur
Reviews.Content: The convenience of this hotel when you need to be "at" the airport simply cannot be beat! This Hyatt is literally "in" the airport. Furthermore, the staff is so well trained to deal with the air traveler. We checked in the night before an early flight and the staff was ready to assist us in everyway from making sure we got up on time to the bell service taking us all the way to the airline counter and helping us check in. It was unbelievable service, really! Plus...the rooms are very nicely remodeled in lovely materials and colors...very soothing. Comfortable beds and work area. Ask for an "outside" room if you want to watch the planes take off, land and taxi around. The insulation must be pretty good, too, because you do not hear the air traffic like you would expect. However, do not get a room on level 6 on the corridor leading to the pool...too much foot traffic outside your front door. Plenty of food options, both in the hotel and in the actual airport food court. Very nice workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: marandbrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after returning from a cruise out of Port Canaveral and had an early flight out the following day. This hotel is so great bacause it's located right in the MCO airport so no shuttle to worry about and the Bell-hop took our bags right to the check in counter in the airport and put them on the belt for us...never had to left a finger. We were able to get a good nights sleep for the early flight because not only are the beds and pillows heavenly, it was nice and quiet as well(never knew we were right next to the runway) The concierge was really helpful and even printed our boarding passes for us. To get a bit of a price break, ask for AAA discount or similar. Will worth a stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhvdragon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly excellent. The location is perfect if you are flying in or out of Orlando. The front desk staff was extremely professional and helpful throughout my stay. The room was wonderfully appointed- especially for an airport hotel. The restaurant on the ninth floor was terrific and the service was beyond compare. The only negative I experienced is that the doors and walls are very thin and that is a definate downside to a property where people are checking in and out at all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: bundy316
Reviews.Content: A lot of reviews say the location is worth the price...but I would say the service is fantastic... We arrived at 2am from a delayed flight, check-in took only 2 minutes, was advised if anything was wrong to contact the desk directly...we had made a request to remove all feather products and that was done. Bell staff brought all bags directly into room...a blessing after sitting in a jet for 5 hours... Checked out in AM, Bell staff again, took all our bags down to the shuttle stop on baggage level, I would consider this a long way out the way from registration desk... Stayed there the night before an earlier flight, again, quick check-in, Bell staff again attentive, and took a nice swim in the pool before retiring to room. Bell Staff arranged to wake-up and pick-up bags at 5:45am...took us down to our Air Canada Check-in point and waited until we got our boarding passes...
