This is the type of extra service I love to tip for... From start to finish, we felt comfortable and well looked after...Thanks to The Hyatt for a fantastic start and finish to our holiday...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!Outstanding Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: relax808
Reviews.Content: You want a great hotel you found it! Speedy check in, great bell service, so easy to get to your flight. Bed was so comfortable, bedding was clean and neat. Security was good. This place is a winner! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “More than a 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: fliptalian
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful in getting us checked into our rooms (we stayed here with a group of 8 people on New Years Eve). The hotel gym and pool area were clean and more than accommodating with terrific gym equipment and a heated pool area on the rooftop. We were highly impressed with the quick service whether we ordered room service, asked for more towels, or needed any other additional items. The location of this hotel is inside the airport yet wasn't noisy at all and offered great variety of restaurants and shopping inside the airport lobby. It was a perk! The only downfall to staying at this hotel was paying $12/day for parking (able to come and go as we pleased though). Although we didn't dine at either of the hotel restaurants, both of their menus looked wonderful with a wide variety of items to choose from at an affordable price. Both restaurants were open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel to visitors who are traveling, wanting to have a romantic getaway, or even going away with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an early morning flight!”
Reviews.Author: simonpoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a trip to Universal since we had an early morning flight. Our room was large with a balcony, two sinks, and had been updated with new tile in the bathroom and a calming decor. We had dinner in the airport, did a little shopping, and not dealing with the rental car, etc. first thing in the morning made for a nice end to our vacation. Front desk people and housekeeping I thought were exceptionally nice. The pool was very attractive and somewhat warm.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great!”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and 1 child stayed coming and going from airport. Booked on hotwire for $84.00 one night and $74.00 the other night This was a great hotel for a late night arrival and early morning flight. The rooms are a good size and we rceived 2 double beds non-smoking in a quiet area of the hotel. The room was away from the airport terminal. Only real problem here is noise from other quests arriving at all hours of the night and day, but I did ex;pect this due to the nature of the hotel. Overall had a good stay both times and hotel staff very friendly. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre FD staff”
Reviews.Author: MissTLI
Reviews.Content: This is the second night staying here. In our room, we have a running bathtub tap and toilet. We didn't report this to the hotel because that is tolerable. But what just happened tonight aggravates me so much I decided to write this review. First night upon C/I, everything was ok. FD staff was friendly and professional. However, tonight we are very disappointed in FD staff (1 guy and 1 girl). We were patiently waiting in line next to that center statue, but when the man became available, 2 European guests cut in line and the guy said nothing neither did nothing. Same thing happened again while the girl became available, a family of 6 just cut in line to do something about their room key!! This time, it is HER to let them cut in line because she knows them. What is wrong with these people!! Believe me they did SEE us standing there because behind us there were other guests waiting too. Unbelievable!!! So I guess if you want to get better service, you are better be European or BFF with them!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Carri45
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt costumer service was great! Traveling with my disabled mother and my daughter I was stuck at the airport do to weather with an eventually canceled flight. The Hyatt held my room from 3 pm till 11 pm with no cost if our flight went through. I was able to us the complimentary computer to rebook our flight. After a late check out Jose took our bags directly to our departure counter and helped us check in. The price was a little above my budget but the comfort and service was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay. This hotel is a gem in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: mariadbd
Reviews.Content: In the 10 years I have been using this hotel when leaving/coming into Orlando, I have NEVER yet had a bad stay. Rooms are clean, staff are attentive and professional. The casual restaurant (McCoy's) has great food, decent wine, reasonably priced. It also has a sushi bar which is surprisingly good. I always feel that Florida lacks decent sushi so it was a lovely surprise when McCoy's brought good sushi in to the mix! Some people don't like the hotel being in the airport terminal. Me? I love it! Get off a flight late and you can be in bed 5 minutes later! Early flight out? Don't fight the traffic with everyone else. Our children love the rooftop pool. There is poolside service and they love watching the planes take off. As one of them said 'ah, this is the life'! When you are 4 - it's the perfect combination! Try to stay over looking the runway. It actually is far quieter than the rooms overlooking the terminal. The elevators will only take non-residents as far as the lobby. After that, the higher floors are by key card so the hotel itself is quiet and pleasant. Always clean. The hotel (I understand) is in the middle of a renovation - so this little gem in the rough of overpriced and underquality Orlando hotels should be even better when the renovations are done. If you want a resort hotel - obviously this is not it - but you will do far worse!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: roger39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually part of the main terminal building.Pick up your luggage and there you are. Could not be easier. The building is a bit like a modern prison with long concrete walled galleries and rooms opening off them.Pleasant reception hall and helpful enough staff. Our room was a good size.We had 2 queen beds, a table and chairs and a large balcony overlooking the car park which would have easily seated six.But the carpet held a large stain and the box like TV was from another era. The bathroom was dark, adequate rather than marvellous , a bit old and dated with the towels a little threadbare. It was all perfectly adequate- if a little pricey for what it was. But it is of course the location you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for a late arrival!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the night we arrived into Orlando. Our flight arrived at midnight and we knew this would be the perfect hotel for such a late arrival. Checkin was smooth and staff very friendly. Checkin was on floor 4 and the elevator required a key for security. We stayed on floor 9. The room was very nice and spacious and oh were the beds comfy!! We didnt have any issues with noise whatsoever. The bathroom was large and pretty. The towels were very soft and plush....most hotels dont have big soft towels and when they do, I rave about it!!! If we were ever doing a late night arrival, we would definitely stay at this hotel again!! Upon checkout we were off to to Port Canaveral for the DisneyCruise.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for early morning / late evening flights”
Reviews.Author: trajectory
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you are catching an early morning flight and are from out of town. It is located directly inside the airport, so no shuttle needed to get to the gate. Qualitywise, you can expect the usual standard that Hyatt offers. A minor negative point was noise from the terminal area, because this particular room was inward-facing. Also, room rates were very cheap, when booked with priceline. Note: The tripadvisor description is incorrect and misleading, it is not a motel, and the rooms are not exactly soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a one night stay, especially if arriving late into Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ewrpex87
Reviews.Content: We take our two young kids down to Orlando from NJ fairly often. We'll typically arrive on a flight that gets in after 11 p.m. With the occassional - though occassionally frequent - delays, we typically wouldn't arrive at our WDW hotel until 1:00 a.m. or later. On a trip last summer our flight wasn't scheduled to arrive until close to midnight. Rather then pay the $600+ a night for the Polynesian, we decided to give this a try at 1/3rd the price for that first night. It worked out great. We had our bags and were in our room within 20 minutes of landing. The next morning I picked up our car and drove it around to the hotels loading area at the hotel. Far easier then trying to wake the kids up at the Disney hotel and fumble with our bags at 1 or 2 in the morning. We like to be in Orlando at the start of the morning and this hotel provides a really easy option for getting in the night before without the hassle of getting the car, loading the bags, and driving the 25 minutes to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “great for one night”
Reviews.Author: azredhead
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family the night before a very early flight. Airport is recommending arriving 2 hours before flight time, so actually staying at the airport was a plus for us with a 7 am flight. Pluses: - convenience for early or late flight - our rental car shuttle dropped us at the hotel instead of at the general airport - 24-hour room service (we got pizza and a great fruit plate) - nice, attractive room - smoke-free room, as promised (with smoke detectors on balcony) - our room had a balcony overlooking the terminal, and no airplane noise - fitness center, in-room coffee, etc. - spacious room Minuses: - some terminal noise: not enough to wake me up or keep me up, but I did here some when I woke for other reasons in the middle of the night - not good for a vacation base (we stayed at a Disney value resort, in a much smaller room, for that part of our vacation) Would definitely stay here again in a similar situation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Talaga_LA
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night here on business travel prior to my early morning flight in November 2008. This is a very nice airport hotel. The lobby is open and inviting. There are loads of chairs and tables to sit at and watch the game on TV while having a drink or bite to eat. Plus the airport has free wireless internet that is available in the lobby and general areas of the hotel. This was a plus since the hotel charges for internet access in the rooms. The lobby also had a computer so you could check-in for your flight and print out your boarding pass. My room was a long distance away from the lobby, so there was a looonnnngggg walk to get to my room. However, I was quite pleasantly surprised when I walked into my room. It was very nicely furnished (king bed with excellent linens, work desk/chair, reading chair/ottoman, 27" TV, small mini-fridge, alarm clock) and had a balconey overlooking the airport terminal below. It was fun to watch the masses scurrying through security far below. The bath was also very nicely done with high-quality furnishings, thick/absorbant towels, and nice personal products. Overall, I was very pleased with the Hyatt. It is a very comfortable hotel for a short stay while waiting for your flight. I will definitely stay here again whenever in need while flying through the Orlando airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a night”
Reviews.Author: frank3355
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is the only hotel I know of that isn't at the airport, it is literally in the airport. It is really cool to stay here and look out your window to see all the people running around to catch their flights. And additionally, it is a really nice hotel, equal in quality to a standard Hyatt anywhere. Maybe even a little higher than average. Obviously the location isn't quite right for an extended Orlando vacation. Just the price of parking makes that true. But how we use it is for the last night of our vacation to make catching our flight the next morning easier. We return the car, check into our room, and enjoy the pool before getting a very relaxing night sleep followed by the most stress free way to catch a flight the next morning. This is how I would recommend using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katladyunc
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Hyatt while visiting Disney and were very pleased with the location and service. The hotel is located right inside the MCO airport and we did not hear the sound of planes or other external noise. The rooms are nicely decorated with the modern Hyatt amenities and the beds are very comfortable. The staff if very professional and helped make our stay a comfortable one.The downside was the price of parking and found it to be a bit steep. The location inside the terminal made it a very convenient hotel for an early morning flight and we highly recommend this hotel for business travelers. You really cannot get any closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice- If you want to live in an airport”
Reviews.Author: v111pilot
Reviews.Content: Very convenient as you are IN the airport. The room was very nice, updated, clean, with a roomy bathroom. Having said that; you ARE at the airport, that means airport food airport NOISE (from the terminal area), and you are miles from anything without a car or taking a shuttle. As I travel allot for work, the last place I want to be is at the airport. But, if you have an early flight, it is nice to be right there.

Reviews.Title: “the best airport hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: If you have an early morning flight out of Orlando, this hotel can't be beat. On so many levels -- decor, convenience, comfort -- it is probably the best airport hotel in the world. That said, would I want to "live" at the airport during an extended stay in Orlando? No. That's why it works best as a one night convenience stop. The hotel is often available on priceline for low rates as a 3 star. I paid only $45, but that was probably a very slow night. Even if you have to pay a bit more, it's worth bidding on priceline for the airport zone, and keep your fingers crossed that you get this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: FORGATOR
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Hyatt MCO the night before I am flying. This Hyatt is about as good as it gets. Convenient to airport terminal, very comfortable and a fantastic staff. On my last stay the young lady who checked me in re figured my rate to save me money on valet parking. If you need a bellman to check you in on your flight, ask for Jose. He is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: threefacesofeveplumb
Reviews.Content: Got this beauty for $69 rate at Priceline. (wish all my Priceline bids were this great) Room overlooked runway - kids LOVED that. Not noisy for us at all. Hotel was amazing and staff including valets were hilarious. Fresh fruit at the desk every day - pears, apples. Nice touch. Kids loved going to the desk 2x a day. Parking was a little confusing, but it is free if you do it right! Don't forget to have your ticket validated at the desk before leaving or you will PAY. Great room - bathroom however was designed by a man - no doubt. Very impractical - good luck turning on the shower, toilet roll is "cute" but falls off when you tear the paper. Retractible cord on hairdryer is a nuisance, little bitty "artsy" shelves, stuff falls off. It was funny really. Loved the decor though.

Reviews.Title: “Started holiday in style”
Reviews.Author: MrOwb
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hyatt because we had a late arriving flight from the UK. We had booked two adjoining rooms and were initially upset to discover that the rooms were on different floors. However that was soon rectified by the pleasant, very efficient reception staff and were taken up to our rooms by a very personable young man (named Danny) who could not do enough for us, shoowing us how the deviding doors opened to make our two rooms into a mini suite! Our rooms overlooked the airport concourse which is the cool picture most see on the website. Altough late we tried McCoys Bar & Grill to get a snack before retiring. Again the staff were friendly and helpfull. We had club chicken sandwiches and burgers which were served quickly and were delicious (although that was probaly because we had just had airline food). After a comfortable night we decided to try the Hemisphere room for breakfast. At $80 for five for the breakfast buffet it is not expensive and is well worth the price. Agan the staff were friendly and chatted with us whilst making sure we had everything we needed. I must say we filled up with the breakfast buffet and really ate alot. Everything looked good so we tried everything! We checked out (again friendly and efficient) and started our holiday rested and well fed instead of tired and hassled from the journey. Well worth the additional expense on our holiday budget.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 13 night here and I would love to go back.”
Reviews.Author: KaosK
Reviews.Content: I attended training in the Orlando area and my companies travel agent put me up at this Orlando Airport Hyatt. I spent 13 days at the hotel and I was treated wonderfully. My family joined me for 6 days of the stay and the staff was great with my children. Both of the hotel's restraunts were good too. (If you want chain food you have the whole laundry list of airport food, a Chilis and a Macaroni Grill.) We are going back to Orlando this fall and we are staying at a timeshare. We are arriving 1 day before the time share is available and we are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: libngeorge
Reviews.Content: During a stop at the Orlando airport last year, I first saw the Hyatt Regency in the main terminal, and thought "how cool!". This summer, our son was traveling to visit friends and was flying out of, and back into, Orlando...so, hey...here's my chance! I was pleased with the rate I got on their website (AAA special, breakfast included). On the first trip it was just my son and myself (female) so I opted for the valet parking. Very easy, relatively inexpensive (since I would have to pay for airport parking anyway). They sent the bags straight up to my room; and oh, what a room! We asked for an outside room so we could watch the plans, and we ended up on the ninth floor...awesome! My son is a pilot-in-training, so he was happy to sit and watch. The room itself was nicely sized, very clean and exceptionally comfortable. I took some time to lay out poolside; it's a beautiful area, and the whirlpool jets are built into the wall at the shallow end Nice! The simplicity of taking him downstairs the next day for his flight, then back upstairs to check out and leave...no stress at all. The staff couldn't do enough to help me with my questions. Based on this, we chose to stay here again when my son was due on his return flight, and this time the rest of the family joined me (husband and younger son). The room was big enough we weren't tripping over each other...and they actually gave us the same room! Oh, have I mentioned the fitness center? The absolute BEST I have ever experienced....no doubt about it. As we were departing, I noticed their advertisement for 'day rooms'...so, if you have a very long wait for a plane in Orlando, I would strongly recommend this option (it beats the heck out of sitting around the concourse) Well worth the money...I can strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: joy527
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times. I have spent the night on two occasions and also got a day day on another occasion. The front desk staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are average sized, but not small. The bed is very comfortable. The services offered at the hotel are wonderful. You can print your boarding passes from the lobby. They also have a dedicated channel in the room with flight arrivals and departures. I have always asked for an exterior balcony room and the balconies are very spacious while looking at the runway. I didn't notice any noise while sleeping or in the morning. If you ask for an interior room, it overlooks the airport terminal which is a beautiful open atrium. I did eat at both restaurants and enjoyed them both.! If you aren't willing to pay the prices for their restaurants, there are plenty of places to eat in the airport. I had my young daughter with me a couple of times and she enjoyed it. We didn't go to the pool, but it looked very clean and small, but perfect for anyone. The children may get bored at the hotel other than the pool, but there is a lot of shopping in the airport and an arcade. I would recommend this to anyone with an early flight, a long layover or just a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: damommyross
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for one night to catch an early morning flight. I got such a great rate for the room I was a bit apprehensive. The hotel is literally in the airport so Gates 60-100 are one floor below and there's a plaza that's visible to most of the rooms. Let me say, I was not disappointed! The accomodations were comfortable and very well furnished though extremely cozy. The bathroom was very clean, no chips in the granite countertops, nothing discolored. After our last hurrah in Orlando, my family showered and collapsed into bed without any complaints or incidents. There was a small balcony, but I'm afraid of heights so I didn't spend much time there. it overlooked that plaza I referred to earlier. We checked in using a kiosk as we had already prepaid for our room. This process was quite efficient and I do recommend it. Beware though--don't select a room away from the elevators unless you're prepared to do a lot of walking potentially lugging heavy (and multiple) bags. It's a huge circle and the only elevators are in the center of the left hallway. They also had a computer where we were able to check in for our flight and print our boarding passes without incurring an extra charge. That was quite neat. We had an 8AM flight and headed for the lobby to check out around 6:30AM. We had to go to the airport desk to check our bags which was a hassle but after we checked our bags we went through security and were at the gate at 7:15AM. Before we could get comfortable in the waiting area, it was time to board the plane to go home. I'd gladly pay to stay here again as I had a great experience and it was super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the airport”
Reviews.Author: CAROLE3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the terminal of the airport but despite that there was no noise from planes or the terminal. Very helpful staff from the bell-boy to the concierge. Internet access to check in on-line easy to access. Beds comfortable and the room very clean and adequate for an overnight stay before flying out. It was easy to get down the elevator and into the terminal building. Car parking a little confusing as it is right in the middle of the airport, so watch the signs carefully. We had room service which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: JoeFal
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Nice rooms. There was even a Prom in the hotel one night, and we were never bothered. Good location to get around .

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelissaTA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent and is by far the best airport hotel you could choose in Orlando. We arrived very, very late at night and the hotel front desk was still very much available and at service. Since it is right in the airport terminal, the location was very easy to get to. Our room was exquisite, the windows overlooked the runways and yet it was completely soundproof. Of all of the hotels I have stayed in, the room was huge, and the king bed was excellent as all Hyatt beds are. In the morning, breakfast at Hemispheres was included in our package. The servers were top notch and very professional, the buffet was also a great value. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I am in need of an airport hotel in Orlando, I would not consider staying elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: zggb0b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an overnight stop on our way to Nashville from London. It was absolutely perfect for our needs after a long flight. We were given a room on the outside on the 7th floor which overlooked the runways and we had a great view of the aircraft landing and taking off, from the balcony. The room had complimentary cable Internet access and a room safe. The beds were extremely comfortable. I have never seen so many pillows on a bed before! We had no problem sleeping and didn’t hear any aircraft noise. We didn’t use any of the facilities at the hotel, instead we went into the airport concourse (which has a fantastic layout) for our meals etc. I had read in previous reviews that it was pricey in the hotel, so didn’t even consider any hotel “extras”. Definitely recommended for a stopover, and the airport itself has some excellent facilities, although you do pay a premium on the booking price for the hotel simply because of its prime location, but we thought it was worth the money for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: atlaffinity
Reviews.Content: my review is based on getting this hotel for $70 on priceline so it may color my opinion. first off: uniformly outstanding and helpful staff. free internet access in the lobby. stunning lobby and courtyard enveloping the airport's A terminal. wonderful beds and huge rooms. zero complaints with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience great way to be sure you catch your flight”
Reviews.Author: OCALAFLORIDATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our way to Maui, HI. We got there in early afternoon and aside from the valet being a bit on the snooty side to hold the car for an hour while we got settled in, the check in process was quick and easy. After about an hour I went and took the car over to the Park and Fly lot and caught the shuttle back. *Recommend if you bring your own car to fly to check out the Park and Fly lot which can't be beat for the price. Although the car was absolutely filthy when I got back. $114.00 compared to $330 is well worth the dirt. The shuttle dropped me off at the turnaround to the hotel. Was back in the room within 5 minutes. Although I wonder why the rooms or the majority of them we've stayed in, in the past have been a hike from the elevators. But heh we needed our excercise anyways. Room service was prompt and the food delicious. Bathrooms were large and the only fault was the lack of plugs to plug in laptops and other charging equipment. I thought noise would be a problem from the concourse below, but you couldn't even tell you were in an airport. I would highly recommend any fellow "locals" to stay here the night before your flight out. It's worth the cost.....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DRU2C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday in Naples Florida. On the outward trip we landed at Orlando and had to stay overnight before driving down to Naples the following day. On checking TA we picked the Hyatt Regency at Orlando Airport as being the most convenient which it certainly was. We collected our cases and the hotel entrance was a short distance away in the terminal building. So it really was a case of leaving the plane and in no time at all we were in our room. The hotel was spotless, our room very clean and we had an excellent view over the airport (which pleased my husband). There was no noise from the airport or adjoining rooms; the staff were very friendly and we would recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great way not to miss your flight!”
Reviews.Author: Tashatart
Reviews.Content: We live in Orlando but had an early Monday morning flight so decided to stay at the Hyatt to avoid travel delays and a very early wake up. The hotel was very nice. The balcony was quite big with a terribly unromantic view of the airport, but clean nonetheless. Orlando has a very nice airport (compared to other locations we have visited) so walking around after dinner the night before helped to build the excitement of the impending trip. I don't recommend McCoy's - hit one of the better airport chains instead (Macaroni Grill, Chilli's, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: McQ2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to an early morning departure. It's a nice enough hotel for that purpose. The check-in/out services are fast, wide variety of rooms, and good dining options. We stayed in an Excecutive King Bed room and the extra sink area outside the main bathroom was handy. The bed was comfortable. They say "soundproof" but our room had a balcony facing outside and we occasionally heard low rumbles of planes although not excessive (and I'm sensitive to that). We liked the casual dining area McCoy's. Nice bar, interesting selection of food and, dare I say, kind of fun. Even if you don't stay at the hotel this is a good alternative from the fast food choices in the terminal. Room service breakfast quality was fine. For all the other consideration they give to speed of check-in and such it was surprising they only gave 30 minute windows, rather than 15, for breakfast delivery on the card you hang out the night before. And, unluckily, ours was delivered near the end of that window so we had to eat quick. This happened even though our wakeup call person told us our food would be early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mountainmary
Reviews.Content: First, I'll say I got a great rate on priceline 2 nights before my arrival. I had a quick one day trip to Orlando and this was perfect. Perfect location, easy in and easy out. Terrfic staff, nice room and I loved the balcony overlooking the planes. I also loved that the airport has stores, resturants etc so you aren't stuck at a typical airport hotel. I had time in the evening so did some shopping and had a nice meal at a restuarnt in the airport. Pool area and gym also excellent. One thing that dirves me crazy is that the rooms are exepnsive and then if you want the bottled water in the room it is $4...come on. Also a charge to use internet in room (if you connect by cable). Luckily Orlando airport has free Wi Fi you can access from the hotel lobby or if you have one of the interior rooms. Come on Hyatt Internet should be free these days!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, pricey food, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: beardogmom
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business seminar at the location so we piggybacked a vacation on the backside. We were traveling with our infant son of 11 months. We had made special requests before arriving via email and they were confirmed at check in and delivered to our room within the hour. (crib, extra towels, pillows). The staff is the most friendly staff I have encountered - from maids to bellman and valet parking attendants - everyone just very freindly and helpful... and amazingly most can speak very good english ( a big deal considering this is Florida!) The pool area was nice and large with some shade areas - the pool was a comfortable temperature and our son loved playing in it.... there were jets in a seated area on the side and he was all over that! The room service, food service was extremely pricey - as expected at a business type hotel - esp. one on location at an airport. It is very quite - as advertised - soundproof - as it is in the AIRPORT - literally; which can be nice if you want to do a little gift shopping or catch a bite to eat at one of the restaurnats. We ate at Chili's one night and is was very reasonable and had great service. The restaurnants inside the hotel were way overpriced so we did not eat there. There is a spa - but, I didn't have the opportunity to use. Parking is at premuim - valet parking $16 a day plus tips! But you can come and go and it is very convenient - esp. with child in stroller - who wants to truck over the parking deck... which is still at a premium of $12 or 13 a day.... Stayed here 2/24 to 2/28 of 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel if you're flying”
Reviews.Author: bizotraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights as part of a business trip and found the process of getting off the plane into my hotel room to be very easy. Simply collect your bags and then follow the signs to the hotel. About a 4 min walk from collecting my bags .nice! Rooms are reasonable. I love the multiple pillows on the bed and the bed was actually very comfortable. I had an room facing on the outside and yes even though they say the rooms are soundproofed, nothing will stop the sound of a 747 landing a few hundred metres away from your window. Better to go for a room on the inside with a view into the terminal. Sushi bar at McCoy's grill is recommended. As are the frozen margarita's. Location is a pain if you intend on travelling anyway by cab. Must have spent about $300 in cab fares going shopping and out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to the Holiday...”
Reviews.Author: ESMSheffield
Reviews.Content: As we were flying into Orlando late on New Year's Eve we chose the Hyatt to avoid the hassle and still get a chance to celebrate. This proved to be a great idea as it was so easy to arrive, pick up the hire car and literally drive out of one side of the carpark and into the other side as the Hyatt is located directly at the airport. The room was beautiful with a fantastic. Huge, comfy bed, lovely bathroom, and cute balcony overlooking a departure lounge which did seem surprisingly quiet (maybe due to New Year). We ate in McCoy's Bar & Grill which was lovely and sipped champagne on oversize settees in the lounge with other guests watching the New Year count down in Times square on the big screen. On the way to our room we wandered past the New Years Eve dinner dance going on in the Hemisphere restaurant which looked brilliant; however after 24 hours of travelling we were ready for bed. We were expecting to be disturbed by the party going on just down the corridor from our room, but as soon as we closed the door we had perfect peace and quiet due to the excellent soundproofing. I would sincerely recommend this hotel after a long flight prior to travelling around Florida, or on the way home to round off the holiday in a relaxed way and avoid the hassle of travelling to the airport/dropping off hire cars before departure.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: leadfoot878
Reviews.Content: I hate spending to much for hotel rooms but this one was worth every penny. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and was close to everything. I would love to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ! very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: gadheri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on new years eve due to our flight being cancelled. Got a room on the 10th floor facing the inside of the airport. Room was spacious and very clean. check-in was quick and professional. If you're looking for a hotel near the airport then this is definitely worth it. Got a AAA rate of $150 including breakfast for two. In fact the front desk was so nice as to give us an extra b/fast coupon for my children. Very safe location and didn't have to go far to catch our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Brhodes
Reviews.Content: I had a delayed flight and I was happy Priceline put me here! A very nice hotel, perfecto for catching that early flight! Only $109 on priceline.com name your bid.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and nice”
Reviews.Author: KirkHarrod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on Xmas eve at a AAA rate of $150/night. Very convenient, clean and safe. The pool on the rooftop is beautiful! Bathroom was huge. I recommend taking a room overlooking the inside of the airport. The balconies there are carpeted and nice. The balconies facing out don't have much to look at other than traffic circling the airport parking lot. Also, it is very loud if you are facing the outside. There are plenty of places to eat in the airport food court. I did hear airport terminal announcements until I turned the air conditioner fan on. In the morning, we got up, checked our luggage and went through security. It was very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: bluewater01
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I stayed for a couple of days with my boyfriend and planned on visiting International Drive and Universal Studios. We realized later that we should have stayed at a hotel near the attractions when we arrived. We ended up having to rent a car the first day and since car rentals were so expensive when we stayed, (before New Years) we ended up paying for a shuttle the next day. We could have saved a lot of money, however the hotel was very nice. The bathrooms were recently updated with a tub and walk-in shower. There are also many places to choose from when getting something to eat as you are right above the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NJOYNC2CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Orlando Airport for one night on a business trip. The location is excellent and very easy to get to since it is in the airport. I used the workroom room during my stay and it was excellent! TV's inside every piece of exercise equipment. Cool towels in a mini frig for after workout was a nice touch. The hotel staff was wonderful as they all spoke to you by name. Only downside was the $16 valet charge to park the rental car, BUT I didn't mind it because of the great service. I wish I had ate at the hotel, but I thought "going out" would be better. Not on a Sunday night. :( I appreciate the security feature of requiring the use of the room key to get on the elevator. Even though some guests didn't get it, I thought it was needed in an airport with so many people coming and going. Overall grade - A.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!! Wish we had stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: TGrl
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and were thrilled that we ended up at the Hyatt at MCO. I would have gladly paid rack rate for the experience we had but luckily we paid much less through hotwire. After a delayed/change of flights we didn't stress at all about our luggage knowing we were staying right "on property". My husband easily retrieved our baggage in the middle of the night from baggage claim without any frustration after a miserable experience with United airlines, all he had to do was take the elevator downstairs after seeing the flight with our bags come in on the TV monitor in our room. The front desk agent was pleasant and ready for our arrival! It only took 2 minutes to check in, refreshing! We enjoyed a yummy meal and drinks in the lobby bar/restauarant after our arrival. The room was clean and very comfortable. We took a quick swim in the pool before heading down to the terminal to meet our family arriving the next morning, something we wouldn't have had time to enjoy if we weren't staying right at the airport. We loved this hotel, the staff and the amenities!! Thanks Hyatt for a great experience, you totally set the tone for our 4 day trip to Disney World!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dana-Mama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt Orlando Airport for 1 night prior to our return flight. The hotel is very posh and convenient to flying out in the morning. When we arrived at the hotel the check in line was very long due to Disney Cruiser's arriving for their cruise next day. We checkin using the self check in kiosk and was assigned the 10th floor. The beds were comfortable and we were able to watch the planes take off and land from our room balcony. We got up early in the morning, checkin our lugguage with United prior to morning rush. Had a leisurely breakfast in the food court and went back to our room to check out and pick up our carryons 45 minutes prior to our plane took off. This worked out really well and shortened our time waiting in the airport terminal. This was our second stay in this hotel and we will defintely return if our travel plans involves the Orlando airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeingtheworld
Reviews.Content: I flew into Orlando for wedding and it was great to stay here for that purpose. Luckily, the reception was held at this hotel, too. Check-in was awesome. I had only 30 minutes by the time my flight landed to catch the bus to the church. Everyone was really organized and efficient. Although I didn't spend that much time at the hotel, it is pretty good for an airport hotel. Bed was comfortable, and the room was neat and clean. It was totally convenient to just get up in the morning and then check in for your flight. It doesn't seem like you are staying at the airport, which is great. The only giveaway is when you look outside and see the cool jumbo jets. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: morningdew4
Reviews.Content: After missing our flight home, my family and I ended up staying at the Hyatt in the Orlando Airport because of its super-convenient location. Without having a reservation, we were fortunate to be given an upgraded room on the tenth (top) floor that overlooked the departure lounge/main area of the airport. We found the staff to be very friendly & personable, and the check-in process was extremely easy & fast. Our room was large, clean, well-appointed and had a unique view. Even though our room was only a few hundred feet from jet airplanes taking off/landing, our room and the throughout the hotel was very quiet and peaceful. The pool was also very unique in that it was on the rooftop of the airport/hotel and it overlooked the runway. Everything about our unexpected overnight stay was excellent, and the price was quite reasonable, especially given the luxury of the hotel and not having a reservation. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sipple
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Hyatts and this is by far the nicest one. Had to stay in Orlando on business for 3 nights and decided to stay at the Hyatt due to a special corporate rate. This hotel provided everything I could have wanted and the rooms were very clean, modern, comfortable and stylish. For a business traveler this hotel is an absolute winner. I would not hesitate to recommend it. This felt like a true and worthy 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: PixieDustedDisneyFan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt in the airport because we had an evening flight arrival and didn't want to pay to rent a car to drive to stay in Disney for the rest of the week. The Hyatt in the airport is awesome! Our room was huge with high ceilings and a balcony that overlooked the inside of the terminal. The decor was very nice and the bathroom was immaculate. It was very quiet even though it was in an airport terminal. We toured the hotel's public areas, like the resturants and pool and were very impressed. We ate at McCoy's Bar & Grill and it was a comfortable setting and great food. The decor in the public areas was very interesting. It had an Asian theme and was very nice. It was great to visit the airport's main terminal and not feel rushed to get off to a flight. Who knew they had so much to offer in a terminal??? I wish we could have stayed more than one night and we will definatley use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This is an awesome hotel. Check it out!!!”
Reviews.Author: faith333
Reviews.Content: Very, Very Nice Room. Very Nice Staff. A little pricey but worth it. This is an awesome hotel. Check it out. Ellen, Dallas Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Every year for the last 10 yrs cant be wrong”
Reviews.Author: Clubworldfan
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Florida for the last 10 yrs, and always use Orlando as the first point of entry. With 2 children, we decided that this hotel would be an ideal way to relax after the 9hr flight from London. The location is excellent, right in the main terminal area. This year were were in the hotel room 25 mins after landing on our BA flight. This was helped by being in Club World so we got off relatively quickly. The porter service is fantastic, they will collect your luggage for you at the baggage reclaim, and deliver it to your room. They will do the reverse if you are flying out too. The room service is as expensive or cheap as any hotel we have stayed in. The Hyatt Orlando airport charges around $250 per night for a family room, we stayed in the Sofitel at Gatwick Airport the night before we flew from London, and a equivalent room was £270 (almost double the price) We will definately be back next year, love the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Day Room!”
Reviews.Author: AWaysToGo
Reviews.Content: Fresh off a Disney Cruise, we had a whole day to kill as our flight didn't leave until 6:30 p.m. So, we booked a day room at the Orlando Hyatt. What a great idea!! It was $89 from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. (You have to call the property for this rate. The main Hyatt reservation system tried to charge us $109. Or you can just go there) Check in is a breeze with automated machines that spit out your room keys and a receipt. The room was comfortable and luxurious. The balcony faced inside of the airport's main terminal and was fun to watch travelers hurry off. We took naps, showered, had lunch in the airport and relaxed! There is a large bathroom with granite countertops. There was also a coffee pot and a refrigerator. Beds were very comfortable as well. There is also a rooftop pool but it was raining so we didn't use it. We would definitely recommend this hotel when traveling in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location especially for early flights you only have to walk downstairs to check in. Nice rooftop pool, very clean hotel. Convenience at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly okay for a night stop over”
Reviews.Author: FordM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2007 for one night. Flew in from the UK and was travelling down to Sarasota the following day. Perfect location for us as it is actually in the main Terminal. No messing about looking for a hotel or having to go off site. Also worked well as Avis cars are stored on site in the multi storey car park so had a five min walk to the car for the next day. Room was fine, clean and tidy with a reasonable standard of decor. Has an outside pool which was a reasonable size and over looked one of the main runways just in case you are bored. Not to noisy either really. Benefit of being in the terminal is that you can either eat in the hotel restaurant, which we did and it was very good!, or you have the fast food chains two minutes walk away. Down side is that you pay for the convenience, not particularly cheap though at $240 (including taxes) for room only. Would not want to stay here for a week with the family, but great as a stop gap over night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at hotel, but great staff and service to work with.”
Reviews.Author: awhitt99
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hyatt at Orlando Airport in June for one night for the convenience of catching an early flight. When we arrived, there was nobody to help, so I found my own luggage cart, but as I started rolling it away, a bellboy immediately came to help with unloading our luggage. The staff was extremely friendly, and the rooms were beautifully decorated and pristinely clean. If you are into ordering room service, the prices are outrageous, and they charge a delivery fee, plus a 19% gratuity to the bill. Needless to say my friend and I found another place at the airport to eat dinner, so I cannot say if the food was good or not. Problem number one: The rooms were very warm, and even though the thermostat showed 72 degrees, it was mildly uncomfortable. Problem number two: In our room on the tenth floor, the air conditioner made a very loud clanking noise every time it turned on, which was often because the thermostat had to be turned way down to make the room cool. We both through we could sleep through the noise, but after having tried for two hours, the noise was loud enough to keep waking us up. Problem number three: at around one in the morning (I needed to get up at 5:15, and had yet had no sleep due to air conditioner noise) I decided to turn the thermostat back up to keep the air conditioner from running so much. There was also a ceiling fan in the room, and I thought that maybe it was running the wrong direction, and circulating all the cool air up to the ceiling. There was a dimmer switch on the wall for the fan, and when I pushed it to turn it off, something was obviously wrong with the circuitry, and it turned on the fire alarm system in the room, possibly the whole floor. After the initial panic wore off, i tried turning the knob, and the alarm finally turned off. It was embarassing to have caused the alarm, and it woke up people that were on my floor. I then called the front desk to tell them what happened, and they promptly sent someone up to move us to a different room. They then offered a voucher for a free breakfast the next morning, which did me no good because I had to check in my flight before the restaurant even opened. When I returned home, I felt like splurging on the hotel was a complete waste, because with the bad experience I had, it was neither restful nor convenient. After working with the hotel, they gave me a full refund, and were always very pleasant in conversation. Hopefully my experience was a rare occurence, because the hotel did seem like it was very nice, and has gotten excellent reviews before. The staff was exceptionally friendly, and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: djm0810
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we only stayed one night, (Thursday, May 24) to catch an early flight. Lovely room, large, clean, quiet...you could hear the jets taking off but the temp control in the room allowed for the continous running of the fan on high. It seems the 6th floor was the Hyatt Gold Passport floor and was well kept. Very nice pool with patio area to watch the jets coming and going. Great front desk service! If you have the time, there really is excellent shopping in the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “FFFFFFFantastic”
Reviews.Author: T_AEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on April 5th for one night and 20th April for 1 night which included a late check out at 6pm which we had to pay for the whole day. Worth doing but I think the Hyatt could be a little more flexible and not charge the whole rate! After a long day and the joy of queuing ages to get through immigration at orlando Airport, our booking in at the hotel was excellent. We were fotunate to be checked in by the best hotel receptionist in the USA, Angie on both occasions. Quick, friendly efficient and with a good sense of humour. Rooms were excellent as were the facilities, bars and restaurants. A great start and finish to our holiday. We were able to check in our bags at 1pm with Virgin just 100 yards from the hotel, then relaxed until 6pm before leaving for our flight. Tim and Angela Grace

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service at McCoy's”
Reviews.Author: Leigherton
Reviews.Content: My son and I were waiting for our flight to New York City on April 3, 2007 and decided to eat at McCoy's. It didn't start out with a friendly hostess (from Brazil) BUT the EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE given to us by CARLA....helped us enjoy our meal and relax.... Just wanted to let the management of McCoy's know...you have a winner employee in CARLA.... Thank you....

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jayneoliz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and I absolutely love it. The rooms are lovely, not massive but very nicely decorated with enourmous well-lit closets and comfortable beds. Feather pillows are standard but foam are available for the asking. Lighting and electronics in the room are all convenient and quality. The staff at this hotel are top notch, special requests and concerns are dealt with the way we wish that all hotels would deal with such issues. The bathrooms are luxurious and the ammenities are fantastic (that massage bar in both lavendar citrus & white ginger is a DREAM). The food from room service is expensive but generous, quick and delicious. The buffet breakfast is convenient and tasty. I usually opt for the inexpensive ($9) continental rather than the full buffet as it offers yogurt, fresh berries and tropical fruit, and cheese as well as some top-notch baked goods. Their pastry chef is great, some of the best biscuits I've had in any hotel in the USA. Thier coffee is rich and tasty a VERY nice change from many of the unfortunate coffee's I've been served in the US (weak and nastyf... eewwwww) The only issue I've ever had was VERY SLOW breakfast service at McCoys on one occassion. This was dealt with quickly and efficiently by management and the compensation offered was more than adequate to make up for the inconvenience. Definitely give this hotel a try!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Orlando Airport, very nice”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Orlando Airport for a work event for a few days in February. Having stayed at other airport hotels (both for work & by being stranded), the Hyatt Orlando Airport was the nicest, most professional, and best on site airport hotel I have stayed at in the USA. Positives: Upon arriving on a "red-eye" flight from the West Coast, it was a welcome site to see the hotel within the terminal, upon going past security. The Hotel Staff was very pleasant, professional, and most of all accomdiating in having a room available for at 7:00 AM (instead of the standard 4:00 PM checkin). The Hotel is quite large, with 9 floors, some looking over the runway, others over the parking lot towards the city, and others overseeing (making up) the main part of the Orlando (MCO) terminal. All rooms had balconys. The rooms were larger than expected with separate sitting areas, large bath room, and a closet large enough to put a suit case in if needed. One additional perk was an I-Home IPOD Alarm Clock (retail for $99) for MP3 (IPODS), which was nice to be able to dock & listen to music. Wireless worked well throughout the hotel. Rooms sound proofed very well (my room didn't look over the terminal or runway). Shower was large & no problem plumming or hot water. Complementary Sunday Local Paper & USA Today. Hotel food was better than average & not too expensive. Location is great for meetings (meeting spaces/ballrooms were very large and good for both meetings and/or weddings). Staff was professional & courteous. Hotel had valet parking & parking structure outside a door from the lobby. Business center on site. $89 rooms available to people from 6AM to 6PM. Airline Flight board on TV in Lobby & Rooms. Check in for all flights w/boarding passes printable in Lobby. Negatives (not too many): Expensive (over $200 per night for an airport hotel is a bit steep, due to being 10+ miles away from anything in Orlando). Only one guest computer for use (printer didn't work). No Sauna or Whirlpool. The pool overlooks runway (kewl) but definitely not "florida like" being all cement without trees, etc. on the 4th floor over the terminal. Overall, for one night prior to an early flight, great location & way to catch the flight, walk downstairs and go right to checkin and security. Also, great location for a meeting/wedding that has alot of out of town people coming into town for a few days (if they don't need to see anything in Orlando). I would stay there again for Business or a night before a flight. Bob

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Joe_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport is great hotel. Its location, yes, inside the terminal makes it great for travelers. The rooms were clean, and very comfortable, and all had either a view of the center atrium or of the airport. There is a restaurant at the top of the hotel, which we did not try, but it smelled good. It's also close to the food court at the airport. Would stay at again in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and Hyatt standards on target”
Reviews.Author: kikiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a late flight and before heading to the Cruise ship in Port Canaveral. The location is EXCELLENT for travelers in the airport. It's basically right in the middle of the airport - you don't have to leave the building. It's clean, new and what you would expect for a Hyatt. Loved it and I'm a fussy traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YBM
Reviews.Content: This hotel easily equals other "airport terminal" hotels in terms of convenience and cleanliness, but the level of service and comfort here, puts them several notches above. From the Front Desk Clerk who said, "Welcome to the Hyatt", to the Bellman who said, "You're at the Hyatt, you don't have to worry about anything", everyone was true to their word! Sincerely friendly staff. Rooms have pleasant decor. Extremely COMFORTABLE beds. Clean - Quiet - Secure. When our courtesy wake-up call came in at 4AM, we were quite well rested for our 6AM flight.

Reviews.Title: “Small beds but great stay”
Reviews.Author: hackwid
Reviews.Content: The beds are tiny. The queen seems more like a double and the king like a queen. The room was really clean and nicely decorated. The location was great for an early flight. We really enjoyed our stay and the extra touches were great - loved the bathroom soaps. I would highly recommend asking for a room with a balcony facing the planes taking off. You would never know you were in an airport hotel as it was so quiet. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased to get this hotel thru Priceline at $60/night. I requested a room facing the runway, and I got one on the seventh floor with a great view of takeoffs and landings. The room quality was excellent- great bed, free wireless internet (it is actually the airport that provides free wireless internet, but I had no problems with reception), very nice bathroom and toiletries. Parking is $12 with unlimited in/out privileges. Overall, highly recommend the Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: AFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Orlando airport can take some finding, the signs are scarce and only point you in the general direction of the hotel. There’s a large reception area and the front desk staff are very efficient. Our room was large with a mini bar, large foyer area with lots of storage space and a large bathroom with separate bath and shower. However, for reason they chose to put the smallest bed I have ever seen at a Hyatt in the room. The soundproofing in the rooms is very poor and the corridor noise was very obvious during the night. There’s no Regency Club at this property but there’s a great pool area overlooking the airport. The hotel is vast with planted areas and aviaries to keep you amused while you trek to your room. We ate in the Sports Bar which is actually a restaurant with a small bar. The food is OK and the service is very good but we should have probably eaten downstairs in the terminal. The breakfast buffet was uninspiring but OK, once again the service was very good. Although we had breakfast vouchers we were charged tax on the $0 amount – this is something that varies from property to property.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HYATT”
Reviews.Author: mitchadus
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. First and foremost it was CLEAN!!!! I am like Monk and I must say this hotel exceeds all expectations if cleanliness is high on your list! The service is OUTSTANDING! The staff was friendly and professional and attended to ALL of my needs. The food was also excellent, and the service was fast. I stayed in one of the executive suites, it was very spacious and well decorated. I travel often and I WILL stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 9300 Airport Boulevard, Orlando, FL 32827
